description:
In Sf for break on Morgan Hill project. And I had to have my all time favorite Thai Food.  This place is awesome, the spices and herbs are all original Thai cooking. The smell , and taste is awesome, simply awesome.  I've been in Thailand many times and this place authentic , too many places say original Thai but it's far from real Thai cooking. Some are kinda Chinese , Vietnamese or Laotian taste , this one is spot on. 
Little place that is super busy, especially around lunch and dinner time so a little wait but it is worth it .  Clean with good customer service, great Thai owners , large variety of dishes on the menu , good location and authentic!  I will definitely be back and I highly recommend this place to anyone who wants original taste of Thai food.

Really enjoyed this the food.
author: Kevin O.

description:
I think the first time I came here, I wanted to cry because of how long it took for the food to come out.

I was really craving Thai food so the boyfriend and I decided to try it out. Small restaurant with small tables but it smelled amazing. Good sign so far. We waited a while for just menus and waters, but put in our order (three dishes) relatively quickly. Then waited... and waited... and waited. For an hour. I'm honestly not even exaggerating because the entire time, I had one eye on an empty table that was piling up with to-go bags and customers arriving for pick-ups. If they straight up told me that they honored to-go customers more than in-house customers, I would believe it.

Don't get me wrong; the food was great. But worth waiting an hour for? Absolutely not.

As a follow-up though, I did give this another try and placed a Yelp pick-up order a few months later. My wait time? 45 mins. The food? Huge containers. It's totally worth it if you time it right. Just have a snack or two while you wait.
author: Lucy Z.

description:
This is my favorite Thai restaurant in SF! My friend and I came at 6pm on a Thursday w/a reservation, but it wasnt necessary at all. There were still many open tables.However, at around 7pm the place was packed and there was a long queue.

Wait for food: 3 stars
* it took around 40-45 minutes for us to get our food after ordering! And it was the same for other tables too! Very understaffed in the kitchen!

Taste & portion size: 5 stars
* pork laab - very good! Comes with cabbage and shredded carrots - was a bit sweeter than I've ever had it.

* papaya salad -super yummy! But not spicy at all - tip: ask for jalepenos and pepper on the side -the red pepper is extremely spicy!

* green curry - my favorite of the 3 - super thick and heavy with sauce! The bamboos tasted like they just added it at the end tho...

* mango sticky rice - THE BEST MANGO STICKY RICE EVERRR. Omg the sauce is infused in the sticky rice to make the rice soft and just like I remembered how my mom made them. It's the perfect amount of light sweetness

Am so excited to come back to try more dishes!
author: Dee Dee T.

description: I only tried a small handful of items, but I can see why this a favorite local spot. I enjoyed the pad Thai, beef fried rice, Thai Tea, and mango sticky rice orders my party had for dinner. The pad Thai had generous amounts of plump shrimp although the noodles had a slight flavor of coconut. It tasted a bit unusual at first but the flavors all blended together once mixed. My favorite item was the mango sticky rice, which was one of the better versions I've had of this dessert! I'd go back for that alone. There were several unique offerings I would've tried if I were a bit hungrier. I wouldn't make a special trip to eat here, but if I was in the area I'd go back.
author: Edwina D.

description:
This may be my new neighborhood Thai restaurant!

We walked in and ordered chicken pad thai, chicken pad kee mao, and a thai iced tea to-go on Saturday night around 7:30 PM.  The restaurant itself is very intimate and cozy with very limited seating.  I would love to dine in one night.  The food came out fast, so we we quickly made our way home to enjoy dinner. 

Both dishes were so tasty and fresh!  We usually have left overs after dining on Thai food but both containers ended up completely empty.  

PROS: 
- Taste, portions, price are A+
- Fast service
- Lots of appetizing specials, definitely want to check those out

CONS: 
- Not sure if this is normal but I found a handful of tofu in my chicken pad thai.  Not an issue for me since I love tofu (and they cook it very well) but some people may not want it in their dish.
author: Cimma S.

description:
Very small location and very cramped so if you don't have a reservation, it may take a long time to get seated.

We ordered the green curry fried rice and the pad see ew. A bit disappointed with both. The pad see ew felt like the noodles were too stuck on each other instead of more loose. The veggies had very little flavor and the noodles were a bit too sweet. The curry rice was less saucy than expected. Overall, was very underwhelmed with this place.
author: Edmund L.

description:
A local hole in the wall for cheap and good Thai food! Thai Time serves traditional Thai entrees like noodle and rice plates, soups/curries, and delicious appetizers - all under $10 per plate. 

My favorite dishes here are the typical Pad See Ew and Pad Thai noodle entrees. Pad See Ew is a Thai stir-fried noodle dish (similar to chow fun) with a savory and sweet twist. I really enjoy this dish most because it has the perfect balance of noodles, vegetable, and meat ratio. A must get! The Pad Thai (a stir-fried rice noodle plate) is also great for those that love tangy and sweet flavors. This plate can be a hit or miss here because sometimes, it's a little too saucy.

Keep in mind this place is small, so it tends to get crowded during dinner hours. Go early or expect to wait long. Parking is metered around the area, but will be free past 6pm. I usually don't have a problem finding parking here.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Nice little Thai restaurant. We had a late lunch. I got a vegetarian soup with coconut milk and a lot of vegetables. My wife got a lunch special of chicken, eggplant and peppers with rice. 

Food came quickly and was good. I really enjoyed my soup - something I rarely find vegetarian. My wife enjoyed her meal that also came with a small bowl of soup. 

The bill was under $17 before tip. Very reasonable.
author: Marco M.

description: I've only ever gotten takeout from here and I like it! Their noodle dishes are good and not too oily. I wish they included more meat though. Besides that, the portion sizes are pretty good for dinner takeout. Overall, the price is really good for what you get and I would definitely recommend this if you're looking for Thai in the Richmond!
author: Amanda F.

description:
I've been twice now and every dish I have ordered has been good. Whether it's the curry, noodles, rice, or beef salad, all are very tasty and they give you large portions. Located on a side street next to a very busy and restaurant-filled Clement Street, this place is a stand out to me in terms of Thai eateries in SF. Lots of parking in the area although depending on the time of day, you may have to drive around a bit. 

Warning: this place is small. 8 to 9 small tables max so this place is not good for large groups. Expect a long wait during certain times of day/night. They do alot of delivery orders so if you want delivery, you have that option, although if you are eating-in, the wait for food might be a bit longer as a result. Also, you have to walk through the kitchen to get to the bathroom. Not that big of a deal but just a warning for those who didn't expect that (like me).
author: Cicely T.

description:
Food is amazing and the prices are the best in SF!  Usually the restaurants on Clement are all really good and reasonably priced. All of the dishes that we ordered did not disappoint and I can't wait to go back to try more. 

Like many of the restaurants in the area, it's a small spot. There may be 10 tables at most, some seat 4 and some seat 2. It could get crowded later in the night and definitely don't come here if you have a big group. When it's crowded it could be a little wait. There's a small kitchen and one stove so the dishes take a little while to prepare. 

All in all, this will definitely be on my rotation when I'm trying to decide what to have for dinner.
author: Justin Y.

description:
Dear Thai Time, don't skimp the shrimp! I've been coming here for a while now, and the Pad thai with Shrimp consistently comes with only THREE shrimp. With tax and tip it's over $11 for 3 shrimp. I've had food cart food that was more generous for literally a third the price.

That complaint aside, the taste is OK. Their seafood soup is good, would recommend that.
author: Conscious C.

description: Very good authentic Thai food.  Seafood soup was hearty, flavors were perfect.  Red curry and Pad Mee Kow is an excellent.  Like being in grandmas house for Thai.
author: Valerie I.

description:
Great little Thai restaurant, when I saw little I mean little.  You'll most likely have to wait outside for a table.  Food is reasonably priced for a great product.  

LOL, my friends and I laughed because we all had to use the bathroom.  You have to walk past the kitchen where all these huge flames are going on the stove and we laughed if you have long hair, you can possibly singe it.  Haha!  Didn't happen, but it's that small of a space.
author: Michelle M.

description: This place is a small family style restaurant that delivers exceptional service and exemplary food! I ordered the pad Thai with nothing but chicken and added egg. I wish I would've order the pad Thai with the pad see-U noodles, because those are the thick ones. It was a definite yes from me and a for sure "coming back".
author: Keve K.

description:
Amazing Thai Restaurant. The restaurant itself is very small and maybe holds 6-8 tables. Service is very fast and your food comes out hot and fresh. 

We started with the Satay for an appetizer and it was delicious and a generous portion. The restaurant is sort of a family style place where you share with your table. We really enjoyed that.  

Service is prompt and the food is delicious. Everything we had was very good. Can't wait to come back and try more items on the menu. 

Don't forget to ask for the spice rack to add a kick of spicy to your food. 

Parking on Clement St is tricky, so just park a few blocks away in the residential area.
author: Carlos P.

description: The place is cozy. The food was okay at the beginning... Then my girlfriend went to bathroom. While washing her hands she saw that the water in the sink was brown and kept coming in brown color. She waited but the water was still coming dirty. My girlfriend came out and told me to stop eating. She told me about the dirty water. I lost my appetite. We did not finish our dinner... The waitress asked if we wanted to take food to go. We said no. We explained to her that the water was dirty. We paid the bill and left. We don't know if this was used to cook the food.
author: U V.

description:
If you are looking to get in a cheap, delicious Thai Fix, Thai Time should be your go to!

It was my first time here and I came around 5:30 PM on a Thursday. It wasn't crowded at that time, but by the time I finished my meal around 6:30, there were a couple parties out the door. The restaurant itself is pretty small, definitely for smaller parties (2-5ppl) because there was only about 7 tables total. Anyways, service is fast, food is delicious and CHEAP. 

My bf and I ended up getting 3 dishes. Each dish ranged from ~$8 - $10 which is really really good prices for quality food! We got the Thai Tea, Tom Yum Soup,  Tofu Pad Thai, and some type of garlic/basil fried rice = #66 with Pork (I forgot the name of the dish LOL). 

Thai Tea:  It was $2.50. It tasted good, but not sure if I would pay $2.50 all the time for it. I'd rather get boba down the street if you are craving milk tea. 

Tom Yum: I got this dish with chicken, and let me say - THEY GIVE HELLA CHICKEN. The soup tasted average, like any other tom yum soup. I don't think I'll be getting this next time though, because I was so full after eating it and couldn't finish my other stuff. It was flavorful, not spicy, had mushrooms, tomato, and chicken, really basic. But it came in a clay pot and the nice server scooped it into bowls for me so that was kinda cool. 
 
Pad Thai: I liked this dish but it was little too much on the saucy side for me - which is weird because I never had saucy pad thai before. The tofu was yummy and fried and the noodles were a good chewy consistency. I also like how the peanuts were really small - so it had the flavor but not the crunch. The portion size was good for ~$8 that I paid for it. Overall, super flavorful but again the sauce made the consistency kind of slimy and too flavorful. 

Basil Pork Fried Rice: Really tasty!! I loved the flavor and texture of this. It really had strong basil and garlic flavor. The only issue was that the pork tasted a little off - so i just picked it out on the side. It might've been nothing, but still tasted kinda weird to me and I didn't want to take chances. Overall, still good taste and good price.

WILL BE COMING BACK!!!
author: Anna L.

description:
So when is Thai Time anyways? -- ANYTIME. All the food here is really that good, and it's literally open all day every day. 

After trying a slew of Thai restaurants around the SF Bay Area, I find most of them sufficient at satisfying my Pad Thai cravings, but the only ones that really blow me away are Kin Khao (can't argue with the Michelin star), Farmhouse (hipster setting and unique dishes), and Thai Time. While the former two are bouge and expensive, Thai Time's prices are a steal. Lunch specials are ~$7-8, and dinner entrees are ~$9 and under $15.... which in SF gets you artisan avo toast and craft coffee.

Thai Time has the vibe of a local small business, no-frills but clean and well kept. The setting features lots of traditional Thai decor in a cozy space. Note that with ~8 tables inside, the wait can be long. (Came at 9pm on Sunday with the wait nearly an hour; however there was no wait at 6pm on Friday.) 

The menu is huge, including all your Thai food staples in addition a wide selection of unique Thai dishes I haven't seen at other places. Making decisions can be overwhelming; when in doubt, choose from the "Thai Time Favorites" to try their specialties. They also have a specials menu board posted. 

(+++) Angel Wings ($9.20): I've had this before at Cambodian restaurants, and Thai Time's version is definitely among my favorites. Not only are you amazed by the feat of how the wings are deboned (though note some bones at the tips) and stuffed with ground pork, silver noodles, and mushrooms; the delightfully thin panko crust and tangy sweet and sour sauce add nice flairs to create a very appetizing appetizer.

(+++) Hor Mok Talay ($14): Looks great and tastes even better. The sauteed prawns, calamari, scallops, mussels, and crab are submerged in a delicious coconuty red curry sauce, all inside a coconut (!!) You scrape the sides to add more coconut meat to the melange, creating a scrumptious and multi-dimensional dish. Be aware that it's quite filling from all the coconut; that it's incredibly delicious and difficult to stop eating :x

(+++) Green Curry Duck ($11.35): The green curry has the same aromatic coconuty tones, with more depth and savoriness compared to the red curry. We were also impressed by the seemingly endless chunks of meaty, juicy duck slices. 

(++) Ped Yang ($10.75): Same great boneless duck, served another way. Being accustomed to crispy roast duck, the syrupy-saucey version took a bit of getting used to. I grew to like the interesting paradox of such a thick sauce with such light flavor that physically smothered yet subtly augmented the taste of the duck. 

(++) Thai Rib ($10.55): A curry version of galbi. I don't know about the texture of the ribs, which were charboiled to very dry, almost like jerky. It's still quite good considering it's covered in the creamy red curry sauce for balance; just don't be expecting fall-off-the-bone braised ribs.

(++) Pad Sai Roong ($9.70): There's something about the surface area and texture of the thin silver noodles that has a lighter mouthfeel than carby rice noodles, and Thai Time does it just right with a light soy sauce and a bucketload of assorted vegetables and shrimp.

Portions are ginormous, but I suggest ordering more and taking home leftovers so that you can try different dishes. Not only are the portion sizes decently sized; the generous amounts of duck/seafood essentially make all other restaurants in SF look stingy.

Other tips:
*This is totally a raving review, but be careful not to hike up unrealistic expectations only to get disappointed.
*Take-out available. May be most efficient if there's a long wait.
*Thai tea comes with a very artistically (Instagram-worthy) folded straw wrapper.
*We were curious about Thai Crepe and Hod Thai (pan-fried mussels), but it wasn't available on both of our visits. We were bummed, though the server explained that they take a lot of time to prepare so isn't served all the time.
*Parking isn't impossible, just may take some circling around. There's a public lot nearby which charges the same as street meters (free after 6pm and all day Sundays).
*Don't come in a huge group since the space is small. But do consider coming in up to 4, so that you can try more dishes. Note that the tables are compact as well, so eat efficiently to make space for the next round. 

TL;DR: Thai Time is one of those amazing niches that's worth coming back until you try the entire menu. 

Geez, this review makes me sound like a glutton, but Thai Time really is that good.
author: Edna C.

description:
Great price for great food! 

What I've tried:
* Pad see ew w/ chicken
* Pad Thai w/ chicken

Overall thoughts:
* Very affordable compared to other Thai places
* Looks like small plates but very filling each time
* Service is good but varies depending on how busy it is since there is only 1 waitress for 8 tables
* Small restaurant & not really a place for large groups
author: Sarah W.

description:
Popped by on July 4th as not many places were open and we were craving Thai food. We waited around 10 minutes but once we were seated, we waited around 15 minutes to get someone to take our order and another 15 minutes to get some water. It's a tiny place with slow service. 

We ordered the Thai green curry with jasmine rice and a fried rice dish with sour sausage. I really loved the Thai green curry but my friend didn't like the fried rice. He said it was bland so I don't recommend ordering that. I've had better Thai food but it was good so I'll consider coming back if other places are super busy or if I'm in the area.
author: Mira B.

description:
favorite Thai food restaurant in Richmond district! Ever since I found this place, I can't go anywhere else. Its vegetarian pad see-ew is tasty. I also got a Thai iced coffee with my order. Staff was friendly, and I got my food quickly when I ordered takeout. Will definitely be back soon!

(Try their pad Thai or cho-chee tofu! Some of my other favorites)
author: Alex H.

description:
Food:
I thoroughly enjoyed their fried rice as well as their papaya salad. My friends got the pad Thai and pad see ew and said great things as well. Thai time is better than king of Thai and has way better portions than marnee Thai. I love their prices here (dirt cheap) especially for SF! 

Bathroom:
Okay don't wanna be gross but sometimes you have to take a shit at a restaurant. Literally you have to walk through the kitchen to get to the toilet and the refrigerator door had to be moved for me to get in the bathroom. The bathroom was pretty disgusting not gonna lie I wanted to kill myself pooping in there. Super tiny and dirty and steaming hot because it was in the kitchen. 

Parking: 
Typical SF meter or street parking. Trash
author: Justine L.

description: Everything we ate was amazing!! The customer service was great and the waitlist via Yelp was fast and easy!
author: Jessica R.

description:
Cute little Thai place! (literally -- only like 8 tables)

Very reasonable prices, flavorful and fresh food (I had duck green curry and jasmine rice), and kind service.

The only downside might be that there's no waiting area so it might get a little intimate towards the door at peak times. 

I'd totally be a regular if I lived nearby! Looking forward to coming back and trying many more dishes :).
author: Jonny W.

description:
I tried this place because of the good yelp reviews, but my experience was so terrible that I would never spend my money here again. Ordered delivery and my food took nearly 2 HOURS to arrive, and I live in the neighborhood. I asked the delivery driver what took so long and he said "haha, very busy." Really? Past 9PM on a Tuesday night? 

The food itself is just alright. I ordered the Thai time fried rice, pad pak gra pao, and mango sticky rice. Good but not great, and not nearly worth the wait. The fried rice in particular lacked depth of flavor. Would not recommend.
author: Daphne L.

description:
Love love this place, it's a small cute place to get good Thai food in the inner Richmond. Highly recommend. It's great for small groups or take out. 
All the food is tasty I don't think I've gotten anything that I wouldn't recommend. I absolutely love all the veggies and how cute they are cut. Highly recommend the food and Thai tea!!! It's worth the wait if there is one.
author: Veronica V.

description: I asked for beef and they gave me this bland half beef half chicken mix....it's not the best I've ever had. Flavor is lacking and it honestly looks like they just threw whatever leftovers they had in a box and gave it to me. I know I ordered right before they closed but I feel like they could have put a little more effort into making my food. I don't think I'll be coming here again. I'm a little disappointed. When I came to pick up my food it looked like they put a lot more effort into the food they cooked in house but there's hardly any sauce on the noodles and I definitely didn't want chicken so I don't know why they put it in my food.
author: Erin A.

description:
Thai Time is a cute, cozy hole in the wall. The decor is colorful and traditional, making you feel like you're eating in some midwestern grandmother's kitchen. My friend and I went on a Sunday evening around 6 pm and there was no wait. 

The food, while delicious, took forever and a day to come out; I appreciate that a long wait implies that the food was probably freshly made, but waiting a good 30-45 mins for an appetizer and two entrees when the restaurant isn't even that busy kinda sucks if you're not patient (and/or starving). 

We got the angel wings, pad Thai with chicken, green curry with pork, and mango sticky rice. The angel wings were not what I was expecting-it wasn't a sweet/spicy glazed, lightly fried chicken wing, but instead a hodgepodge of mystery meat, glass noodles, and other things in the shape of chicken wings-kind of like meatloaf, but the chicken version. I was not a fan. 1 star. The pad Thai was delicious!!!!!!! Get it! The green curry was also packed with flavor and had a nice kick to it. 4.5 stars for the both of them! Lastly, the mango sticky rice was the perfect end to our meal. 5 stars. Must try, even if you're "full" (don't lie to yourself you ain't full unless you had dessert). 

If you get there anytime after 6/6:30 pm expect to be waiting outside for a good half an hour or more (the restaurant only has a few small tables and is cramped). If you're still not getting the picture, this restaurant is literally the size of a giant shoe box. Or a NY sized living room. Same same, but different. 

This place won't be able to accommodate parties bigger than 6, you should only come with a handful of friends and not a bunch of people, and did I mention this place isn't the best for large groups???
author: Joy K.

description:
I stopped by for lunch and ordered their basil chicken. My new favorite thai food spot in the Richmond. Loved it!
Fast service and portions were good size.
author: Ev C.

description:
Huge fan of Thai Time! I know the service can be slow and even the preparation of a take-out order can be slow, but man is it good!

The beef pad see ew and chicken pad thai here are incredible. Really basic dishes, I know, but I know what I like and I DEFINITELY like these dishes at Thai Time. Loaded with plenty of flavor and toppings on well prepapred noodles, I always finish my meals feeling very satisfied with the food and the price. Especially convenient is their take-out option, which is what I usually opt to do rather than dining in. 

You can call in your order or order using Yelp.

-1 star for slow service, but the food itself and the price keep it up at 4 stars. Highly recommend to any fans of Thai food who are in the Richmond district, but not in a hurry.
author: Phillip V.

description: Who could have known that a little mom and pop restaurant would be the best Thai restaurant I've had in the city? The prices were very reasonable for the amount of food we received. We order the papaya salad for the first time, and it was so refreshing! I've never had anything like that and it certainly opened up my appetite for more delicious food to come! The menu has a big selection, which can be good and bad at the same time lol - we just wanted to order everything!! What was really good in the end was the green curry duck. Sweet coconut tones and just the right amount of spiciness. The duck was tender and juicy, and we couldn't get enough rice to eat with it haha. I've been wanting to come back ever since and hopefully can find the time to make the trip!!
author: Priscilla L.

description:
Thai Time is inexpensive and can kind-a taste like it too.

There is no place to wait for a table inside. Phone in an order to pick up or expect the possibility of waiting outside for some time.

At $9.75 the Pumpkin Curry Talay (we choose green) arrived in a ceramic pot heated below by a blue flame. Fresh or frozen seafood I don't know but nothing was over cooked or rubbery and the pumpkin cubes gave this dish a not so common twist.

At $12.95 we had the Hor Mok Talay. This was a similar Seafood Red Curry served in a coconut.  Again the seafood was very do-able and the coconut meat was easy to scrape off the inside of the coconut, mmm mmm.

With the enormous variety of dishes offered here we will do better to try different selections next time we visit.
author: Caesar A.

description:
New Thai find nestled by the corner of 8th & Clement across from the very packed Halu. I was impressed! My go to has been Marnee Thai for years but this place is quite affordable and is quality food. Ordered the catfish curry and tried the pad see ew. Wasn't too oily like I sometimes find Marnee Thai can be, and both dishes were filling for dinner. Would recommend and plan to come back. However the restaurant is small so I can imagine there can be waits sometimes. I came on a Saturday evening around 7:20 and didn't have to wait for a table of 2 but when I left there was a bit of a crowd. 

Can't wait to try my dishes next time!
author: Carissa G.

description: Love this Thai food! I've gotten the yellow curry a few times and it's one of the beat I've ever had. The green curry duck is also great! I've had the pad see ew twice and it's just ok. But the pad Thai is always a winner! The wait can be long because it's a hole in the wall and the service can be slow because they do a TON of takeout so you have to hunt down the waitress to get service sometimes. But the food is good for the most part, you just gotta be patient.
author: Jenn A.

description:
This whole restaurant is smaller than some bars' seating areas - only 8 tables. Authentic staff. Cheap prices. Right up my alley, right?

I started with the Pad Thai, but was disappointed. I love pad thai, and it was mentioned by a lot of people. But, this one was just not packing a lot of flavor. King of Thai is definitely beating them in this item, hands down.

When trying a new place - especially one as economical as this one - I usually try a few menu items. I got the Thai Time Noodle Special (letter E on their specials board), and man was it fantastic. I also got the rad na with beef. Delicious. 

One thing I'll change next time is ordering stuff spicier. Luckily their spicy sauces are decently effective.

Oh and it's not just the food that's cheap - the Thai Iced tea clocks in at only $2.50, making it one of the cheapest I've had.

And did I mention they're fast? Lightning fast. I was in and out in 25 minutes AND I never felt rushed in the slightest. 

Definitely will come back, although at a more typical time (I was there right before closing), I imagine it might be harder to get a table and I'd have to do takeout.
author: Chris S.

description: Beware: Online orders at peak times will receive a 60min ETA. Calling the  restaurant to cancel will fail because their staff are trained to tell you to contact the app vendor. Expect to go through the credit card chargeback process if you can't wait.
author: Eclectic E.

description:
I have patronized Thai Time for 6 years now. I continue to return for the tasty food at a great price. Not to mention, the ingredients are always fresh, and the portions are quite generous. 

Given the small size of the restaurant, tables are at a premium, and the wait is often long after 6pm. Instead of waiting, I opt for delivery since my flat is nearby (tip: it's much cheaper to call than order through Yelp). Most estimates are 45 minutes but often arrive much earlier. Pick up is another great alternative, which typically takes 15-20 minutes for modest orders.

As for the food, I am very rarely disappointed. I recommend the Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, and Thai Time Fried Rice. The vegetable dishes are also very good, and the curries are quite popular. The duck, however, is extremely salty, so you may want to avoid it if you are sensitive. It remains an issue to this day.

To the Owners: Please extend your weekend hours at least one hour. This neighborhood desperately needs a late night option that isn't King's Thai. Thank you!
author: Curt S.

description: Small restaurant but feels at home. The food is like home cooked and provides a large portion for decent pricing. The Pad Thai with Shrimp tastes great and authentic! Servers are spectacular as they check in to make sure the food is good and water cup is full.
author: Kevin R.

description: Hole in the wall Thai restaurant that serves up home style Thai food. So delicious and bursting with lots of spices and herbs. I prefer this place over Marnee Thai. We ordered the green curry, drunken noodles, papaya salad, and the deep fried crab. They were all great! I would recommend this place to all people.
author: Jim G.

description:
I took a chance on ordering delivery here one night, and was in for a very pleasant surprise!  My food arrived HOT and oozing with aromas of fresh ingredients.  I have actually never been to the restaurant, only ordered delivery.  

My main dishes that I order are the yellow curry with chicken, Thai Time fried rice, and Pad Gra Prow.  The food is never dry or overcooked (steamed too much).  Vegetables are al dente (my personal favorite), and sauces/gravies have so much flavor!  When I want to order in Thai food, I always think of Thai Time.  Delivery time, even on a Friday night, is prompt and never damaged.  

Thank you Thai Time!
author: Marisa R.

description:
Yum! With so many options, it takes a lot to earn these #s from yelpers!

Only be sure to explicitly state if you're veggie as meat will be included if you don't mention even if not listed.

We will return!!!!
author: Jon H.

description: Stopped in around 4pm on a Thursday and they were actually very busy. Got the green fried rice which has green curry mixed in. It was a delicious and just a little spicy.  The portion is huge. Enough for 2 people in my opinion.
author: Cameo W.

description:
My friends and I came here on a Wednesday night around 7:15. The place wasn't crowded, but as the night went on, more and more people came, and the place was getting packed. Considering it is a small place, the restaurant became crowded, and I noticed that around half of the orders were take-out, which makes sense given the small venue. The wait time for our food took a while, maybe 20-30 min, and it seemed like there were only a few servers and one or two cooks. The servers did come by to refill our waters frequently though, so that's a plus. As mentioned before, a good portion of orders were take out, so the cooks were probably cooking their orders as well, making the wait time a little longer. We decided to order family style so we could try more options.

Food:

- Pad Thai: The pad thai was good, and the portions are decent. The noodles were nice and tangy, making it even more delicious.

- Thai rib: The sauce was nice and spicy, since it's topped with curry sauce. The vegetables were decent, and I wished the meat was more tender.

- Kao pad: The portions were good, and I liked how there were a lot of veggies. The curry from the Thai rib went well with the rice. The rice itself was a little salty with the flavoring of soy sauce (I think) but overall, a very satisfying dish!

Overall, the food was good for the price you're paying. The downside is the small venue (not much can be done about that) and the slow service. Either than that, I would come back if I'm in the area.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Small hole in the restaurant serving cheap Thai food. Value for what you get is crazy. I was able to come in for lunch hour during the work week and the lunch special for 1 item is less than $8, which is UNHEARD of. You get a good amount of food, probably the portion you're SUPPOSED to eat per meal.

The value for your dollar is 5 stars. Service is 5 stars considering the type of restaurant thisis  (she's so nice and everything is prompt!). 
Food is still about 3-3.5 stars. We got a few items and they were all just alright, nothing that blew me out of the water. But you really can't complain for the cost.
author: Emily C.

description:
It's my second time here and it's for sure one of the most authentic Thai restaurant. The place is a small place but the food is definitely worth! I ordered the pad thai because it's one of my favorite thai dish and it did not disappoint me. I was very surprised by the Green Rotee because I've tried rotee before but the sauce is usually peanut butter. But the green curry sauce compliments the rotee really well, especially it's a little spicy. 

Definitely will come back!
author: Anna L.

description:
I ate here twice, both through yelp pick-up. The first time, we all got 3 orders of pad thai with thai tea. No complaints, the pad thai is delicious here!! I love the thinner rice noodles. The only con was 60 minute waiting time after placing the order for pick up. 

I stopped by here and ordered a yellow curry with brown rice for pick up through the yelp 24 app. The wait time was slightly better this time, but my food wasn't.... Curry is usually slightly thick, but not super thick, but my CURRY WAS A SOUP. A literal soup. It was a sad curry. And all potato were so big and I did not get any carrots :(  I was really disappointed given so many great reviews of it. 

Also NOTE: the brown rice here isn't that super amazing delicious thai brown rice, but typical brown rice. 

I'll come here again, but maybe not for the curries, but for the pad thai.
author: Micaela I.

description:
Small hole in the wall, but they have more traditional dishes than your average Thai restaurants nearby. We came just in time around 6pm so that we did not have to wait. After being seated, people started flooding in to wait for a table.

I ordered catfish curry with brown rice. They gave an abundance of catfish, so much that I couldn't even finish it. Lots of fish bone to spit out though, but still delicious. The curry consistency was good -- not too thick but not too watery, and it was very tasty. I tried some of my friend's pad thai and it was really yummy too. The prices are pretty good since I made two meals out of mine.

Such a cute place with amazing food.
author: Julian Y.

description: After reading so many positive reviews I decided to dine here one night with a couple friends. I absolutely love Thai food, and we were excited to sit down and order the pad se ew and a variety of curries. I'm not sure if this was just an off night, but the food was bland and missing traditional Thai flavors. The wait staff was attentive and friendly; however, I'll seek out other Thai options in the city.
author: Hank D.

description: This is a great part of Richmond, just off Clement street. Across the street from Halu, one of my favorite restaurants anywhere. I've ordered takeout from Thai Time several times and each time it's been good to great, but the experience ordering and picking up has always been terrible. I think this might be one place where you just want to eat there, although the tables look very small, close together, and one poor table actually prevents the door from opening more than halfway. If I lived closer, I would definitely try having it delivered, but I'll keep looking for a place to order takeout.
author: josh f.

description:
Heavenly cozy interior reminds me of the old San Francisco of my childhood. Great, calm service without being intrusive let's you enjoy your companion's conversation. 

The food is incredible. It's the perfect Thai place without all the added sugar. Their seafood is fresh. Check out the Tom Kha Talay soup (I always get it!) with white rice, all of their awesome curries, and their pad Thai is classic with the thinner noodles.

Everything on the menu is great and the prices are amazing. My jewel restaurant that I bring all my friends to. 

Fast delivery! I love this family!
author: Priya S.

description: Decided to try it due to reviews. Tried and experience was far from pleasant. Sat down with my lady & 2 year old and ordered at approximately 7PM.  Did not get our food until 8PM!  During this wait time, I see people walk in and grab their to go orders. Perhaps we should've ordered to go. In any case, if the food was wait worthy, I may have been more forgiving with this review. Food was mediocre at best. We actually had to pack our food to go 5 mins after we got it because it was babies bedtime and he was hungry and fussy.  Safe to say, never returning. Got tricked by Yelp :0(
author: Jason T.

description: Food is average.  We didn't like the duck curry, didn't taste it right.  Ordered and paid online but upon delivery we were told to pay cash.  Delivery guy called the restaurant to confirm but nobody answered. Paid $60 cash to get our dinner but the restaurant charged my credit card.  Called the restaurant to inform but nobody answered.  We waited close to 2 hours to get our food delivered.
author: Maki M.

description:
Everything about this restaurant reminded my of my recent trip to the beautiful country of Thailand! From the decor on the walls to the small kitchen that you must pass in order to get to the tiny bathroom, it brought back fond memories. 

Not to mention, the food was as authentic as food from a street cart in Bangkok. Obviously, Time doesn't offer the same prices as a street cart, but it is decently priced at about $7- $11 per dish. As well as $4 for dessert and $2.50 for thai iced tea. Talk about a deal! 

No dish really stood out to me with the exception of the dessert, roti. If not for their homemade, freshly cooked pancake drizzled with condensed milk and sprinkled sugar I would rate this place 3 stars. However, the roti was perfectly executed that the final rating bumped to 4 stars. 

If you're in mood for some quick home cooked thai food, go to Thai Time and it'll satisfy your craving.
author: Briana H.

description:
Really liked this place a lot! Came here for a date night and it's a small place but cute. Thai place that's affordable and good food. 

I got the hor mok and my boyfriend got the red tilapia which were both really fresh and good.
author: Michelle T.

description: A great hole in the wall place with great Thai food. I especially loved the whole fish. Would definitely come here again!
author: Samantha C.

description:
I've eaten here twice and have also ordered to-go with my roommate and their prices are solid for SF. 

4 stars since we had to wait 30+ minutes for our Togo order, but makes sense since it's a super small kitchen. Overall, delicious food though - how can you ever go wrong with Thai?
author: Brianne I.

description:
It's a failure on Yelp's part that they don't allow the option to give a 20-star rating to this restaurant alone. Thai Time is literally fucking incredible. I feel like I've stepped back in time to a period in history you probably won't understand- a period in recent history when San Francisco was a beautiful, multi-cultural, affordable, happy mecca. A time before the "dot-com revolution" rolled in the SF we know and "love" today- overpriced, gentrified, obliterated, befouled.

Anyway,  Thai Time offers up EXQUISITE  Thai food at INCREDIBLY reasonable prices, with AWESOME quantities of food and ... well... zero negatives I've experienced yet. Very friendly people too.

Enjoy and let's all pray this wonderful institution remains alive and well for years to come!
author: Grizzle J.

description:
I was so excited to try Thai Time due to all the rave reviews and the fact that it's such a cute hole-in-the-wall atmosphere. I've walked by many times and finally tried it last night. We ordered to go and when we arrived to pick up there was a wait. The place is tiny with great Thai decor/vibe. Now for the food.

Green curry with chicken.
Green curry is my favorite Thai dish, and I was so excited to try theirs.  First bite, salt.  I've never had saltier curry. And it was very watery and flavorless.  No curry taste whatsoever. Huge disappointment. 

Pad Thai.
A staple that I always order when trying a new place.  It usually sets the tone of the quality of the restaurant. This was just OK.  Fairly bland and again, missing the traditional pad Thai flavor.  Disappointment.

Coconut shrimp crepe.
Interesting dish. Crepe was thin and crispy, with a filling that was hard to make out. There wasn't much to it, and really had no taste.  I didn't taste coconut or shrimp.  Disappointment.

The prices here are good, but the quality unfortunately isn't there.  I'll continue my hunt for good, high quality Thai.

***UPDATE***
My Thai food search has ended! Tawan's Thai on Geary/8th is amazing and authentic! So so good, flavorful, very spicy (there are spice level options - #1 is spicy!!) Cute, tiny hole in the wall and just as inexpensive as Thai Time. They deliver as well, and fast.  Holy Thai grail has been found!
author: Kim W.

description: Nice small place , fresh food, great service and reasonable prices/on the low end. Had 4 dishes and mango sticky rice and all was very good.
author: Michel B.

description:
Great little place off of Clement and 8th avenue. Seating can be a challenge but if you come at the right time, you will enjoy your experience dining at this restaurant. 

The food was tasty and I loved how cozy this place was.
author: Misty M.

description:
Food is very good, prices are reasonable, service is excellent. Good parking in the area, depending on time of day/evening.  4 stars for these!

Best to use the restroom before you come to this place, as it's through the kitchen that you must travel to arrive at the small bathroom in need of remodeling.  The small, quaint dining room could use a regular cleaning, vacuuming in all knocks and crannies. These issues are minus 1 star.  Maybe the owner(s) will read this and start keeping it clean in those places.

Good for take out as well!  Give it a chance if you haven't. It's great.
author: Sue C.

description: The food quality and quantity is awesome. Loved it !!! Will definitely come back here and strongly recommend this place for anyone looking for Thai food in SF.
author: Shailendra P.

description: Ordered on the app for pickup and arrived when at designated time. Had to wait an extra 20 minutes. Ordered the rotee which was a little burnt, the Thai ribs which were tough but flavorful, the po tak soup which I liked, and the duck larb. They have the best duck larb that I've tasted so far in the city but today it wasn't that great. Maybe they were busy and didn't put as much attention in their food as they normally do but I've had better from here. Overall the meal today was ok but not as good as it usually is.
author: Jared Y.

description: It looks and feels like an authentic Thai home-cook restaurant but it taste nothing like Thai, taste definitely altered to suit Non-thai. Don't know how it got it's rating maybe because the standards here is lower than NYC.
author: Elaine C.

description: Broken meal box. Delivery man charges more tips. No answering from restaurant. Terrible experience.
author: Anthony H.

description:
This is my new favorite Thai place. The food is consistently good and the service is great. And compared to other local places, the prices are relatively inexpensive.

I love the green fried rice with chicken. Every meal I've had here has been solid. The restaurant itself is a little small so often I just get food to go. And park of can be a little tight also.

But overall, this place is definitely the place to go for Thai food on the west side of SF. I highly recommend it.
author: Chris D.

description: Pad Se Ew here is great. We ordered a pick up order through Yelp and they were quick. They also payed attention to spice level as I could tell my order was definitely spicier. Walked into the restaurant and it was actually very nice and cozy. Like your neighborhood Thai restaurant. Definitely want to actually eat in sometime.
author: Julie L.

description: I was excited for Thai near me with lots of vegetarian options however halfway through my meal I realized that all of my food was non-vegetarian. They simply added tofu to the standard yellow curry and pad-Thai in order to fool the costumer. I'm disappointed with this lack of care and rather disgusted.
author: Katie O.

description:
Stopped by for a late lunch a few Saturdays ago with some friends. Like the basic person that I am, I had the Pad Thai and enjoyed it. It was fairly standard and could have used more peanut flavor, but I was hungry and the food came out quickly so no complaints here. Thai Time has a nice hole-in-the-wall feel and the staff is nice.

Side note: if you need to use the restroom, you have to walk through the tiny kitchen space where the staff is cooking and then awkwardly stand in their way while you wait. The bathroom itself is fine, but I'd wait to go elsewhere.
author: Joanna C.

description:
Stop me if you've heard this one before...

What's worse than finding a worm in your apple?

Two long black hairs in your fried rice dish...in a restaurant you eat at a lot. 

Yep Thai time Restaurant sorta freaked me out with their cleanliness issue.

Insult upon Injury: bringing back the hairy rice and being told I would get a credit on my next order....Okay will you also add extra hair too....???
author: David G.

description: Tasty Pad See Ew! Takeout pickup went super smoothly. Looked like a nice snug spot, will probably sit down for dinner next time
author: Earl R.

description: Came here for lunch and had the vegetarian yellow curry. It was very tasty how ever a bit salty for my taste. I ordered the garlic rice with it which is also seasoned, so I asked to change it for the steamed rice to balance out the saltiness. The waiter was hesitant but he agreed to change it. When the bill came i noticed he charged the garlic rice not steamed rice, which was only a 20 cent difference so I didn't say anything. I was just happy the server changed it for me. This made all the difference and my curry was delicious.
author: Sophia M.

description: This is my second time eating Thai food. The food was excellent but the place is very small, and the service could be improved upon in terms of being served in the order you were sat. It's a decent price for what you get. I am not sure I would go back but I don't regret it.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
San Francisco is a foodie paradise, and because I only visit the city on average once per year, I become particularly dissatisfied when a meal is subpar.  Luckily, Thai Time did not disappoint; the prices were completely reasonable, the ingredients were fresh, and the restaurant itself is so small and kitschy (admittedly a potential turnoff for some, but an atmospheric positive in my estimation) that it gives off a distinct SF vibe.

Everything we ate was delicious, but I want to shine a light on the Green Rotee.  The combination of curry, spice, and the sweet rotee was beyond delicious; I visited around 10 restaurants on this particular trip to San Francisco, and this was without a doubt my favorite dish!  Visit Thai Time, and do yourself a flavor favor by ordering the Green Rotee.
author: Raman M.

description:
This place has been here forever and I've never thought about coming in... 
Well glad I did cause their lunch specials are awesome. Pick 2 items from a list of things for only $8.50! The portion size is huge to....
Also the mango and sticky rice did not disappoint! Next time I'm getting the roti dessert cause that looks very promising.
author: Liz N.

description: This is my go-to Thai food place when I don't feel like cooking. The flavors are great, portion sizes generous, and price is quite affordable. I've always ordered take-out but noticed the place is tiny! Yum and thank you!
author: Fleur R.

description: Thai Time is a almost like a hole-in-the-wall establishment that you'll miss if you're not paying attention. The restaurant itself is very small, and the inside seats maybe 20 people maximum. The service is okay, but even with a small restaurant, they take a while to bring your food out. I had the Pad Kee Mow, which came in a large portion but was not too flavorful. A friend had #71 - the steamed garlic rice with deep fried boneless chicken, and really enjoyed that, however. Although I wasn't blown away by the food or service, the price point and portion sizes may be enough to bring me back, as the two of us ended up paying $20 flat for our dinner.
author: Anderson H.

description:
Visiting family in the neighborhood & stopped in for a quick late lunch before heading to the airport. 

Mistake. 

1. Small restaurant with maybe 9 tables. Male owner was acting as server & was not attentive. When I placed my order (spring rolls, pad thai with shrimp, & thai tea), I asked for ice water as well. I had to remind him twice. When he finally brought it, there was a vibrant pink lipstick mark on the rim of the glass. I understand being busy, but I don't understand how he couldn't see the VERY noticable lip print. When I pointed it out to him, he made a face and brought another (clean) glass. 

2. The spring rolls were well-done & crispy, however, my plate had a chip in it the size of a quarter. It was noticable. 

3. One of the shrimp in the pad thai was not fully cooked. 

4. About 10 minutes into my meal, I saw a HUGE cockroach crawling up the wall about 6 inches away from my plate. I discreetly got the owner's attention and asked him to remove it. 

At that point, my appetite was gone & I couldn't eat another bite. I asked for the check and was flabbergasted when I saw that he charged me for the full meal. The fact that he did not acknowledge that my meal had been ruined by the unexpected visitor let me know that it was a good thing I chose to leave the remaining 80% of the food. Rather than cause a scene, I paid and immediately left, relieved that learning to skip this restaurant cost just over $20. 

Moral of the story: DO NOT EAT AT THAI TOWN unless you enjoy dealing with inattentive service, dirty/broken dishes, & vermin.
author: Li S.

description:
ABSOLUTELY DO NOT ORDER FOOD FROM THIS PLACE.

Quite possibly the worst Thai food experience I've ever had. Ordered Tom Kha and catfish curry for delivery through Yelp Eat24 and food took over an hour to arrive--and they didn't include the rice they made me pay for. They had to return with the rice after I called and had zero apology. Thought that was the worst of it (i.e., not that bad), but then the food turned out to be inedible.

When I finally started to eat, Tom Kha started tasting moldy in the middle. The catfish curry was disgusting. Cold in weird places, gooey in weird places, and tasted moldy/dirty. Like I literally I had a mouthful of dirt. 

I don't often have such a horrible experiences with food in San Francisco; I'm kind of shocked.

Wish I'd read Jonathan W's review before I ordered instead of just looked at the overall rating. Would saved me $25, over an our of wait, and no dinner to speak of.

Submitted a complaint to Yelp Eat24, but they refused to do anything about it. Manager Alberto talked over me instead of listening to the complaint and the fact that they are letting this restaurant get away with this again and again (probably how they get rid of old bad food, just mix it in and send it for delivery. Gross!). So I reported everything to the Better Business Bureau. Really hope something happens to protect other people from this problem.

After the fact, I also noticed they have multiple health department issues.

Buyer beware!
author: Cassidy P.

description:
Thai Time is a cute little hole in the wall Thai place with friendly staff, but if you come at the wrong time the supreme lack of seating may mean a long wait. 

There is a long comprehensive menu with all the curry and dishes you would expect, and the staff did help curate a nice dinner for our large party. 

My favorite dish was the red curry. The fried rice was pretty good too, but there just wasn't a ton of rice to go around as there was so much mixed in that there was simply not a lot of rice left.
author: Joey T.

description: Very cute spot, great authentic food and lovely staff. Portions are generous, and the prices are super reasonable as well. Space is pretty small, but that's really part of the charm of this place, which has the feel of a hole-in-the-wall, but all the quality and menu selection of a larger restaurant.
author: Annie R.

description: Living in the Richmond district, Thai Time has quickly become my favorite go-to Thai restaurant. They offer great prices and generous portion sizes. The dining room is quite small, so I prefer to order pickup. When I do dine in, I am always met with friendly fast service. They have plenty of options for vegetarians and meat eaters alike. A few favorites are: Pad See Ew, fried rice and rotee. They also have amazing peanut sauce you can order on the side!
author: Mary S.

description: My new favorite Thai place. I've been here 2 times a week. Price is very reasonable, especially when you come for lunch. It goes anywhere from $6.5 to $9. Dinner costs little bit more but the portion is huge. Food is very tasty and good. Very recommended!
author: Minh H.

description: Definitely the best Thai food place in the inner Richmond. I always order their Chicken basil dish and it is always amazing. Their pad Thai and Thai tea are also really good. Whenever I get it to go, it is always ready by the time I come pick it up. Definitely worth having if you're around the area.
author: Antonella H.

description:
The food here has been consistently good whether it is dine in or take out.  Portions are generous (maybe about 20% more than what's considered regular) and on top of that, many of the dishes can be had for sub $10 (as of 2018...).

One of my favorite thai places for sure.
author: Moto Y.

description: Really fantastic Thai food. We had the veggie/tofu pad Thai and the chicken pad Thai. Both were phenomenal! I like that you can choose the spice level. Take out was fast too!
author: Hannah L.

description: The restaurant is small but the foods are Very flavorful! Love the seafood curry in coconut
author: Thao D.

description: One of the best Thai restaurants in the city! Pad see ew and their green curry with roti is delicious!
author: Alice C.

description: Ordered fried chicken over rice. As soon as I got to work and tried eating it. The food smells so bad like a rice that Has been on a rice cooker for awhile. It was moist and i even let my coworker smell my order to make sure it's not just my sense of smell. Nor ordering from this place again.
author: Alex C.

description:
Better than the joint on Geary but because it's a 1/2 a block from my dining room it took me five years to make it here. Crossing Geary I often feel like the last Wildebeest crossing the crocodile infested Mara river in Tanzania.

The grass is greener on this side! The vibe is locals. Happy locals enjoying a great meal in a tiny restaurant.

It's a tiny spot because, San Francisco.

Everything is great. The often over looked rice is just right.

Everything I've tried here it's great so it's unfair to highlight just one thing. Simply close your eyes and put your finger on something. You will be happy.
author: Justin S.

description: It's a nice small restaurant. The food is great for a workday takeout budget, and they can make food togo in less than 15 minutes. They have a separate menu section for vegetarian food which is great, but beware that the only curry without fish oil is panang curry. I'm giving three stars because the curries with fish oil were listed under vegetarian, even though they were not. They also could not be made without fish oil.
author: Shailee S.

description: Meh. It was edible. I ate it, but it wasn't quite delicious. Lots of flavor, but a bit greasy and very few vegetables. The Tom Kha Gai soup was really sweet for some reason, almost inedible. I say almost, but it was all pretty disappointing.
author: Lisa A.

description: Would leave a zero star review if possible. Placed an order for delivery with them via Eat24, was informed it would take 30-45 minutes. Then was notified they would need more time, up to an hour and a half. Annoying but we didn't feel like canceling the order and decided to wait it out. 10 minutes after that 1+1/2 hour wait I call them to find out what's going on to find out they haven't even cooked our order yet and it would take at least 30 minutes more. It wasn't due to a technical mixup or anything, they knew about my order and just hadn't done anything about it. Other than an "I understand" when I voiced my incredulity there was no apology. Will NEVER order or go back.
author: Dave L.

description: Just as delicious as ever! I'd been craving Thai food and decided to pay my favorite neighborhood spot a visit. I got spring rolls, Tom Kha Gai and Gang Keaw with chicken, and Gang Panang with beef. Each dish popped with seamless, well-balanced flavor. I would've liked to see some more veggies in the curry dishes and a thicker curry sauce, but there was plenty of meat in each (save the spring rolls) and everything was tender and flavorful. I ordered medium spice on the panang, which gave it a lovely sting without compromising the flavor. I look forward to returning to Thai Time.
author: Jen H.

description: Portions were huge for the price. Their angel wings were pretty good, but wasn't a fan of their fried fish fillets.
author: Jasmine L.

description: One of mine favorite Thai restaurant. It's pretty small place, always full, but from my experience never a big wait to be seated. Food tastes very good and it's always very fresh. I definitely recommend it! And vegetarian curry options are great, and what's the best is that you can add pumpkin to it which makes it even better! Worth of trying!
author: Milos L.

description:
This place is so small. The smallest I've ever seen in my life! I'm surprised the people of San Francisco manage to live like this. As a rural SoCal resident, I'm used to spacious restaurants but this was a surprising change. We waited more than an hour for the food sadly. Since they only had eight tables mostly for couples and four-people, our group of five hogged up half the room or so it seemed. 

Pro: -food was pretty good. Portions are nice 
- experience the real city life 

Cons: -waiting...seeing other people who came at he same time get their food and finish before we got ours
-small room... it was a joke turned into a restaurant however 
-our server was not that attentive compared to a different one. 
- they served about ten other people's pick ups before they worked on ours. It was frustrating to see ppl come in and out with food and we had none
author: Myshello T.

description: The food is delicious and well made. It is a cute and small restaurant. Since the place is so small, you will most likely have to wait. The portions were a bit small so I would recommend to order to go or have delivery since the portions are bigger and tastes just as good. Love to get delivery from here but won't go to restaurant again.
author: Tamara L.

description: This food is really, really good. Like, probably some of the best pad kee mao I've had in a while. I got it on a 2 spicy level on a 1-5 scale, and they perfectly placed the heat in the dish. Really, my largest problem was the service. I found our waitress to be slightly inattentive, especially with our drink orders. Still, she was nice and gave us our orders accurately. I would come back here again when I'm the Bay Area and try some of my other Thai food favorites.
author: Derek B.

description:
Best food ever

We had the duck and oh my god 
My wife doesn't even like duck and we we're fighting over every last morsel it has become my new favorite Thai restaurant we will be coming back again and again
author: Azikiwee A.

description: Went in on a Friday night around 8 and was seated immediately, which seemed lucky based on how small the place is. Seriously, you walk in the door and you're in the middle of the place. I ordered the rice noodle with duck, Guai Tiew Ped Yang, #82. It was delicious, affordable, and worth every minute of the wait. Cant wait to go back for it.
author: Elise C.

description:
Love Thai Time - we always get delivery and have never been disappointed though sometimes the delivery takes some time as my understanding is that the restaurant is small. Food always arrives hot and is consistently good. Green curry rice is our fave - good amount of protein included and fresh veggies. 

We switch it up between the various a la carte entrees and noodles - usually get the Pad Gra Prow and Pad Prik King. Veggies are always fresh and everything is super flavorful. Rice or noodles and 2 entrees is a good meal for 2 people with leftovers for the next day.
author: Taryn G.

description: Neighborhood favorite Thai spot. Great food big portion for your price. 4 dishes were under $40 and still had enough for the next day. Friendly and accommodating staff. Always order Togo and they even call when ready. LOVE IT!!!
author: Angel C.

description: The first time I ordered delivery from Thai Time, it was like heaven in my mouth!! Especially the mango sticky rice, holy wow!! So good. And they delivered the food pretty fast and it was hot. I've ordered a couple times since then and the food is consistently good and delicious.
author: Adelle K.

description: Food isn't bad, prices are good. But my delivery came with used gum at the bottom of the bag, which I unfortunately touched. Disgusting.
author: Eugene K.

description: Small Thai restaurant in the Inner Richmond. Sometimes there can be a wait for a table but luckily there is a bench outside for you to sit and wait. We ordered the pad thai and green curry and both were really good. The food is really affordable. They also offer lunch specials during the weekdays.
author: Joe L.

description:
I had a KILLER craving for curry the other night and made a trip here with my boyfriend right before the dinner rush at 7pm. It was fairly packed but we managed to snag a table without waiting. We ordered the vegetable red curry (bomb!!) and chicken fried rice. Both dishes were pretty darn good and tasty. However, the restaurant itself was extremely suffocating and stuffy. We ended up just packing the food to-go )= (wah) Despite this, the food was great!

TIP: Parking is available in the parking lot across the street and is free after 6pm!
author: Mary L.

description: Great neighborhood spot for us now.  My wife's favorite currently.  Food is good and service is fast.  They usually have people crowded out front and are doing non-stop deliveries.  Yellow curry is still my go to.
author: Aaron G.

description: I've come here two times and every time I have it's been a pleasant experience. The waitresses are very kind and welcoming. I have a food (fish) allergy that's annoying especially at a Thai place but they were so accommodating with this. The food is amazing, it comes out quickly, and it's large portions. Everything is also very fairly priced. Such a great experience!
author: Jessie A.

description:
Great food, TERRIBLE service. Been here a bunch of times (takeout and dine in), but it's really gone downhill lately. 

I called in an order for takeout and was told it would be ready to pick up in 45 minutes. Got there right on time and checked in with the hostess - "it's almost ready, 10 more minutes" she says. Okay. 10 minutes go by and nothing. I check back in she tries to tell me that it hasn't even been 45 min yet, until she checks the receipt and sees that she's wrong and it's actually been an hour now. No apology, just "they're finishing it now, just another minute." 15 more minute go by. I ask again and express some concern about how it's now been nearly 30 min longer than the original 45 min they told me. Again, despite my visible (but respectful) frustration, no apology, zero offer to do anything to try to make the situation right, just bag up my food and hand it over without a word. Out the door an 1 hr 20 min after calling my to-go order ahead. 

Sad because having been here 10+ times, it looks like I'll have to find a new "go-to" neighborhood Thai spot.
author: Patrick K.

description:
I've been eating at Thai Time for 15 years and I still love it.  Anytime a small, family owned business is delicious and friendly, I'm there to support it! What's not to love?

Everything on the menu is delicious.  I really like to end the night with roti- all fried and covered with sugar. Yum. The curries are awesome, noodles on point, soups hot and delicious.

I must say though that the place is SMALL. So I wouldn't recommend coming with groups more than 4, maybe 6 but arrive early.
author: Veronica L.

description: Fast delivery and cheap! I ordered delivery through Yelp and the meal arrived within 30 mins. Everything was very fresh and delicious. I recommend the  pad se ew. The chicken curry was a lot soupier than typical curry but still good.
author: Elina P.

description: The food was average. The plates and utensils were worn out. I saw two baby cockroaches crawl up the wall next to my table. We had to wait outside for 30 minutes on a Sunday afternoon around 3pm.
author: Jasper S.

description: We've tried many times over the last 4  weeks to call Thai Time, and the phone always goes straight to voice mail. It's such a shame, as they were beginning to be more cognizant about not putting the phone down, and customer service had improved greatly. Not sure what's going on with this place, but now we're forced to go elsewhere because they never answer the phone anymore.
author: roz A.

description: Thai Time is definitely a rare gem.  It's nestled in the Richmond area part of town between busy Geary & busier Clement Street on 8th Avenue in a converted garage of a typical SF home.  The place is very tiny with barely 8 tables, but very cozy on a cold SF evening.  Make sure you close the door behind you after entering or you'll let the cold draft into the restaurant and get some very annoyed stares from the other patrons.  The food was  served in nice generous portions and I'd specially requested Thai-level of spiciness.  The food came steaming hot with just the right amount of spiciness without making me run for the fire extinguisher.  From where we sat, we could hear the sounds of the food being prepared by the clanging kitchen wok and utensils, but interestingly, we did not hear any human chatter nor smell any food aroma.   Service was efficient, gracious and not intrusive. Overall, I would take friends to Thai Time.
author: X X.

description:
Went here for dinner at 7:45 pm and didn't think it would be crowded because it was after dinner hours. It wasn't too crowded, but there are only a few small tables inside a tiny restaurant so we had to wait 30 mins for a table. 
The service was CRAP. Absolute crap. The workers were nice and all, but the wait after they took our order was unexplainably long. It took so long, that I lost my hunger and by the time the food came, I wasn't even that hungry... The first thing to come out was a bowl of rice, and that was after ONE HOUR. It shouldn't take an hour to make rice. You also have to request every time you need a refill of tea which is real stupid. At the end of the meal, the waitress asked if we wanted a refill of water. I did want a refill, but that was A WHILE AGO. WHY ARE U ASKING AFTER THE MEAL IS DONE?!
The food was the only good part. However, it wasn't as enjoyable because, like I said earlier, the wait was so long that I lost most of my hunger. We got green curry with chicken and pork and red curry with catfish. Very delish, and filling too. 
Overall, not a great experience. The workers couldn't handle the business, and were not attentive. Food shouldn't take an hour to come if there are only six other tables in the restaurant. I would definitely not go again on a Friday night, and to be honest, I PROBABLY WONT GO AGAIN EVER
author: Bob J.

description:
Their Catfish curry is my favorite. Yes, you need to eat with your hands cause the fish is bone in; but the sweet spicy curry makes it all worth it. Combine it with their Thai time fried rice, and you have one delicious meal.
Small place, and has take out. Dine in is nice but there can be a wait. Food is always delicious though
author: Winson L.

description: Cute little place with good food and excellent service. Please note they only accept cash.
author: Julie D.

description:
VEGETARIANS: the vegetarian section is full of meat in the form of fish sauce. Thai Time considers vegetarian and pescatarian to be the same thing. Make sure you ask questions if you want to get a vegetarian or vegan meal. 

This place is small but adorable! I had a bomb heaping of veggie fried rice with no egg and the kitchen paid close attention to the small details. Their coconut soup was incredible and they were able to make it vegan with no fish sauce. Speaking of fish sauce... 

The service was great but I am reviewing the overall business so have to knock from five stars to one for blatantly lying on their menu about the "vegetarian" section. All/ many (I didn't ask) of these items contain fish sauce, which would make this section pescatarian NOT vegetarian (as it is labeled). Fish sauce contains fish, it's fish sauce. Our waitress defended the menu's mislabeling so much it seemed she was told the wrong definition of "vegetarian," which was more concerning. I love and appreciate restaurants that label their menu to make it easy to understand what is and isn't vegan/vegetarian but this is making me wonder if I should be concerned other labels are blatant lies. Vegetarian means no meat- a fish is an animal, not an egg or a vegetable. Please fix this, Thai Time!! I just want to know what I can actually order so I can focus on the delicious flavor and not question what I'm eating. 

There is fish sauce in all of their curries so if you're vegan or vegetarian you can't have any of the curries. 

The yelp label "vegetarians go crazy for this spot" is based off of people reading the menu and believing their huge vegetarian section is actually vegetarian. I hope yelp speaks to the restaurant to fix their menu. I also help Yelp stops mislabeling this place as being vegetarian-friendly as they are drawing vegetarians into unknowingly breaking their morals against consuming animals.
author: Katie B.

description: This place was good. My 1st time, ordering Pad Thai to go. I will come back, when I have more time.
author: Rowland W.

description: If you're craving Thai food- it's definitely Thai Time. This is a great restaurant to do family style- order the Pad Kee Mao with beef, Chicken Pumpkin Curry, and Pineapple Fried Rice! If you have room for dessert, the Mango Sticky Rice is also a winner. The food comes out as it is finished in the kitchen but expect a wait. The restaurant is tight- so don't come with a large group.
author: Grace L.

description:
My go-to thai place in SF!
I love the small cute setting of the restaurant and the food is delicious. I love their pad thai!
Everyone is very polite and nice.
It is one of the few thai restaurants that stays open in the afternoon so they will be available if you're having a late lunch and their prices are very friendly.
author: M Alejandra L.

description:
Wow, this place's thai food was very good. And what great prices! It's so nice that it's a small place kinda tucked away from the main storefronts of Clement.

Things I've had:
- Pra Ram Tofu: 5/5. Loved it. Exquisite combination of sweet peanut sauce on steamed vegetables.
- Choo Chee Tofu: 5/5. Not spicy at all, which is perfect for me. 
- Garlic Rice: 5/5. I was shocked at how delicious this rice was. Definitely a must for my future visits.
author: Kaito C.

description:
Yes it is a small hole in the wall.. if driving you will definitely pass it up. Of course parking is never easiest but nice that there's a small public lot across the street. 

So ordered the beef pad se-ew although it was a good amount and didn't feel gross with MSG after the beef was really tough and over cooked. 

As for the yellow curry it was really watered down and didn't taste like curry at all. 

I was looking forward to yummy Thai food ESP with the ratings and reviews... but again everyone has their own opinion and taste buds..
author: Keeks P.

description: Excellent Thai food at a very reasonable price. We had Yum Yum Fried Trout with Mango relish.....YUM YUM YUM. Pad Thai was very good. Gang Panang (Panang curry) with pork was also tasty. Will become our go to Thai restaurant in SF. Small place in Richmond, very nice.
author: Charles C.

description:
Inedible food was delivered to my house tonight. The meat in the Larb salad looked and tasted old. They put rice powder on the meat to try to mask the taste/age of it. Some of the appetizers tasted like they had dish detergent in them.The Pad-Se-Ew was terrible.

I'd have to rate this as my single worst dining experience in 25 years of eating great food in San Francisco.I paid $60 for food that I can't eat. Simply Awful. I asked Eat24 for a refund, but the restaurant only offered 10% off.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Been eating here for over 10 years. Only 4 stars because their pad thai is mediocre. But never mind, everything else is awesome. Love their duck larb appetizer. Ask for it thai spicy, extra mint. Green salmon curry is tender, eggplant not slimy. So many dishes, so little time...They do a monster carry out business with good reason, it's small, but more likely because they are popular!
author: jj c.

description: We love the food here and they have always been very helpful about ensuring no gluten in our food as my husband has celiacs disease. Ordered on Friday night and asked the girl who answered the phone to ensure there was no soy sauce. She said okay but did not sound confident. Needless to say, he was extremely sick that night and all the next day. That was a major disappointment and hopefully it will not happen again. If someone is unsure of something, I think they should ask as opposed to just agree. Food is still good though.
author: Tammy M.

description: Easily one of the best restaurants in the neighborhood. I've lived in the Inner Richmond for three years and it's my favorite place to eat and get take out. Great food and nice people.
author: Alex W.

description:
A *COCKROACH* crawled around the table we were sitting at (this was last Sunday). The waitress helped us kill it and moved us to another table. I really hope they fumigate this place, as we may not ever come back. 

*Tom yum soup with chicken: Very tiny bowl for the price. But it had nice flavors. Best dish. 
*whole talapia with red curry sauce and eggplant: It was a pretty dish, but tasted mediocre. A bit creamy and not enough of a true curry flavor. The fish had a  strange softness...not sure if it was super fresh...
* Fried rice with string beans: the string beans were old and tough. 

We haven't been here in years bc flavors are usually hit or miss. I see another review from last week about a roach coming out of the  kitchen. After Mr. Cockroach, I'm not sure if I can stomach another bland meal here, just makes you question how clean and fresh the food is in the kitchen, just gross!
author: Minh D.

description: This is the most favorite Thai restaurant for my family in the city.  The food are so good and the price is very cheap compare with other restaurants.
author: V X.

description: My parents and I came here on a Sunday night and were seated immediately. It's a very small, intimate space, good for couples or small groups. The food was delicious and very inexpensive (each plate was $10 or less). I'll be back next time I'm in the mood for Thai food.
author: Hannah S.

description: One of theeeee best Thai places I've been to in the city! We live a few blocks away so normally we go to King Thai #2 on clement a few blocks over but this time wanted to try something new. I must say I was VERY impressed! The service was amazing and wonderful. This little restaurant is hard to find with such a small location but the food quality was impeccable! Everything was so fresh and made to order! Prices are so reasonable as well! Going to the bathroom you have to walk through the tiny kitchen where they prepare these delicious dishes so that was really cool! I ordered the tom yum soup with seafood and added noodles and the portion was bigger than I thought it would be and the flavor was incredible! Me and my boyfriend will definitely be coming here a lot! This is going to be our new go to place!! LOVE!!!!
author: Michelle F.

description:
After starving until 2 PM, I was super happy to have found a restaurant that not only had good food, but great customer service as well! It's a tiny place suited for parties up to four :) I came here with my younger siblings and me mommy~

Things we ordered:

64 Thai Time Fried Rice - I thought the rice and pineapples really stood out in this xD The prawns/calamari weren't too special but still good nevertheless

74 Chicken Pad Thai - A bit sweeter than the rice (get this if you like sweet better than savory!) but tasted great as well

92 Tom Yum Pak Soup - Hmm, I would have to say that this was a little too salty/sour for me, but since I'm not a Thai food expert I can't say anything bad about it uvu
