I appreciated that they gave us extra plates, already knowing that we would share our orders! I really liked the rice and pad thai noodles/the bases of these dishes. The toppings/garnish were pretty standard~ I regret not ordering their curry lmao

I recommend this place if you're having a casual lunch with a few friends and not looking to spend too much money on fancy food!
author: Yuzuki K.

description:
This is a review for delivery via Eat24. Everything about the experience was disappointing from the delivery time to the ultimate food that was delivered.

The original estimate was 45-60 minutes, but it actually end up taking 90 minutes to deliver. They didn't include any utensils or chili sauce as requested.

We ordered the Pad See Ew, green curry and stir fried green beans with red curry. 

Both curry dishes were incredibly watery. As other reviewers pointed out, it's basically a soup. The green curry just had salt salt salt flavor...no complexity that you normally taste with green curry. The green beans had no flavor (there was also no red curry...)

Finally the Pad See Ew was incredibly dry with a burnt flavor and the beef was rock hard and dry. 

There are too many good Thai restaurants in this city to be ordering from a restaurant that clearly does not care about quality.
author: David S.

description: Dined in at Thai Time Restaurant last week and was blown away!  I came with a group of 3 people and was seated immediately.  I ordered the special on the board: young coconut curry.  It was a little spicy, but delicious!  A lot of bellpeppers in the curry, and a good amount of shrimp (A lot more than I assumed could fit in a coconut).  I will be coming back :)
author: Gina B.

description: This restaurant probably has the best bang for your buck thai food in San Francisco. The quality and service is good. The only downside is that the restaurant is small and it takes a little longer for the food to come out than most places. Sometimes there is a 20-30 minute wait for a table on busy times/days.
author: Darian L.

description: Came here for a business trip and happened to stop by for a good meal.  The hostess (probably owner) was exceptionally friendly and did a nice job of recommending dishes to suit our palette.  We had the yellow chicken curry, chicken with string beans and pad Thai, all of which were deliciously prepared.  I love Thai and I've had my fair share of it, tasted straight from the kitchen of a native!  The Tom yum like soup with coconut milk was also very aromatic and tasteful.  The Thai iced tea here is also great.  Yum yum enjoy!
author: Kathy H.

description: This place was disappointing despite the high amount of reviews.  Fellow Asians looking for an authentic experience beware : this is NOT genuine Thai food! Very westernized,  and doesn't fulfill my Thai addiction.  Go elsewhere.
author: Dillon W.

description: Great taste and portion got the pad Thai lunch special. Perfect. From North Carolina and it's hard to find good pad Thai up there.
author: Danny B.

description:
Food was excellent with very good vegetarian selections.  Ordered to pickup and they said 1 hour and were not ready for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Very small kitchen and a small restaurant but worthwhile if you have the patience to wait
author: Ron J.

description: this is one of my favorite thai restaurants to go to in the richmond district! it's a tiny restaurant so it's not recommended for large parties. sometimes the wait can take a while depending on the time you get here. i ordered the thai fried rice while my friend ordered a pad thai. the portion size is generous. the food is great and the staff is friendly. i always have a good experience whenever i eat here. if you need to use the restroom, you have to walk through the kitchen to get to it. there's meter parking right outside, if you get lucky!
author: Sylvia H.

description: Here we go again .. A small family Restaurant hidden on inner Richmond.. Clement aria.. But once you taste their Food.. It's like traveling in time to Bangkok.... True enough.. I don't judge the façade of the restaurant it's what they offer.. Authentic one.. It's a must to try...to taste is to Believe.. Khup
author: Donovan L.

description:
Literally, just received our takeout order of -- thai samosas, firecracker balls, thai fried rice, green curry, and pad kee mow. We ordered the fried rice and curry as "medium" and pad kee mow as "mild." Holy moly!! They either have a different interpretation of "mild" or they screwed up the order-- those noodles are waaaay hotter than the "medium"!! My mouth is on FIRE! I am on my 3rd glass of milk and can't taste or feel a thing. 

Whenever we eat thai food at other places, we always order medium and it's a perfect amount of burn and deliciousness. Based on other reviews, I saw other people had trouble with this place's "spice" scale too-- but the opposite-- not spicy enough.

Thank goodness I tried the samosa and firecracker balls first-- those are good! The other stuff, I can't comment on or even bear to try and torture my tastebuds with. 

Most likely will not be ordering from here again. There are better thai places out there!
author: Ren B.

description: A small hole in the wall restaurant with delicious food . Came in here with my family and we all enjoyed dining here . We will be coming back soon !! Thank you Thai Time
author: Paul P.

description: The service was so bad the waiter will be ignoring you the entire time you are there .
author: Tracy L.

description: Good food, fast service with only one waitress for the room. Decent prices and baby friendly.
author: C N.

description: Food and everything here was average I have to say. I was hoping for more as in flavors and trust me I was excited to try this place, I have to say I was disappointed unfortunately. The amount of food that came out per order, wasn't much. Also the flavors was basic. Fortunately I've been expose to authentic Thai food and I've been to hundreds of locations in the U.S. including Thailand. Absolutely come here if it's last min. Just don't expect to be thrilled nor 100% satisfied. Just saying.
author: Dang D.

description: This is our neighborhood Thai place, and we have eaten here many times over the years. The veggie dishes are pretty good, but they use tortured animal bits, and have a very low cleanliness rating from the Health Dept, so we don't come here anymore. We noticed we didn't feel great the day after eating their food - perhaps because of low sanitation issues, or whatever cheap ingredients they use.
author: S. K.

description: The food was good considering we were very hungry; however, we did not expect the gratuity charge to be so high. The service wasn't all that great. The food made some of us feel sick. We weren't quite done with our food and the workers rushed us to pay and leave. There wasn't much room for those waiting for a table. The overall space was very limited.
author: Taylor R.

description: Best used-to-be little hidden secret in SF! We eat here at least once a week. The food is great. Staff is friendly. Recommend the eggplant (pad ma keur) and any of the noodle dishes. Red and Panang curries are also good. Go early to avoid the wait.
author: Joshua R.

description: Only been once so far but it stands out as one if the best Thai restaurants in SF. Will definitely go back. Great curry and noodles. Amazing Thai iced coffee.
author: Enoch T.

description: This is hands down the best Thai food I've ever had in my life, and Thai food is my favorite cuisine. I go about once a week and have never been disappointed. The portions are large, the price is right, and the food is incredible. I've probably had 12-15 dishes on the menu, and strongly recommend their curries. Also, get the sticky rice with peanut sauce- the peanut sauce is to die for.
author: Emerson K.

description:
I know I went to the right place, because my receipt says so, other than my experience differs from my yelp counterparts.

Came here for lunch with a buddy and we ordered their Pad Thai, Chicken Green Curry, and Chicken with Peanut Sauce, and a Thai Tea.

It was lunch time and given that there were only 2 tables out of 8 that were busy, I'm not understanding what went wrong.

Here's the thing, if I'm ordering hot food, I like it to be hot. I'm talking temperature wise, not spice level.

Both the Chicken Green Curry, and Chicken with Peanut Sauce were cold. I mean, like cold, as in it needed to be reheated, or better yet cooked fresh. I had to box it to go.

The Pad Thai was warm though, and good. We had it with shrimp, and I wound up eating my buddies plate since my combo dish was cold.

Also, I'd avoid the free soup with the lunch combo as it consists of salt water and shredded leftover vegetables. Geez, and I thought I was a bad cook!

The Thai tea was good, and for under $2.00 I think it was a good value.

But, I can't give this place high marks since I came here wanting to eat my own lunch, instead of stealing from my friend's plate because I was starving.
author: Jack R.

description: Absolutely delicious. I will be ordering other dishes-the flavors are layered, tasty and scrumptous.
author: K W.

description: Wow! Met a friend here for lunch, and we were both wowed by the excellent food and attentive service. My combination Gang Panang was exceptional, and my friend was equally enthusiastic about his Pad Thai. Plus the prices are reasonable. Highly recommended.
author: John N.

description: Very cozy little house restaurant. Food is amazing. Might just be the best pad Thai that I've ever had. I will be back .
author: Matthew C.

description:
We stumbled in here because the place across the street had a wait and we were that hungry.

Looks like nothing special from the outside. The waitress that seated us did not raise our expectations as she was not very friendly initially... 

5 stars for the food. Quality Ingredients at a steal! Yum red curry and spot on with the Pad Thai. 
 
I'll be back again for sure!
author: Caroline M.

description:
food is solid, this is my go to spot for thai food right now.

order the green curry with platha--it is spicy and soo delicious. the papaya salad is very good, nice amount of spice (but i could always use more)

pad kee mao is ok, not enough flavor for me but it did the job.

sometimes they run out of mango sticky rice, but when you do get one the mangoes are perfectly ripe. above average for sf.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Much better than king Thai. Good prices. Good size portions. They do eggplant really well.
author: Kate Jetski Y.

description: Visiting my daughter and her roommate who are living in this area and decided to have Thai Food. Lots of good reviews for this place so we decided try it. It did not disappoint. We ordered 4 main courses and then sent them around to each other and everything was amazing. It's very small and quaint. I would be a frequent customer if I lived anywhere nearby!
author: Traci B.

description: My favorite Thai place in the city. I take all my friends here because it's cheap, the portions are good, and they listen to you
author: Humaira A.

description: I love Thai Time, and not just because it was within walking distance of my apt. The menu is very reasonably priced, especially if you dine in. They have a lunch special with a large portion. I've ordered the Tom Kha Gai soup when I was sick and it was really tasty. You pretty much can't go wrong with anything on the menu. They have a very small seating area and it can get crowded on the weekends, but you can always order take out if you can deal with the upcharge.
author: k h.

description:
ALRIGHT so:

Came here on a Tuesday night, mind you this place is super small. Maybe 6 tables? There was a wait to get a table and then there was a 35 minute wait for the food, but ho-ma-gosh was it worth it. 

Panang Curry (Vegetarian): Thick, flavorful, fried tofu, fresh crunchy broccoli yes yes yes. 

Spicy Red Curry Fried Rice-- Duh-lish-iz. 

Mango Sticky Rice, great.

plus 2 Thai black teas, free refills all for $25? 

Yes.
author: Dede C.

description:
I used to pass this place everyday in grammar school. I saw it all the damn time growing up.. Now, finally, after 25 years, I've finally ventured in!

BF and I ordered:
green curry duck- not a fan of duck in general, but the eggplant was yum! Green curry was good, too; had some great flavors.
angel wings- omg.. this was so delish. chicken stuffed with ground pork, silver noodle, and black mushroom.. all fried.. it was reminiscent of cha lua, vietnamese "fancy pork".
spicy green bean fried rice with chicken: pretty good. nice and spicy.. but it was fried rice, so yea. 
roti: I was apprehensive when it came out because it wasn't flaky paper thin like the one at Banana Island.. but I was pleasantly surprised with its flaky exterior and chewy interior. Reminded me of a croissant.

Definitely get the angel wings. They come in pairs, but they're HUGE! I'll be back :)
author: Leslie C.

description:
This place is so cute and tiny. Gives off that home-y vibe. This place probably seats 15 people max. Came here on a Friday night for date night. And I think everyone else in that restaurant was on a date. Food was delicious!

We ordered the red pumpkin curry, green fried rice, and the Tom Kha soup (which I'm not a fan of most of the time- but it was very good here). And for dessert the mango sticky rice. 

Food was good and flavorful. Service was great!
author: Dara S.

description:
Boneless chicken over garlic rice was so good. 
The chicken was so tender inside and crispy outside. We had whole tilapia with eggplant and bell pepper in curry sauce, the fish was overcook. Sauce was good, but we prefer fish fillet instead. 
Thai ice tea was just standard. Less sweet tho, which I like.
author: Joice K.

description:
6 STARS (based on 2 experiences)

BEST tom kha ($8) I've ever had! overpriced $2.50 Thai iced tea 90% ice. teeny cozy place. felt like a friend's house; young girl doing homework at a back table, boy walked in home from school = adorable family biz! when will Thai restaurants realize the glory of bottomless Thai iced tea (this one hasn't yet, either)‽ decent Pad Thai ~ why did You put in tofu when I asked for prawns? I HATE tofu
author: Loren B.

description:
Early this year, I set up a goal to explore different neighborhoods and perhaps eat more ethnic food. To that end, T has been helping me to accomplish this goal in a way that has resulted an unexpected consequence. Walking, as opposed to driving, we have made an imaginary circle using the apartment as the center, and as time went on, the radius of coverage has expanded, and we walked further and further in Inner Richmond.

T makes suggestions. I vet it, often via Yelp, to make sure that it is to my liking. TT came about that way. It's across from Halu, one of my earlier adventures into Inner Richmond. I had no idea that it was that close on foot when you lived on 7th, and I was surprised by how sleepy this hood gets after 7:30 pm. It's a mixed neighborhood, unlike Inner Sunset, Inner Richmond is less touristy. T explains that's because there are no restaurants right by the park, one must walk a few blocks to reach the commercial side of things, so it is more residential. I have known to run into people I know whenever I'm in Hayes Valley, downtown, SoMa and the Mission, and so far, I've been very lucky to not have done that thus far in this neighborhood, which of course, is a HUGE plus because privacy and personal space are very important aspects in achieving quality of life. When you can eat in peace,  you can start to appreciate the diversity this place offers. It's not just izakaya, there are Thai restaurants too. I learned quickly that that southeastern Asia cuisine is fairly good. This place is more than fairly good. It's in fact excellent.

Vegetarian curry is superbly done. T knows what I like to eat by now. I don't like too much curry too much coconut, it has to be just right. There is a delicate balance to strike and Thai Time seems to have executed it perfectly. I like good chicken wings. We got that for protein. Peanut sauce covered fried wings. What's not to like? Mango salad was my contribution to that evening's dinner menu. It has shrimp and squid, and it's milder than the papaya salad but I liked it more. Garlic rice is portioned just right. Get only one bowl to share with two people, it's very dense and flavorful. If you must kiss your companion after the meal, please brush your teeth and use mouthwash first.

The restaurant is very intimate. When we arrived there were quite a few seats available,  but by 8:30 it was packed full, with a few folks waiting outside.  I grabbed the seat facing out, so I could observe the occasional night dog walkers or the drunken crowd coming out of Halu.

Satisfied with the meal, we took the long route back, finding suitable and relatively new restaurants along the way for future food expedition. I leave in a couple of days for Asia. My life is decidedly different than last year this time. I have been seeking for an enthused food companion for a long time now, perhaps forever. 

Here is the short version of my quest for that companion: I seek no commitment nor fidelity, but you must like this restaurant as much as I do.
author: Victoria E.

description:
A pretty small restaurant with maybe 9 tables. Server was friendly and polite. 

They had a separate lunch menu with combination plates. I ended up ordering from the full menu and got the green roti. The dish consisted of a green curry with beef and chicken mixed with vegetables. I asked for it extra spicy. My tolerance for spice is might high and it's hard to convince people sometimes(I think maybe because I'm white?) so usually I tell them to "try and hurt me" but this time I merely asked them to make it as spicy as they can. The result was spicy but not really the level of spice I was hoping for. Still the dish was quite tasty and the roti was nice and thick and crispy. Good portion and the price was fair.

I'll be coming back for sure.
author: aaron t.

description: Had food ordered for pick up through our office and it was delishhhh ! I ordered the seafood combo mixed with garlic chili sauce ( with Medium spice ) & it was better than expected. A lot of my co workers ordered the green duck curry & raved about it. I will def. be back with my boyfriend to try other dishes !
author: Miss V.

description:
Yum!! Everything we ordered is wonderful. I love how to tofu is cooked. Great prices. Quality meat. Perfect size portions. We ordered a couple sides of peanut sauce. 

Very good. I'll come here again when I visit the city for sure!!
author: Niya S.

description:
The food was pretty bland and average relative to all other Thai I have tried in the city.

But! It was really cheap. 8.50 for a pad Thai and 9.50 for a chicken curry. Pretty big portions! But as said before...pretty average
author: Matthew D.

description:
Super tiny, unassuming hole-in-the-wall restaurant in Inner Richmond with amazing Thai food. I love restaurants like this, especially when there isn't a super long wait!

Green Rotee is my favorite dish here. I order it every time haha. I love how the deliciously  spicy chicken and beef green curry is already served with 4 generous pieces of roti. The portion is always too big for me to finish so I get 2 meals out of it! So awesome because it's already super cheap (less than $10). 

I've also tried their pad thai and angel wings. Love the pad thai, but didn't love the angel wings so much. Marnee Thai still wins that one. Their "wings" were pork-stuffed boneless wings, but I didn't taste any chicken at all. It wasn't too bad, but I definitely wouldn't order it again. 

The servers are also super nice. My friend forgot her purse here and waited for 30 minutes past their closing time just so we could pick it up.
author: Stephanie G.

description: I've ordered delivery several times. Delivery is fast. The food is consistent and always good.
author: Nikolette S.

description:
If this is some of the best Thai food you've ever eaten, I feel sad for you, because there's better Thai food in San Francisco.  You don't even have to go to Thailand.

Pad Thai is bleh - Marnee is better, or even Osha.  The fried chicken over garlic rice was pretty good, but there's a problem when the rice, which is merely meant to be the side dish, is better than the chicken.  I liked the appetizer platter, which came with fried tofu, fish cakes, fried shrimp, and spring rolls, but the tofu was extremely bland.

Seems like an okay place to grab a bite if you don't want to leave the neighborhood, but nowhere near the better Thai restaurants I've been to in SF.
author: Tori S.

description:
One of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city (in my Top 2, next to Lers Ros). I love the intimate, hole-in-the-wall feel of the restaurant. Definitely not Americanized Thai food, everything tastes really authentic. It's also much cheaper than a lot of other Thai restaurants in the city.

Their delivery is super quick as well. My friend and I ordered one night, and they got to us within 35 minutes.
author: Chris V.

description: Yummy green curry with chicken, inexpensive, cute small place. Next time I'll know to ask for more veggies in the curry, it'd be great if they could throw in some broccoli or green beans.
author: Ellen S.

description: LOVE.  The red curry and Pad Thai and Thai tea were simply delightful.   So delicious!
author: BB S.

description:
I am a cat who is totally addicted to Thai food, and I have no shame in proclaiming that as a fact.
ever since my boyfriend started taking me to Thai places, my craving for good Thai food is always up high, and with that comes a very picky tongue that knows what is good and what is not. this cheetah has experience!

it was my boyfriend and i's date night, and we found ourselves basically deciding to eat wherever we could find parking. we ended up finding a space right down the street from Thai time.

now I've passed this place on numerous occasions but never thought of giving it a shot. from the outside it looked absolutely tiny and dull. but I would soon find out what was in store for me within.

upon entry, we noticed that indeed this place was tiny. 7 tables basically. they gave us a nice table by the window and we were given menus. i noticed after a bit, the place did fill to capacity. had we gotten there deeper into the dinner hour we probably could not have eaten there.

there was a really nice selection on the menu with lots of variety. of course, I had to go for pad Thai with chicken with a Thai iced tea, while my boyfriend got his favorite thing in the world, fried rice.

service here is quick, and in no time, my paws were all over the pad Thai. absolutely wonderful! great flavor and mix of ingredients, not to mention the serving portion was really nicely sized! the thai iced tea was very fresh and sweet just how I like as well. ^ ^

our waitress was very attentive and filled our waters often, and did a great job of explaining dishes we weren't sure of.

we finished the night off with a sweet rice and mango dish and left feeling perfectly full and satisfied.

I will definitely return here, easily some of the best Thai food I have had.
just remember to hit this place up a bit early to assure a table!

*chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description: Great food! We got there before the place got busy. Loved the Panang curry and green fried rice
author: Rajitha V.

description: Very small restaurant with only nine tables. If you find yourself sitting at a table, consider yourself lucky. The food here is cheap, delicious and will really fill you up. The deep fried crab with mango salad is amazing, try it with a fresh coconut
author: Christine E.

description:
Green curry rocks and the fried rice is sooo good. Lunch specials include rice so lunch is kind of the way to go. Satay chicken is also nicely grilled and the two dips that come with it are very good. 

The restaurant is super tiny and dinner time can get packed. I haven't eaten in the restaurant yet, but we order take out 2-3 times a month and lunchtime is, again, the best time to get quick service.
author: Hanster P.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. It is a small hole in the wall that makes up for it's lack of flair with delicious and cheap food. I am a huge fan of their eggplant, green curry salmon, and pad see ew. The service is great as well with attentive waiters. I visit this spot regularly with my friend and will continue to do so because I always enjoy the food here.
author: Manpreet B.

description:
Absolutely one of my favorite places in the Inner Richmond. It's amazing how good the food is that comes out of this tiny little place. We usually order takeout since we live around the corner. The staff is always super friendly. 

Good portions, reasonable prices, and just delicious food altogether. Cannot recommend this place enough.
author: Dudley F.

description: Pretty good curry and pretty good pad se-ew. We came here late one night after a meeting nearby. Super hungry, not much open. This was a nice, hole-in-the-wall place, quiet, with friendly staff. I can see coming back if we were in the area, though probably not the best Thai in the city.
author: Allison M.

description: My new favorite Thai spot!  Best service I've had in a long time, and an unbelievable lunch special :)
author: George O.

description: Great food--got the sweet potato duck red curry. It was full of flavor and cooked just right! The chicken pad Thai, also very very delicious. Highly recommend this cute little place. Service gets high marks too. Both the lady servers were kind, patient, and efficient. Exactly what I'd expect from a high quality place in terms of food and service. Thanks!
author: Jas M.

description: Cute ambiance, great food, helpful staff. The lunch special is incredibly affordable and great quality food. Good for vegetarians.
author: Myles M.

description: Love this place! It's a tiny hole in the wall spot with great good and prices. We got boneless chicken and basil chicken. Got it with garlic rice, which was the best part!
author: Melanie S.

description: Yummy food great service nice ambiance and easy parking. Very clean too. Pad Thai excellent, pumpkin curry excellent and coconut soup magnificent. I will definitely return.
author: Ann P.

description: We had really high expectations for this place because the atmosphere was really good and the reviews were great! The seating was fine and the food was okay but we found a bug in the salad and the waitress tried to dismiss it and just say "oh it's probably just a vegetable bug" and shortly after we saw a cockroach from the tiny kitchen so we decided to leave IMMEDIATELY after seeing that.
author: Zack L.

description: For being the #2 Thai restaurant in SF, I was slightly disappointed. The food wasn't bad by any means, just mediocre. The restaurant is pretty busy and it took a while to get our food (that being said - I don't mind waiting for good food). I know of a few other places which I can get my food much faster and the food is even tastier.
author: Olga B.

description: Went for the first time the other night, don't know how I hadn't found this little gem sooner! Top Thai food in SF I would have to say. Ordered the satay, beef with eggplant and vegetables, chicken with peanut sauce (#50 and #52 I think) and pad see ew. All were fantastic and left three hungry people full. Surprised at how inexpensive it is for Thai in SF..very hard to find. Small area inside but cute, only about 7 tables. Entire time I was there their phone was ringing off the hook for deliveries or pick ups. Minus half a star because it took a while for them to take our order but highly Recommend!!! Can't wait to go back
author: Courtney S.

description:
This place used to be our favorite Thai. Maybe even more -- on of our favorite restaurants in Inner Richmond.

But since they came back from vacation in July/2015, service became total crap. Staff has changed, and it's now probably the worst restaurant staff I see around.

We decided to give yet another try tonight. As we enter, none of the 2 waitresses bothered to clean our table. It was so messy that we couldn't rest our arms on it. Gross.

After waiting about 7-8 minutes, one of the 2 waitresses threw 2 menus on us. We knew exactly what we wanted -- the usual. As I tell her I was ready to order, she responds in a very disrespectful manner.

My only option was then to immediately get up and leave. And promise myself not to make the same mistake again.
author: Bruno R.

description: I ordered takeout here and received two noodle dishes with hardly any tofu or vegetables. There were probably four pieces of broccoli total and one dish had only three tiny pieces of tofu. I feel this place is very cheap and a scam especially for the price. I will not be ordering from here again.
author: Alexandra C.

description: Thai Time is a dining experience that I've heard about in Manhattan's heyday and exotic vacationing lore.  Where else can you get delicious authentic food that feels like the owners don't know how much they could charge if they called a few consultants... and you walk past the cooks to access the bathroom?  It has a special place in my heart, my wife and I went here the night we finished moving in together.  Tonight, they took a reservation for ten because we had family in town, which was half the seating.  Just a wonderful hidden jem in a neighborhood full of choices.
author: Daniel K.

description:
We went here on All Hallows Eve, and had a great meal.  Flavors were just so utterly delightful and perfect.  We left happy and satisfied, and definitely want to come back to explore the menu further.

(we got everything vegetarian)
Tom Yum: most thai places have a noticeably inferior Tom Yum when made vegetarian -- not here though.  The flavors were balanced, the sours, sweets, and savories all just right.  Strong, but not overwhelming.  Full of vegetables.  One of the best Tom Yum's we've had.

Pad See Yew: smooth, flavorful noodles, cooked but not burnt, flavored but not too oily or strong.
author: Jon M.

description:
First visit in years this evening with my father.  Two thumbs up!

We got the chicken pad Thai and the vegetables with basil and tofu.  Both were prepared very nicely with very fresh ingredients.

The servers were friendly and attentive without hovering.

The people at a nearby table ordered some soup that caught my dad's attention.  He asked the server about it and she was very friendly, helpful and patient in answering his questions.  (He is hard of hearing and can be a little bit persnickety.)  It was clear that she wanted him to feel welcome and to understand their menu, including letting him know that they can make the food more or less spicy as desired.

While we were there, at least four or five people can in to pick up food-to-go.  From eavesdropping as they were picking up, it sounded like they were regulars.
author: Gary A.

description:
Ped kra pow 5/5 AMAZING pork!! Quality is great, great pieces of savory fat with garlic tamarind marinated caramelized skin and juicy bites of meat! just a little minimal portion. With garlic rice and some curry = WOO!

Poo nim 4/5 soft shell crab, great appetizer! Real small, but it's an appetizer. Fried and served with brown sugar tamarind sweet and sour sauce. And GREAT fried zucchini chips with the sauce!

Green talay seafood curry 3/5. I remember this being good in the past, but now it's more bland towards the end of the flavor ending with an unmatched cream that is too heavy, especially to be alone. Quality pieces, but the soup didn't have a great taste at the end, only in the beginning. 

Great little hole in the wall, one of the best Thai places I've been to. Good prices and sweet homey service. It's very intimate, great date or a hang out with a friend! 5/5 restaurant and vibe.
author: J J.

description: Best Thai I've ever had with incredibly friendly service - they were super busy but you couldn't tell by their smiles and not rushing the meal. Definitely coming back and bringing folks! The salmon green curry was the crowd favorite.
author: Nicole B.

description:
This is a tiny little hole in the wall on 8th/clement. The place is dirty including the ledges that sit in plain view as you wait for your food. It also came with an appetizing long hair innit. Yep 
The food 
I was very unimpressed with the curry
- spicy and much more to it 

Would not go there again
author: Eve D.

description:
Definitely a must return Thai spot for me. 

The first time babe and I came here, we just ordered from the favorites menu. I got the Thai Rib and babe got the Green Rotee.

Thai Rib - Tastes AMAZING! Most likely due to the sauce. so all the veggies it came with tasted so good with it. The only down side of this dish was that the rib was mostly all bone and barely had any meat. I was definitely disappointed about that. I recommend a side of rice with this, because I'm not sure if you'll be full with this dish alone. 

Green Rotee - The rotee here is most definitely a must try! I could probably eat it all day here. Get some rice with this as well, because you cant have curry without rice. 

The second time we can here we just got a Pad Thai and Pad See Eew. 

Pad Thai - pretty darn good. A little too much tofu, bean sprouts and what not that I wished there was more noodle itself in there. 

Pad See Ew - I would say its the same quality as the pad thai, so also good in my book.
author: Harriet W.

description:
My sister suggested we try this place as she had friends that came here often... It's a tiny Mom & Pop restaurant with a high traffic for take-out it seemed. Don't let the outside fool you, inside lies a gem... 

We were seated immediately and took a look at the specials on the menu board and decided to start with their Thai Time wings. The wings are fried and sautéed in a red curry sauce w/ fried basil leaves on top. This was spectacular. So much flavor in each bite and not your typical hot wing... I could've eaten a dozen by myself.  We also ordered the Mango Tango curry which was red curry w/ coconut milk, shrimp, scallops, calamari, mussels, bell pepper and more basil. This too was so good and I am not even a fan of Thai curries. The fried chicken breast and Thai fried rice rounded out the rest of our meal... again, everything was terrific. From where I was sitting, I was able to look right into the kitchen, and it seemed to be one older Thai lady doing all the cooking. Just as if you were at your Thai friend's house and their Mother was preparing dinner! Incredibly authentic, wholesome and just plain delicious... I am usually on the fence about Thai food, but when it's done like this, I would say I love it!

Service was prompt and friendly. Total came close to $60 with tax and tip (and 2 glasses of wine). Totally worth the price and I highly recommend this place.
author: Julie B.

description: Little piece of haven!! Really small original Thai restaurant, one of a kind Thai food. It does feel that your in Thailand suburbs. It's tastes amazingly fresh and full of inspirations. I highly recommend for people that wants to try something original.
author: Rainiere R.

description:
Long overdue for a review! This place is consistently quality and delicious. I always get takeout, but the restaurant looks like a cute intimate (tiny!) spot for date. 
Ive enjoyed all of the dishes Ive tried, but my absolute favorites are the coconut Tom Kha Gai (such a COMFORT food and I adore the chewy whole mushrooms), the yellow curry Gang Garee Gai (comes with giant delicious velvety potatoes cubes), and the classic Pad Thai (very satisfying noodle dish).
 Portions are perfect in my opinion, I always have a little leftover to enjoy later. I get them with chicken every time, and the meat is always great, never funky or weird.
I've never had to deal with the annoyance of being shorted on food, they get the order right every time.
Basically... quality, portion, taste, price, and consistency are on point, very happy to have them in the neighborhood!
author: Chelsea V.

description:
This restaurant opens at 11:30am and when we arrived, around 2:30pm, we were the only party there.

Quickly seated and were given our water. They have awesome lunch specials - prices ranging from $6.95 for one entree to $8.50 where you can combine two items from #1 to #14. The portions are pretty huge and I'll post a photo of it later.

I ordered the pad-see-ew($6.95). It was average, nothing special however the food I felt was lukewarm :( it could've been hotter. The flavor was also subtle - not something I'm used to.

I felt the waitress was a little skimpy with the napkins - my friend spilled curry on his jacket and I asked twice for napkins and each time she brought at most 3. In the end, she suggested my friend going to the bathroom - which for me I felt she was trying to have less work on herself.

This restaurant is definitely a bang for your buck but not sure if I'll be back. They also have a non-sweet Thai Tea for $1.95 which is the cheapest I've ever found.
author: Yeanne L.

description:
It's a bigger hole-in-the-wall restaurant. Good for a quick meal. Can accommodate 15-20 people. But the food is simply amazing. And the variety in the menu is also huge. You have the problem of plenty. The advantage is that there are ample vegetarian options to choose from. This place can be a haven for vegetarians. The food tastes great. The portions are generous in size. And the service is courteous and prompt. The family that runs this place manages to stay invisible but in control of the proceedings. 

A tip: for 2 people, ordering an appetizer, one curry and 2 servings of rice should be enough. The problem for you is which curry do you choose?
author: Vinay B.

description: Do not park in the public metered parking lot across the street. Our car got broken into. Window was shattered and our belongings taken. This is apparently not uncommon and it happens on the daily basis. Food was okay nothing great.
author: Vonne M.

description: The food is good with fair price. I love their green curry with duck, assorted veggie and shrimp fried rice (I forgot what it is called), and Thai tea. The service is good as well. One thing I was not happy about is that when you order a delivery via Eat24, the restaurant charges you $1.49 for it; the amount does not show on Eat24. In fact, on Eat24, it shows "free delivery" on their page. Although it is just $1.49, I would be more satisfied if the restaurant states it out front on Eat24.
author: Kerstin C.

description: Always good service. Never too crowded or a long wait. Food made at the moment so the wait is worth it.
author: Carlos G.

description: The place is small, but the food is delicious. When I first walked up to this place, I almost turned around, but then I  said to myself let me just try it.  And I'm glad I did. Highly recommend it.
author: Emad F.

description: Great little spot! The waiter and waitresses were nice and always checked up on us. My favorite was the angel wings & hoy tod! Must try if you go there and too bad we don't live in SF but if we are ever in town, we will definitely be back!
author: Tida T.

description:
A small restaurant that is easy to get overlooked among the sea of restaurants on Clement Street. I gave up on King of Thai a long time ago after the food quality went dramatically downhill, and this is a strong contender to be a local Thai replacement. 

Highly recommend the salmon green curry. Will be back to try more dishes.
author: Lisette P.

description: Found this place on yelp. I ordered the yellow curry and shrimp and though it was tasty, it was a little watery for my liking. Cost was $13 and had enough shrimp for the price. Staff was friendly and restaurant was small and culturally cute. I would go again and try something different.
author: Cherisse T.

description: Super yummy place! The pad Thai did not have too much sauce(most places drench their noodles in sauce)and the curry had just the right amount of spiciness. Everything had so much flavor and tasted amazing! They only have about two chefs in their tiny kitchen and we ordered 6 dishes but everything came out within 20 minutes! The place is really small but we managed to fit our group of 8 quite comfortably. Everything tasted fresh and I would definitely recommend coming here if you're in the area!
author: Anthie P.

description: Very delicious food! Small little place,  we had to wait maybe 30 min till our food came out but they were slammed so it's understandable. The price is a steal for this quality of Thai. It was worth the wait. I got the green veggie curry with no tofu extra veggies and medium spicy. It was bomb!! Loved being able to eat vegan for $7.95. Highly recommend this spot! And they are open till 10pm on a Sunday night! Perfect for a late night dinner.
author: Maureen E.

description:
Thai comfort food! 

I've tried a few things across their menu and I think Thai Time's curries are definitely their strong suit.

I'm totally addicted.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Great curry/pad thai. I ordered delivery and it takes 60min (even though it's down the street), but as long as I order before 8pm that's fine.  Ordered the yellow curry with chicken, green curry with chicken, spicy string bean with prawns and pad thai with chicken. Everything was still hot and delicious when delivered, makes me sooo happy after a long day at work :)
author: Carissa S.

description:
Cute and quaint little hole in the wall place in sf. I would've never guessed this place existed here! 
Servers were attentive and constantly refilled our waters, but only had basic knowledge of English. 

Ordered my usual Thai dishes of pad see ew and pumpkin curry. Flavors were there, but there wasn't enough heat in the food, even though we asked for it. The noodles in the pad see ew also had a different texture than other Thai places. Thought they were just like that or underdone, but wasn't sure until I reheated my leftovers and they became the right texture. Boooo. 
Pumpkin curry was good, but I would've liked the pumpkin to be cooked longer and "melt" into the curry. 
Rice wasn't included, but they do serve brown rice!
author: Samantha K.

description: This place is absolutely delicious! I had a little trouble finding it as it wasn't right on 8th and Clement but on 8th just a bit South of a Clement (that's probably just my awful sense of direction/map reading skills though). I got the spring rolls and red curry... SERIOUSLY best Thai I've ever tasted! Will go back 5 million times and take everyone I know!
author: Brittani D.

description:
A nice atmosphere and a typical small Thai restaurant in this neighborhood. Service is good and the Pad Kee Mow was great.
I'll be back!
author: Tom P.

description: I am in love with this place. Ordered Pad Thai, Papaya Salad and Seafood in the Coconut , they all tasted so good. The place is small so you are expected waiting time but not too long. I went there Saturday night but did not have to wait that long. Highly recommended.
author: Chloe N.

description:
Hands-down, best thai food in SF! So good. I recommend any of the curries, fried rice dishes, pad see maw, or the soups.

Also, the prices are beyond reasonable. Where else can you get a delicious entree for under 10 bucks in SF?!
author: Sam F.

description: I'll give this place full STARs as this place's food is awesome. I love authentic cuisine and in this Neighbourhood all Thai not up to the authentic standard but this place rock my stomach tonight. I enjoyed all food and really wanna come back here to try all of it. Too bad today they not serving mango sticky rice, I'll definitely come back for it. Good job to all Chef cooking and so busy in kitchen. This place deserved full stars. Thanks to the Chef again.
author: Unyo N.

description:
I was at Green Apple Books redeeming my Groupon when my roommate called and asked if I wanted to go to Thai Time for dinner.  I immediately said yes.

Because its was earlier in the evening (around 5:30pm), the dining room wasn't crowded.  I ordered my standard vegetarian pad thai and saved half for lunch the next day.  I also got Thai iced tea, which has always been delicious.  Service, just like the food, was top notch.

I've been dining here for the past 3 years now.  Their food and service have always been consistent and at a great price.  There are other Thai restaurants in the area, but there's a reason why Thai Time gets a crowd.

If you do plan on getting it delivered or to go, make sure you decide quickly (see my last review).  Once the dinner rush starts, it will take awhile for you to get your food delivered.
author: Vira P.

description: A great hole in the wall restaurant with low prices. The atmosphere is busy and there are too many items on the menu to decide on. The only problem I had was that the seafood dish i ordered was salty, other than that everything tasted great.
author: Vincent G.

description: Amazing food at great prices. Every single thing we ordered was delicious. Tea was great too!
author: Adam T.

description: So sad this place is closed today ): I love their Panang curry and their yum moo mang (BBQ pork salad). Delicious!
author: Lauren A.

description:
First off, they have some AWESOME prices here.

This is a happy review of Thai Time!  I had satisfying meal and they offer a pretty extensive menu for as small as the place is.

It is definitely a great little find. It is cozy and seems like it is family-run.  The lunch combo is an especially the best value you can grab.  You get 2 dishes with a soup and some rice. (2 dishes plus soup for like 8 bucks)
I had the yellow chicken curry, my friend had pad thai and we ordered some rolls.
Small location so be prepared to wait if on a weekend.
author: Eloy W.

description: Service was SLOW on Saturday night, but food was tasty and the restaurant so adorable. Definitely would go back!
author: Caitlin G.

description: Super tiny eating area, but real good flavors! Service was a little slow considering there was only me and my partner but it quickly picked up shortly after we arrived. It was a chill spot and I'd definitely hit it again.  They had good sized portions and friendly service tho they were a lil laid back and chill. But most importantly, the food was definitely worth it! We got the mango catfish, Pad See Iew, and Thai TimeFried Rice! Of course you need to get Thai iced tea with your meal to top it off. Real good spot tho. Check it out if you're in the Richmond district.
author: LeleAndJenJen ..

description:
I've been to about 10 thai places in the city.  This one is far and away my favorite.
The restaurant is a family owned hole in the wall, so most of their dishes are made directly from fresh ingredients rather than frozen/packaged/processed things and the difference is very noticeable in the taste.
The place is also very cheap.
Recommend you go sometime.
author: Alex F.

description: Lunch special is such a good deal! I would definitely come back and get the two dish combo again. The basil leaf chicken is a little plain taste but the red curry I got was reli good!
author: Monnikka M.

description:
One of my favorite Thai food places in the city

Kind of hidden from Clement street, but worth looking for
author: Alec H.

description: After a long day of moving my daughter into her new apartment, we were anxious to find some food for delivery in a neighborhood where we were unfamiliar with the offerings.  Luckily, Yelp came to the rescue and didn't disappoint!  We ordered Pad Thai noodles, mango sticky rice and a Thai Iced Tea.  Not only did the food show up pretty quickly, but it was still hot and very delicious!  My daughter is a vegetarian and is happy they offer so many veggie choices. She is looking forward to trying more dishes in the months ahead from her new apartment!
author: Jody T.

description:
Favorite Thai place in the City! I only discovered this place after seeing such a long wait for King's Thai around the corner.

Finally there is a place that makes peanut-free panang curry, sweet and fragrant. Highly recommend you ordering that plus their Pad See Ew. If you want an appetizer, I would suggest you trying the Tom Yum soup. Delicious hot and spicy shrimp soup.

Restaurant is small and limited in seating but I haven't had to wait to get seating every time I go.

Take-away: Order the Panang Curry, Pad See Ew, and Tom Yum soup and run with it!
author: Henry P.

description: As much as I love this place for ordering online, we thought it would be easier to come in and order on our way home from a long day of work, only to have to wait for over 45 minutes for 1/2 of our to go order. No one seemed concerned or in a hurry to prepare our food or that we were waiting with a bag of 1/2 of our food on the table. We were never offered water or checked on us. Especially when nothing was ordered out of the ordinary. I'll order online through Eat24 but I won't call in or dine in ever again, I'll stick to the middle man. Poor Customer Service.
author: Allison T.

description:
Pad Thai was meh.
Mango salad was pretty good, but it only came w two shrimp.  I'd go back, but not for the noodles.
author: Robert W.

description: Roaches! Roach came from under the table and ran through a plate of food. The waitress had no sense of urgency/didn't care. She even charged tried charge us for the food... wtf.
author: Rob L.

description: Had the shrimp pad Thai,yellow curry chicken and steamed rice.Everything tasted awesome.Friendly service.The place in kinda small but otherwise amazing
author: Harriet A.

description:
Small little Thai restaurant surround by so many other Thai restaurants.   

I normally do take out here.  They are consistently good.  It's hard to find consistency with some places.  I get the same thing hot and sour soup with veggies, pad Thai, and/or pad see ew.  I am a creature of habit.  I like the same things. 

My only gripe is when they say 20 mins for take out and it ends up taking 50 mins.  Usually happens on a Friday
and Saturday night.
author: anita h.

description: I got delivery here and ordered the papaya salad, not reading carefully enough I supposed, but was shocked how spicy it was and then realized it had chili in it....who puts chili in salad? So spicy it hurt. One star for coconut soup being good but buyer beware!
author: Lauren C.

description: Fast delivery & delicious. Accommodate  modifications well (e.g., requests like less oil, more vegetables, soft vs fried to tofu, etc).
author: Kimberly S.

description: I eat at Thai Time 3-4 times a week. The ingredients are fresh, the staff is friendly/professional and the flavor is spectacular. All for an extremely fair price, especially for San Francisco. I HIGHLY recommend the 12. Larp Ped, 47. Pad Krapow with ground chicken, 50. pad ma keur with ground chicken, 19. tom yum gai, 41. gang panang, 38. Gang keaw, 76. Pad se-ew, 77. Pad kee now, and to finish it all off, some mango sticky rice ;). Make sure to get all the dishes ped mak mak (extra spicy). Shoutout to Will and P for the great service!
author: Kyle V.

description: Not too sure what all the hype is about this place. Yelp reviewers have failed me on this one. Came here on a Saturday at 725 p.m. with 5 people and there's really no hostess. It's a super super small place. 7 tables inside that could fit at most 25 people inside. You put ur name on the list that's on the outside of the door. The wait was about 30 minutes. We got seated inside that was a table for 4 people. They added a chair to the end of the table, which barely had any moving room. We were seated and then they asked us if we wanted to move over to the next table since it was a little roomier, so we did. There's two servers. They looked super stressed out dealing with 7 tables. We had to flag them down multiple times to get our order in. We ordered our food, got an appetizer and then our main meals. We asked for water, but didn't get any water until 20 mins after we ordered. It literally took 55 mins to get our food and our appetizer came out 5 mins before that. By this time, we were super hangry and getting real irritated. When you're super hangry and then you eat any food, it's suppose to taste like the best thing you've ever eaten. However, this was not the case with our food. I got the pad Thai tofu, which was probably one of the worst pad thais I've ever eaten. Not sure what people are raving about their food, but it is not good. They use a sauce bottle that my sister saw in their kitchen for their pad Thai (since you have to walk through their kitchen) in order to get to the small bathroom.  The reason for their poor service is because the servers are too busy dealing with their togo orders that people are ordering. They put that a priority before the people who are coming into the restaurant to eat. They could care less about their customers inside the restaurant. So overall, this place is a big NO NO for me. I will definitely not be returning ever. So if you want to wait to get seated and then wait even longer to get your food and get poor service, then this place is for you. If not, there's plenty of other restaurants that are so much better that I would rather go and enjoy.
author: Cat L.

description: Incredibly friendly service! The food is delicious. The menu looks awesome. I just had green curry with shrimp, brown rice and coconut but it's all perfect.
author: Alexis B.

description:
I have ordered from this restaurant in the past, and, enjoyed their food.  However, last night, I ordered thru Yelp, and got a confirmation back that it would take 45-60 minutes to deliver.  Cool....or so I thought.  At 60 minutes I went through the Yelp online message help center and a nice guy helped me.  He told me the restaurant had said it would take 90 minutes for my food (I wouldn't have ordered the food if I knew this upfront...and....I hadn't been told this upfront).  Then the Yelp guy tried to contact the restaurant.  He told me that he could not reach the restaurant directly, or the owner of the restaurant.  By this point, we were passed the 90 minute mark, probably close to 1 hour 45 minutes from the time I ordered.  The nice Yelp guy came back and told me that without the restaurant responding at all, he recommended canceling my order altogether, and refunding my money.  ARRGGGHHH....  OK...... what could I do or say?  The Yelp guy was nice, but, now it was almost 9:30 pm and I was very hungry.  No delivered food for me last night.  I had to dig through the freezer instead.  

I am not sure what's up with this restaurant, but they completely failed me last night.  
Yelp guy was nice.......but overall...... a bummer of an experience trying to get delivery last night.
author: Michael D.

description: Went here for pickup on a late night crave. The food was very good. No complaints from any of the 3 people who shared. -1 star due to the fact that they served the pad thai in a plate that had a huge hole, which caused the oil to leave all over my grey sweater smh. It almost seemed intentionally done. Besides that I would Def order from here again if I was in the area.
author: Alex C.

description: Disappointed! We yelped and went all the way to this restaurant from Mission Bay. Its an extremely tiny place (not that I care about the size as long as the food is good). We were 4 people along with an infant. When we entered there were only 2 tables available. One with 2 seats and the other with 4. A couple was seated on the bigger table. The gentleman offered to move to the smaller one but neither the lady who was with him nor the hostess showed any interest. The hostess's reaction was more like "you better leave, you are just blocking the whole space!" Well, maybe I should have made a reservation in advance but overall, will never make the adventure of spending 20 bucks one way on cab and realizing it is a total  waste of time and money.
author: Mohan C.

description:
Amazing, just as amazing as it could possibly be.

Tiny place, very cozy, friendly staff, very good food and well priced. 
This is the go-to place for Thai for me and my husband.

:)
author: Giulianna P.

description: Their menu has a large "Vegetarian" section. My immediate reaction was great! Not many Thai restaurants do that. So I was happy. Just to make sure like I always do at Asian cuisine restaurants, I asked the waitress if the vegetarian dishes have any fish sauce in it. She said yes they do without even blinking the eye! Fish = an animal = not vegetarian and so is not its oil! I understand if certain dishes at a Thai restaurant has fish sauce or clam sauce in it and cannot be made 100% vegetarian. It happens to me all the time. When you explicitly put a section in your menu saying "Vegetarian section" and not honor it 100% that is outrageous!
author: Rakesh K.

description: Excellent food and quick service. Went to this restaurant in a hungry early lunch time and doesn't get disappointed.
author: Vijey V.

description:
You know how i keep bashing on Thai restaurants in the Bay Area.

Well...

I have finally found my match. Thai Time is always the right time! I recently came here after picking up my new Iphone 5 (let the bashing begin) from the Radio Shack around the corner. It was around 9:45pm and the restaurant was closing down, but they graciously sat us down and treated us like it was 7:00pm and the dinner rush had just started. 

This place is small! I mean probably one of the smallest sit down restaurant I have ever been to. There are around 5 tables. The restroom is all the way in the back. Cool thing about that is, you get to walk through their small kitchen. The people cooking your food looks like Thai moms, so you know it's about to be on like tampons. 

It took my friend and I awhile to order as their menu is fairly large. After the WW2 that was going on inside my head, I finally settled with the angels wings to start and i know i know... pad thai. I had to! Everyone on yelp said it was the best and might as well start with the pad thai when visiting a Thai restaurant for the first time. Am i right folks? 

Morale of the story is, BEST PAD THAI EVARR! It was super flavorful, fresh, and perfectly cooked. Squeeze a bit of lime on top and mix with the shredded carrots and cabbage and just go to town on that thing like an 8 year old girl at a Justin Bieber concert. This is all fairly cheap and the Angels wings were angelic. 

One complaint though. The cups for water are so small. Like 2 gulps small. They do keep refilling the water, but i feel really bad having the waitress come back every 5 minutes. 

Enough chit chatting. Head over there for some slap yo mama type of stuff Thai food. I don't know if they take reservations, but I would advise on doing so. The line was very long like around 8.
author: Tung T.

description:
The food is from fair to very good (depends on the dishes). 
I think that they need to put more soul in their soups. I tried two different ones and wasn't impressed. 
But over all is reliable. 
Service is very polite and courteous. 
Very cute tiny little place. Almost romantic.
author: Bruno S.

description:
I hate to give this place a bad rating because their service is so friendly and pleasant.

but it all comes down to the food, and Thai Time does not deliver. The first tip off was that all the dishes were the wrong color! The Tom Kha soup was brown, not white.  The yellow curry was green. They just didn't taste like the things you'd expect. chicken is dry. Pad Thai somehow too sweet and too bland at the same time. the flavors were way off.

we did not enjoy this place as much as other yelp reviewers seem to have.
author: Jimming C.

description:
It's so disappointing that I'm going to have to write this place off.  I've been a long time customer, but the service is so terrible, that I won't go back again.  It's been declining for over a year but tonight really sealed the deal.  

We waited for over 25 minutes and were totally ignored.  The table that came in after us was more aggressive flagging the waitress down so she took their order first.  Ok, we'll be next, we thought, but no.  We continued to wait and the waitress wouldn't even make eye contact.  Then my friend, who is the most patient person in the world, told her we were ready to order and we sat there for another 10 min.  It's wasn't until we got up to leave that she started to approach our table.   There were no apologies and she seem relieved we were leaving.

It was this way last week too, but they were short staffed and only one waitress was working.  

After several times of similar service I'm not going there anymore.  My friend and his family have also been long time customers, but no more.
author: Cynthia R.

description: Delicious curry sauce, fresh veggies, lovely jasmine rice. The mango sticky rice dessert was fantastic! Great attentive service. Small restaurant with huge flavor- loved it!
author: Melanie E.

description:
Atmosphere: great little shack type place with low key lighting. Was very quiet and small, I really liked that about this place. 

Service: waiter took so long to take our order even though there were only 2 tables with people seated. Wasn't rush hour. Waiter never served my wife and I drinks at all, even though I asked for water.. He also never asked how we liked the food.. 

Food: the food was okay.. Wouldn't want to eat it again. We both ordered the Pad Thai w/ tofu but my wife's didn't have tofu in it. They used too much sauce and noodles weren't cooked long enough. 

Price: great price. We left with a bill under $20 for the 2 of us. That's a great price. 

3 = good atmosphere and price but terrible service and food. Didn't hate my life but I don't ever wanna eat there again.
author: Alvin A.

description: I come here all the time, easily my new favorite Thai place. Always delicious, huge portions
author: K. A.

description: I had the chicken pad see ew here and it was really good! Highly recommend Thai Time. It's not expensive and a great alternative to your usual dinner spot.
author: Cruz K.

description: I saw the reviews for Thai Time and decided to try it out. The atmosphere was intimate with 8 or so tables and the decor added on to the experience. My boyfriend & I tried the sample appetizer, shrimp pad thai and red curry-all of which we enjoyed! Usually, the pad thai I've tried at various restaurants on Clement or Geary are too salty or don't have enough flavor but this one was yummy! The staff was extremely friendly and I'll be sure to come back.
author: Kathleen T.

description:
I love Thai Time!

They deliver and have delicious food! I really enjoy the Green Curry with sticky rice.  Their Pad Thai is also really good.  

2 things that to look out for at Thai Time: Every time I ask for 2 orders of sticky rice they never give me both.  Make sure to check your order before you leave or if doing delivery make sure you have them read the order back to you.  The other thing is that it takes FOREVER to order to go or have delivery. This is probably because the restaurant is very tiny, has a very small kitchen and is always busy.  Not Thai Times fault but be aware that often times delivery/Take out takes over an hour. 

I cannot speak for dine in wait times because I have never sat down to eat at the restaurant.  

I most definitely will continue to satisfy my Thai food cravings at Thai Time.
author: Brittany N.

description: My go to for takeout in the neighborhood and a cute place to sit down, too. Green curry with duck is my go to.
author: Mike C.

description: Delicious! the Tom Kha soup was yummy and the delivery came promptly.
author: Jesse C.

description: Service for such a small place in one word Ignored. Possibly the worse pad Thai very wet. We asked for tofu only got count them 5 small cubes in the dish. Catfish curry tooo sweet. My wife asked for green beans with nothing else she got carrots mushrooms (she does not like either) sorry never come again and won't recommend
author: Ricardo H.

description: The food here is pretty good. I've had the pad thai and pad kee mow, which were not the best I've had but definitely decent for the $7 price. 3 stars are awarded due to the painstaking slow service. My friend and I waited for 45 minutes just to have our orders taken. My suggestion is to order delivery or pick-up, it seems like the fastest and easiest way to get your food.
author: Allison D.

description: Ordered delivery. Too as long as one would expect at 7pm on a Friday night, 60minutes. Food was amazing! Medium spicy level was perfect level of hot, the thai iced teas were on point, and the chicken pad thai was one of the best I've ever had. Perfect to fix my thai food cravings.
author: Chris K.

description: You know you want it, so just do it! I recommend the stuffed angel wings and the green curry duck over rice. Nuff said.
author: Viv V.

description:
Definitely hole in a wall. People tend to look for restaurants on Clement, but don't miss this.  Not on Clement but worth check it out.  Came here after church service and it wasn't busy at all.  It's pretty small place, but their food is great.  
Ordered Thai time wings and fried rice and mmm good!  Have enough flavor and they give you a lot too.  
Oh yea when you use the bathroom, you'll definitely go through their bathroom coz the place is that small.
author: Claire J.

description: This is one of the best Thai food restaurants in the inner Richmond district. It is cozy and the food is delicious.
author: Sam P.

description: The place was homely and the food very good and cheap. All dishes served were excellent. Wit the spices not to prominent and on the side, even my kid enjoyed it.
author: Ernst E.

description: I really like this little hole-in-the-wall in Richmond.  Their menu is HUGE and they have some wonderful regional dishes and they can make it super hot at your request.  The staff has always been friendly in spite of the occasional delivery chaos.  Parking can be a pain, but if you're looking for some legit Thai in northern SF you can't go wrong.
author: Andreas H.

description: Tiny restaurant with great food!  The prices are reasonable.  Service is very good.  It is a fun little place.  Give it a try!
author: Kathleen B.

description:
My heart is torn b/c my go-to thai restaurant in SF is Siam Lotus on Haight Street, however, after visiting Thai Time during a bike ride with friends, I'm afraid my heart yearns for another.

First of all, the amount of vegetarian and vegan options is amazing. My fiance ordered the pad thai along with drunken noodles (both with tofu) and each dish was super flavorful. I started with the pad thai and thought it was good (with just the right amount of spice), but then had the drunken noodles and it was amazing! By far my favorite dish. I ordered the panang curry, which was great as well. It included a variety of fresh veggies and tofu which kicked it up a notch in my book. For all of you spice fans, this is the dish for you. 

So short story long, this place is awesome...just go.
author: Kelly L.

description:
8 tables, with public parking across the street.  Wonderfully flavorful duck curry (though I would have been happier with more duck and less duck fat.)  Great service, good prices, ample portions.

My personal favorite, though...they take the time to finely grind the red chilies.  I'm always fishing down to the bottom of the jar for the powder.

Yummy place, if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Theresa B.

description:
I eat Thai Time 2-3 times a week... it's that good. 
Small, hole in the wall restaurant, but what is better than that?
I love their cucumber salad and I almost always order Pad See Ew (with thin rice noodles) SO good.

I have tried a lot of thai food places in the city and this is still the best one yet.
author: Rachel E.

description: I absolutely love this place! Been going here for years and it is always consistent. I feel the prices are super fair as well. My favs are the Thai time fried rice and Tom Kha soup!
author: Tessa T.

description: Outstanding small Thai restaurant loaded with great dishes, reasonable prices and good service. Noodle dishes , soup, satay and other Thai plates we usually get hit the mark. Very pleased with this restaurant!
author: Daniel N.

description:
Review not for the food- didn't get a chance to try it.

Hours show that they are open on Sundays at this time, but the phone goes straight to a voicemail box,  for one, and two it's full! Disappointed.
author: Sira L.

description: Lunch prices were great, under $9, pick two items, rice and soup, can't beat that! Especially with the quality of food provided. This food was authentic and truly yummy. My tastebuds are so happy right now!
author: Courtney B.

description:
The Business: Let me start with, these folks do not deliver to the Sunset but.....I called on a Sunday afternoon and they said they would do it. YAY!

The Delivery. They said 50 minutes, they were here in 20, all food was STEAMING hot. Delivery guys were very nice and professional.

The Food:
Thai Time Combo ($10.95)- This was probably my least favourite dish. It is A LOT of fried food and I am not that into fried food. When I say a lot, I mean a ton of fried tofu, 2 huge egg roll, 2 big fried prawn, 4 huge fish cake and 2 of Garee Puff. Out of all these appetizer I would say the Garee Puff and the Fried Shrimp are the best.

Kao Pad Kra Prow ($7.95)- By my standards, this is good for the price. You get a HUGE portion, I got pork and there was meat in every bite. I didn't taste a lot of that typical grilled flavour I like in Thai fried rice, but it was fine. The bell peppers and onions were fresh and not overcooked.

Gang Keaw Pla Guy($7.95)- This was my favourite dish of them all. So much seafood and the curry was very spicy, even though I ordered medium. I can take a lot of spice so my suggestion, if you can too, the medium is perfect. The curry didn't have bitter taste, nor was it too salty. Great creamy taste, not oily at all.

Pumpkin Talay($9.75)- This is the sautee dish, not the curry. This was quite delicious. I never thought about pumpkin and seafood together but this dish balanced the two well. The pumpkin was cooked to perfection, and again, so much seafood I was not disappointed. Just so you know, the scallops in this dish are the baby scallops, not the huge ones which I think makes for a better dish because all the pieces are bite-sized.

I will definitely order again if they will deliver to me :)
author: emma g.

description: I love this place, priced really reasonably, delicious food and fast service. I will note that even the mild is a tad spicy, so adjust orders accordingly!
author: Kimberly K.

description: This has become my preferred place while in the area. They have displaced King of Thai because King has moved away from it's roots of providing solid, reasonable priced Thai in minimalist environments.  Plus Thai Time has more variety on their menu.  We ordered a stir fried ginger chicken dish & wide noodles w/beef - wish I could remember their actual names.  Both were great.  The ginger chicken dish sauce was super yummy over steamed rice.
author: Kim S.

description: The seafood soup in a clay pot was absolutely delicious. The duck curry was good. Not too fatty and have plenty of meat to chew on. However they have to clean off the duck feathers a little bit better. And also I just love the coconut in my food. Price was reasonable. And please get the sticky rice. It makes the curry much better with sticky rice.
author: Michael Q.

description:
FOOD: Best Tom Kha Gai soup I've ever had. All the flavors were delicious but still balanced and it came served in a nice stone wear pot with a top. Very tasty noodle dish as well. The brown rice was a little soft and clumpy. Overall, best Thai food in the city and I can't wait to return.
SERVICE: Helpful and friendly.
AMBIANCE: The kitchen is basically IN the restaurant which was cool, but doesn't lend itself to a formal dining experience. Parking can be a challenge.
author: Evan K.

description: Excellent food and amazingly friendly staff!  We had the coconut crepe and the green duck curry with Thai tea, everything was spot on. They didn't even mind that we stayed late to chat (even when it was getting busy, which it was on weekday night), they just kept refilling our water glasses.  The restroom is through the kitchen so you can see how clean and organized they keep the kitchen.  I'll definitely be returning!
author: Michelle W.

description: Honestly nothing bad to say about my visit. The bamboo shoots were cooked perfectly, that's probably a first - I usually don't eat them because they're too tough, but not here! Tons of veggies and great prices too!
author: Morgan V.

description:
Ordered the following at dinner on a Saturday 

Chicken Satay- A
Mango Salad- B (delicious, but we wanted more shrimp/calamari)
Green curry Salmon- A+
Thai iced coffee- A

Service was friendly and attentive.  Ambiance was very pleasant 

Total bill before tax/Tip- $30 !
author: Nicolas G.

description:
Thai Time saved the day for me one night when I expected to go to Golden Buddha with my date. We were both very hungry and were shocked and sad to find Golden Buddha closed, despite the fact that according to their hours, they should have been open. Not knowing the food options in that area very well, I pulled out Yelp and plugged in vegetarian. Right towards the top of the list Thai Time came up and sounded like an excellent choice.

Well all you Yelpers, you were not wrong. Thai Time was great. First, the service was perfectly attentive and friendly. The servers and hostess came at all the right times to make sure we were taken care of, and always re-filled my hot thai tea as I just finished my cup. And of course the food was incredibly delicious. We started with the Garee Puff appetizer. It came with a great little cucumber salad and I savored every bite. Before we knew it, our entrees came out too. I went with one of my Thai staples, Pra Ram Tofu. It was a huge serving, and despite doing my best not to look like a pig, I couldn't help but finish off the whole thing.

Not only would I come here again, I'd go out of my way to do so. There are a lot of Thai places in SF but so many are mediocre at best. Thai Time is really a grade above the rest.

P.S.
This place is very small, so it might not be a great destination for a huge party of people.
author: Jon T.

description:
Thai time still remains my #1 place to get pad thai in SF, ever since 2007. 


I also decided to order the pad kee mao, and it wasn't really that great..I should just stick to the pad thai here.
author: Janet Z.

description:
This place was amazing! It's small but the food is delicious and the waiter was very nice. I ordered #73 which was a pad thai (can't remember the name), which tasted home cooked.  My boyfriend ordered duck which was sweet and tender.  The homemade lemonade is a must! It's tangy and sweet and you can tell it was made there that day.  

We were seated right away, and the food came quickly after we ordered. We are definitely coming again!
author: Alicia Q.

description:
Still crammed and still delicious!

The last time I went (I still remember what we ordered -- pad thai, stir-fried clear noodle, and fried rice), everything had a bitter aftertaste somehow and were relatively bland. But this time everything was very well-balanced and tasty.

I also discovered a new favorite: Mango Salad! Sweet and tangy -- cute and delicious. Squid perfectly cooked. The dressing was pungent but didn't overpower the mango.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Do not let the outside of this place fool you.
The food is amazing!
I ordered something off the specials. I forgot the name but it was deep fried chicken wings that were covered in panang curry....EPIC!
If you like Thai, you will like this place.
author: Shelby S.

description: Small place good Thai food!  The fried tofu was not greasy at all - very light.  Sauce was good.  Good for a date and or single.  Service wasn't bad.  Soup was well made.  Will have to try the other dishes and maybe update my review.  Till then - Good eats!
author: Chris S.

description: Loved this place. Just what we needed after a long day in the city. Sweet servers, delicious food and great prices. The Mango Salad, Pad See Ew and Panang Curry were loaded with meat and vegetables. Not great for groups (small venue) but otherwise a great and affordable choice.
author: Sara V.

description:
Decided to try something new for dinner and stopped by thai time. The restaurant is super teenie, about 4-5 tables (12 people max?). 

There are many thai restaurants in the area and I can always rely on them to be authentic. I liked that they have a whole page of veggie options. We ordered the hot and sour soup, pad kee mao, and red pumpkin curry with soft tofu. Everything was pretty good and I liked that the soup came out in a ceramic bowl with a fire underneath. 

Although everything was ok, nothing stood out as spectacular to me. I will stick to my usual spot down the street.
author: Stine H.

description: One of my favorite places. It doesn't look fancy though. And it's really small. However, the food is absolutely delicious. And staff is super friendly. I'd definitely recommend this place.
author: Dim O.

description: Real gem of a place.  Everything I've had here has been prepared to perfection.  Large menu selection and daily specials.  Exceptional quality.
author: John P.

description: This is now the 4th Thai restaurant in the city that I've tried. Out of those 4, this would be 4th. It's such a cute little place and the staff was very nice. The prices are excellent, and the food comes out fast! My daughter and I have a standard meal we always split and then my husband and I usually try something spicy. We had chicken satay with peanut sauce. The chicken was ok, the peanut sauce was good! We also had chicken pad Thai, which is my favorite, but not this one. It had no peanut flavor at all, and the chicken texture and taste was bad. I have no idea what the flavor was, but it is not a standard pad Thai flavor. My husband ordered the lunch plate with the red curry chicken and basil chicken. Red curry chicken is my other favorite Thai dish so I tried some of his. I thought it was just ok. It was bland, if that's even possible with curry, but it was. At that point, I decided not to try the basil chicken. I had so much hope for this being our new go to Thai, everything was great about it, except the food.
author: Stacey R.

description:
My first expérience :) 
The food was delicious 
We got the curry and some noodles 
We recommend the combo appetizers ! 
A family restaurant with few table : you feel at home ^^ 
Prices are correct and portions are good size ! 
I recommend this restaurants
author: Laura B.

description:
I love this place, it's a great little hole in the wall that serves tasty, fresh and authentic thai food. The waitresses are always very friendly, the food is always delicious and prices are very reasonable.

I usually start with their mango salad and then continue with any of their main dishes. I have never been disappointed. Portions are large so you'd better be hungry!
author: Nicolas G.

description: Very accommodating for our group of 14. Portions were generous and the price was super reasonable. The vegetarian panang was delicious and their mango cucumber salad was really refreshing. Everyone in our group from age 8 to 74 loved it
author: Adam T.
