description: San Francisco's best kept secret Thai restaurant. So many varieties of flavors. My pickiest friends and family love it here. It's homestyle and mind blowing.
author: Dexter H.

description: Thai time has lovely service, warm, cozy atmosphere, good food and reasonable prices. I ordered the masamun curry with chicken and steamed rice. The curry was really good and flavorful, although I would have liked more richness and peanut flavor ( like a TBS of peanut butter) the sauce was a little watery and it really needed a touch of sweetness (which is funny coming out of my mouth since I hate sweet curry). But overall really good. I would return here happily to try other dishes just for the sweet service.
author: Emma H.

description:
Ok. Not terrible, but not worth another visit. 

Service is good. Space is clean. 

No spicy chile heat in the papaya salad, tom kha soup, and the green curry, which is a Thai travesty. Over cooked red tilapia. Yum nuer was tasty, but still not special like Vietnamese beef rolls can be.
author: Chris Z.

description: The larb Ped (duck) is outstanding- easily the best I've ever had, and why I keep coming back. But everything else I've eaten here- including wings, pad Thai, Tom Kha Talay, and their Panang curry- has just been pretty standard.
author: Doctor S.

description: A tiny little restaurant in the Inner Richmond that you might not even notice passing by. Cute and cozy decoration though it is really tiny space inside. My friend and I shared a Kao kook ga pi and Pad Thai, and we were amazed that they were both so good. I'm normally not a big fan of rice, but I gotta say the rice was tender with a touch of coconut taste. Went with beef and dried shrimp and some sliced crunchy mango. Pad Thai was very good as well. Will come back another time
author: Zisele N.

description: Food was cheap, good, and fast service! Not 5 star great but it was really yummy. Am definitely going back again.
author: Theresa B.

description: One of my absolute favorite Thai places in San Francisco. Their green curry is phenomenal!
author: Erin A.

description:
Hole in the wall defined.

This is a wonderful neighborhood Thai restaurant that has delicious food that is cooked well and made with love. The ambiance is small, and the staff little.  But even when I went to the washroom (that is through the kitchen), there is a care and consideration in making their meals in their humble kitchen.

- Kung Roll: The delicate prawn wrapped in wonton and fried was light and appetizing.
- Gang Talay in Green Curry: A delicious green curry dish with delectable seafood that is fresh and appetizing.
- Pad Se-Ew Fresh, not too greasy, and overall a classic dish.

Thai time is a great Thai restaurant in the city, that has beautful food and is delicious.
author: Natalie G.

description:
Good food,

Every random dish was impressive.

Need to refill water more often. Other than that, i know ill b back!
author: One L.

description:
This place is great for dine-in or take-out Thai food. They're super affordable, friendly, and have a great online ordering system. They do offer delivery as well but you have to call the order in.

My BF always gets the gra pow (ground pork) and it's perfectly spiced each and every time. My favorite item on the menu is the tofu gra pow krob. It's fried tofu served in a creamy garlicky curry sauce with mushrooms and carrots, then topped with crispy basil. It's HELLA good.
author: Grace C.

description: Ordered 58. Gra  Praw Talay, a stir fry with calamari, prams,  scallops and mussels worth basil. It was amazing,  all the seafood was cooked perfectly.  Friendly, fast service and really low prices.  I loved that they have Thai iced tea available without the cream/sweetener.
author: Sarah G.

description: Delicious green salmon curry. Mango salad was also great. Felt like being back in Thailand. Loved it!
author: Brian S.

description:
My girlfriend has eaten here many times before, and we came here this afternoon.. she was raving about the soup. After a long day of running errands, we were hungry enough to eat anything. The only thing we didn't want to eat was food with flies in it. Well that's what we got.

We ordered two bowls of soup. She found the first small fly. At first it was difficult to tell it was fly, but upon further inspecting we could definitely see the legs. It was only one small fly, no big deal. We then found multiple flies in both of our soups. We never send anything back, but were disgusted at this point and called the waitress over. We pointed out a spoon with 3 flies on it. She took it to the chef/owner and showed it to him. They didn't think the things with legs on them were flies, but didn't offer a rebuttal to our claim. We weren't eating the soups at this point and asked for the bill. Graciously, they didn't change us for the fly soup.

As we were leaving, the owner/manager told us "don't come back". We weren't sure if that's what he said, and asked for clarification. He said yes, don't come back. We were astounded that he would say that, and said he was upset because we complained about a fly. We responded by saying there were multiple flies, and that's not okay. After a little back and forth, we were in a yelling match!! Obviously we will not be returning. Don't support this place!

Summary:
- FLIES IN FOOD
- Management gets upset if you complain about flies
- Management will yell at you to not return after complaining about flies
author: Gregg K.

description:
Outstanding angel wings.

Decent pad thai.
author: Inigo M.

description: I've been coming here since 2001.  All dishes are consistently delicious (my favorite tofu satay and dessert roti in the city), service is great and fast, restaurant is cozy and clean, parking isn't too bad, and the prices are very right.  What more could you want?
author: Kim Lan G.

description:
They have great food here .. i am fan of green curry and regularly visit the place .. !

But, their thai tea is pretty bad .. guys plz work on it and serve in bigger glasses, less ice even for a dollar more :)

Thanks for your kind services.
author: Deepak A.

description: Best Tom Kha w prawns I've ever had. I know that sounds crazy and I keep telling myself to reign it in a just say "one of" the best, but consistenly, time and time again it does not disappoint. Friendly service, reasonable prices. Girlfriend loves the rotee and is surprisingly hard to find elsewhere. Swears by the panang curry too. Would be 5 stars but dined in for the first time last night and leftovers were removed from the table w/o asking if we wanted them to go. We were engaged in conversation so didn't notice until after too late. Will still continue order from them though, was just a bummer since we love our leftovers. Also, Thai style fried rice is not as good as King of Thai around the corner. Four and a half stars
author: Kareem C.

description: I love their food even though their place was small and cozy its worth the try! And plus its cheap!! Their food portion are also big. also their service are great. Quick and good!! The Thai Time wings (i think its their specialty menu) are the best! YASSSSSSSSSS !!!!!
author: Janikka R.

description: Call me basic but I always judge a Thai place by their pad thai...it's like Spaghetti at an Italian restaurant: If you can't get that right then I am skeptical about everything else. Thankfully this place hasn't disappointed yet, it's always fresh and flavorful. Some of my other favorites here are Tom Kha Gai Soup and the Panang Curry. Very reasonable pricing, quick seating and usually easy parking makes Thai Time a go-to.
author: Rachel H.

description:
I've given up on regularly eating Thai food because it all tastes the same, like it all came out of the same fish sauce, sugar, soybean oil factory. 

Until I came here. I'm never on this side of the park (I'm an Irving / Judah girl) but here I was, and I wanted filling curry to make my bones warm. 

That was exactly what I got, in addition to an incredible, complex beef larb salad, a dish most Thai restaurants phone in, but here it was a giant portion of big, juicy pieces of meat and an awesomely spicy cilantro dressing. 

I now have curry for dinner. And I'm coming back to Clement.
author: Maria D.

description:
Thank you so much for being in SF! This is like my 5th time coming here, yesterday was the best! 

I'm very sensitive to msg so this time i asked for NO MSG - they actually did it and did not feel sick! Had Duck, Talapia, and Salmon. My fav was the duck perfectly done beautiful curry. And of course Dessert Roti 2 of them! YUM!

Servers On Point - I didn't have to ask to refill my water! Big Plus!

I hope they get a bigger place. Keep UP the great work! Quality...Quality!
author: Thomas C.

description:
Sticky Rice, Brown Rice, Garlic Rice, Jasmine Rice...All the same price for $1.50! Got rice? Go get some!

One of the few things I like about this place is that they have Thai Iced Tea for...drum roll...$1.95. I haven't seen this price anywhere else.  This drink usually cost starting at $2.50 and up. 

Of course, the ladies who work there are so friendly and nice. Kudos!

Because of these little goodies at a super affordable price, I will keep coming back to eat some good o' Thai food. :)

P.S. Celebrated my 1-year anniversary of living in SF...Thai Time was one of the first places I tried in 2009. It's still sooooo goooddd! Yummy for my "grumbling" tummy.
author: Deborah C.

description: We really enjoyed our food here! The kids loved their spring rolls and chicken satay. My husband and I shared the pad Thai and the Thai time noodles, both were delicious. I know they can't "help" it, but the one thing I was turned off by was walking through the kitchen to get to the bathroom .
author: Jackie K.

description:
Charm, charm and a little more charm. Cozy decor, this place oozes ambiance, although you'd never think to look into this place with its weather blue awning. This place only has something like 30 seats on 7-8 tables so you might have to wait a few for someone to leave should it be busy.  When we got there on a Tues at 7pm is was full, but we luckily got a seat, while a couple behind had to wait 10 mins.

Hot Thai Tea is delicious, almost has a hint of vanilla. Ordered Veggie Pad kee mow. Very healthy helping of food, and a bargain for the price.  The food is good, and satisfying, but no better than others I've been too.  I 
think its the price and ambiance that makes this place a worth while visit.
author: Jean Francois K.

description:
(In the tone of Aziz Ansari's whyyoupushinonme) whyyouhatingonrichmond?

The Inner Richmond has a surprising number of one of a kind, foodie haven, hole in the wall spots. Thai Time is one of them. Inside is a cozy little space that probably fits ~30 people. Don't sit by the door when it's freezing outside and you have a jacket that only looks pretty. That's more a memo to me.

Start with the Thai Time appetizer. The crab cakes were the only thing on the dish that was lacking. Everything else was enjoyable (and not to mention, FRIED!) The Pad See Ew and the Green Curry were delicious. Mid-meal, order a Thai iced tea and enjoy the goodness that is condensed milk. It will soothe your tongue that is on fire from the spices and make your belly a happy one.

Parking in Richmond is doable, so drive on over. Thai time can't come soon enough, wheeeh!
author: Rosa L.

description:
Gang Ped and pad see eeww is the bizzzommmmbb!

Love the food here.
author: Rod T.

description: Very solid, delicious Thai food, we generally get delivery but have eaten in the (small!) restaurant on occasion as well. Love the gang panang (red curry) and the green fried rice is a MUST! Forgo regular rice and get that instead! I am also a fan of the eggplant with peppers. It's our go-to local Thai restaurant.
author: Annika M.

description: First time here to this hole in the wall neighborhood Thai place.  Very authentic and good portion too.  Will come back to try the other dishes and maybe the mango sticky rice too.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I first came here with a friend for lunch and as always, I ordered the pad thai.

I have to say I think this is the most delicious pad thai I've had compared to all the similar tasting places. Comes with bamboo shoots! YUMMY!

I tried the appetizer boneless wings on another occasion and it comes with a fabulous dipping sauce! Go try!
author: Mabel Y.

description: Tough to find really good thai food but I have to say this is one of the better thai restaurants.
author: Julie C.

description:
1.95 thai ice tea???! hells yeah!!! and its as good as KOT!

had the thai time fried rice and its delicious. rice is cooked to perfection it isn't mushy or overcooked. theres a good amount of broccoli, choy, shrimp and calamari. its a nice even amount, you wont find more veggies then the seafood. nicely flavored and decent. also theres pineapple in the rice too!

my friend had the fried chicken over rice and she loved it especially with the dipping sauce. it had a nice crunchy battered outside and hot juicy chicken inside, it was definitely drool worthy. it was paired with a kind of sweet sauce and it was so delicious. we are coming back here again! and prices were pretty decent about 7.95-8.95 for alot of their rice plates!
author: Stella J.

description:
We had Pad See Yew J and Crispy Fried tofu cooked with red chili, peanut and crispy basil, with Garee Puff for appetizer.  The appetizers were crisp, light, and super yummy!  The tofu was like candy, hard to stop eating!
A delightful, cozy little spot, seemed like lots of regulars coming in and getting takeout.
Would definitely come back!
author: Michelle D.

description:
So delicious - My new favorite Thai spot. 

Friendly, knowledgable, & helpful staff. Our glasses were never empty!
The Pad Thai was amongst the best I have ever consumed. We also ordered the Green Rotee - the perfect amount of spice and just bursting with authentic thai flavors.

I loved the charm, ambiance, and small, yet cozy vibe. Plates are large enough to share & prices are reasonable.
author: Briana F.

description:
I'd give it a 3 stars because.. 
+ Clean place
+ Nice decor 
- Small (probably 8-10 tables..) 
+ Great service 
+ large proportions of food 
+ Low/decent prices 
+ Friends I came here with said the food was good or alright. 
- Why did I get a stomach ache..?

Why the loss of a star? 
I ordered #65 (Green Fried Rice w/ Chicken). First off, it's supposed to have green curry paste but I don't think I got any. Second, the chicken tasted pretty bland. Third, it's because after a few bites, I got a reallyyyy bad stomach ache!! :( I thought it was just me but when 2 of my other friends decided to take a bite, one was okay and the other got a really bad stomach ache too...idk if it was the rice or something but yeah..

Because it seems like a good place, I don't mind giving it another try sometime in the future. Just didn't first experience wasn't good for me..
author: Mandy G.

description:
I've been here a few times. Mainly because it's the fastest real homemade food that I can actually sit down and enjoy rather than a quick bite joints in the vicinity. 

I particularly like the chicken pad thai, it's pretty good. The rice dishes are decent too. Had the sticky rice that came in a little rice pouch and it's tasty. The price is very affordable especially lunch time.
author: Aina L.

description: Very attentive staff and service.  The food was meh.  Soup was extremely salty. Yellow curry and pad thai wasn't memorable.
author: Krystle L.

description: This restaurant is my favorite thai restaurant in the whole entire bay. Customer service is so on point and they are very friendly-- always refilling your water and asking if you are doing good! They have a great selection and different chef specials on the board. The ambience is super cozy and comfortable. Definitely have brought all my friends here! Thank you Thai Time!
author: RayRay M.

description:
This is our go-to Thai restaurant in our neighborhood.  It's a really small hole in the wall place but we always get seated quickly and service is good.  Ever since we got back from Chiang Mai, I have been looking for a good kao soi and this place makes a pretty good one.  My only complaint is that one time they substituted the type of noodle without telling me they were going to do that - I guess, assuming that I wouldn't know the difference, but I did.  It was still good, so I didn't complain.

the seafood curry is tasty too.
author: Theresa N.

description:
I would say the thai food here is just average. I came out of my way to try this restaurant and while I was not disappointed I was definitely not enthused. It's a small restaurant but there were a few other people eating as well. The woman serving my food was friendly but had no interest in talking to me. For my meal I ordered pad thai with shrimp and shredded peanuts. I was also given soup (which I didn't know was included) and ordered a thai iced tea as well. The meal was very OK; I didn't taste much peanut and my shrimp tasted old and rubbery. I ended up drenching my meal with the supplied chili paste on the table; that was the only way to get some flavor into the meal. 

What I didn't like about the restaurant was when I ordered my meal the waitress brought me over a fork. I found this pretty odd considering everyone else was eating with chopsticks. Maybe she assumed I didn't know how to use chopsticks? I'm not sure about Thai custom and eating but I asked for chopsticks anyway. 

The price was reasonable but I much prefer King of Thai Noodle over this restaurant. It's pretty close so I'll pick them over here.
author: Tommy C.

description:
Catered: 
Mango salad - perfect, best i've had. Better than a papaya salad from any place I've been to and ordered a mango salad.
Veggie Eggroll - alright, not a big fan of eggrolls.
Eggplant, chicken dish - good, went for seconds on this dish. eggplant was a good size and nicely cooked.
Green chicken curry - good, very yummy.
Pad Thai - not bad, i went for seconds.
Chicken skewers - good, along with their side cucumber salad.

Great catering service, is what I hear, accomodating. I thought the food was fresh, warm, and very yummy. It was so impressive that I asked for the name of this place. I will definitely visit this place.
author: Vicki T.

description: Umm, they tacked on extra $6 for delivery...for nothing particularly stunning, I'll pass next time.
author: Clare Y.

description:
This is a hole in the wall that serves delicious food.
I had one of their special dishes, a sort of seafood curry served inside a coconut - possibly one of the best dishes I ever had in a restaurant. And cheap, too!
That will definitely become my new stop on my way back from Green Apple.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Best Thai in the area. Good for either delivery or eat-in. Delivery comes fast (rare around here!). Usually takes under half hour if you live in the area.  Good service if you dine there. It's a small place though.

Everything we've ordered has been good. Lots of vegetarian options too. We love their spring rolls and their various red curry options. Portions are generous and well-priced.
author: Lisa E.

description:
This was my first visit to Thai Time restaurant and admittedly, I didn't do any advanced research or preparation for my dining experience.  Instead, it was a rather impromptu meal and I ordered one of my "staple" dishes that I normally order at my favourite traditional Thai restaurant and one "house" dish (in addition to sampling "family style" a dining partner's "house" dish)

The dish that I almost ALWAYS order when I'm at a Thai restaurant (which may or may not be a traditionally Thai dish... oops) is larb and preferably, DUCK larb. What I can say about Thai Time is that they have a solid larb ped.  They include skin and fat, but also meat.  It was NOT rubbery, which is good.  Of course, I'm a big fan of the lime/cilantro dressing that most Thai restaurants use on their salads.  Very yummy.

The "house" dish that I ordered was the Yum Moo Yang.  Surprisingly, this dish had a little spicy KICK.  It was almost reminiscent of spicy sausage.  Overall, I enjoyed it.

The "house" dish that I sampled was the Red Tilapia.   It was a de-boned, sliced tilapia with Janese eggplant, basil, bell pepper in a curry sauce.  2 words: creamy goodness and the eggplant absorbed the sauce well.

Decent, solid food for my first try.  Nothing amazing, but definitely a place that I would recommend if someone were in the area looking for food.
author: Hiromi N.

description:
I'm not the biggest fan of Thai food, but this place made me reconsider! 

Those days when you're in the mood for delicious flat noodles accompanied by yummy Thai tea? Yea, this is the place to go!
author: Oriel F.

description:
Whoa whoa whoa. I walk in and think, hmm this place is small.

The Thai guy who took my order was so incredibly happy & friendly that I immediately was feeling better about my life. If this deep fried trout with mango salad is half as tasty as this guy is happy, then I'm in for some good food. 

It was. More than half. Like 99%. And they do small things like wrap the to go bag in a way that prevents the dish from going vertical when you're walking with it. Now that's impressive.
author: Tony P.

description: I would say this is the best Thai restaurant in all of Inner Richmond, SF. I have been there a couple of times now and every time I have ordered a different dish and I wasn't disappointed at any point of time. And there's another thing. Their price. It is really cheap price for that kind of food. We usually go to different restaurants every day. But given me Thai Time at any day, I wouldn't say no..!!.. Give it a shot.
author: Ram R.

description:
I love you...i love you...my belly LOVES you!!! (singing aloud)
 
     Do not ...I SAY Do Not under estimate the size of this quaint restaurant!!! it is absolutly bursting with flavor it will knock your momma out...Dont say i didnt warn you.

   Hands down my FAVORITE ..wanna make me happy place to eat is Thai Time.  i used to live a block away from this place years ago ...Ahhhhhhhhhhh Memories!!!! i would eat here every chance i had.  My favorite place for Tom Yum Kah Soup , garlic rice and angel wings too. i also appreciate that the flavors here are not watered down and they ask you how spicy you like your food.. OK ENOUGH of telling you how good this place is . Get your booty up and run there...and thank me when you order your tom yum soup.
author: Azu A.

description:
For some reason, no matter what city you're in, the better Thai restaurants are the smaller, more "homely" ones. This one is no exception.

The food was good - we ordered the Duck Curry, "Thai Time" fried rice and stir fried vegetables, and I liked all three (and they seemed to go well together). Service was fast and attentive, especially with refilling the tea. Prices were good. Would definitely go back. 

-1 star for the random bug I spotted crawling along the wall shelf. Almost all restaurants have something (especially hole-in-the-wall places), but are generally harder to spot - maybe it was a fluke.
author: Jim P.

description: I hate to give this a bad review...i ordered red curry with chicken and it was oh so delicious! However about 20 minutes in my stomach started cramping up something awful!  I had to stop eating and spent the rest of the night hunched over in the bathroom.   I came back to work the next day and the same exact thing happened to my coworker a week prior!  Maybe just stick to the veggies this place's meat is no good.
author: Janelle H.

description:
Thai food is here is fine, comparable to any other.
prices are maybe a dollar more than King of Thai and the portions are slightly smaller.

Thai time seems like its trying to be upscale in comparison to king of thai. but theyre slower, really lacking in space and food is the same but a little more expensive. 

I choose KING OF THAI  everyTIME
just my pref
author: Ash R.

description: Delicious Thai food that's great value for money. I ordered ahead online in the morning for a birthday party and picked it up that evening. Super easy - only thing is that you can only order up to a certain total cost.
author: Lara O.

description: I have to say that my first impression on this place was that it was tiny but it reminded of a small mom and pops restaurant. I never really like the fact that I had to walk through the kitchen to get to the rest room but the place was kept clean. But the best part was the food omg it was amazing well beyond amazing I had #33 it was a sea food mix in a coconut  and fried rice with chicken and shrimp mix and let me tell you they did not hold back on the sea food  or the flavor girl amazingggggggg wold love to go back when ever I visit the city again. I most say best Thai food I ever had thanks guys for making  the food with so much love :*
author: Aliaksandr Z.

description: I've tried this place a few times and I'm finally remembering to review.  Here's how I rate my experiences.  If the place blows me away in all aspects like price, ambience, taste, friendliness, cleanliness, service...in short perfection which is hard to achieve especially with food and from here I rate everything else.  I've dined in and take out with friends from this restaurant and and the taste is very good.  We ordered the roti, duck green curry, pad kee mao, larb and pad thai.  I was a bit disappointed with pad thai more on the sweet side but everything else was excellent.  I would like to give 3.4 star if I could but I'll give this a solid 3 stars instead.  I would eat here again.
author: J J.

description:
After having tea and crackers at the Japanese Tea Garden in SF today, my Daughter and Son said that they were hungry for Thai food.  So, my hubby, self and teenagers headed to Thai Time after doing a Yelp search for inexpensive Thai food. 

Everything we had was absolutely delicious! Coming from the East Bay, we weren't sure what to expect - but the four of us (and more) will definitely be back!

Even the walk through the kitchen to get to the one-person bathroom was part of the experience.

Try it - you'll like it!
author: Debbie C.

description: They just keep getting better every time I go
author: Chelsey G.

description: Found a hair in my food.  When I called to order the woman who answered was very rude. And my other order just didn't taste good. This place is terrible do not eat here!!!!
author: Femi D.

description: The best version of fried rice I've ever had (photo 96) in comparision to the other Asian versions. It had at least a generous 7 different ingredients in the dish. Calamari, shrimp, carrots, tomatoes, pineapples, leafy greens,broccoli & minced meat. Multiple flavors to delight the palette. Hugh portion for under $8. Place is a hole in the wall but the food here is authentic Thai. They also have a 2 item plus rice & soup lunch menu. Place can get crowded in the evenings.
author: M L.

description:
Warm and cozy little place, good for family style eating. 

The food was delicious. We ordered deep fried tofu with peanut plum sauce as an appetizer. The sauce was amazing! For the main course we ordered pad thai, gang garee gai (yellow curry), pad pak gra pow, and two sides of rice. The pad thai was okay; it was definitely different from most varieties of the same dish that I've tried before in that it was less saucy and more mild in overall flavor. The yellow curry was aromatic and wonderful, it complemented the rice so well. It's the kind of flavor and texture combination that Thai food lovers dream about at night. And last but not least--the awesome vegetable tofu dish. It was really fresh and the sauce was superb. The service was really nice! The waitress refilled our water glasses over and over and over again, I lost count of how many times. She was also really knowledgeable about the menu and the portions. The food prices were reasonable. Definitely a good place to try.
author: Idk A.

description: Get the koh soi chicken with extra pickled greens on the side. Seriously fantastic.  It has everything: yellow curry, noodles, chicken, crunchy noodles on top. I get it every time. Very authentic.
author: Lucy P.

description:
Really delicious - pad Thai and coconut soup + spring role
All very classic and perfectly executed.
Thank you!
author: julien b.

description: Popped in here on a whim when my stomach was craving Thai. Saturday afternoon around 3pm there was only one other patron there. This place is a tiny hole on the wall with less than a dozen tables. We were seated right away and our waitress was quick to get our order. The waitress seemed new and didn't speak English so there was a lot of pointing at the menu to convey our wants. Food came fairly quickly. We got Tom Kha Kai soup which I had never had before and it was Yum. Entrees were Thai fried rice, basil chicken and crispy chicken with bell peppers. We never received the basil chicken. Rut roh. The other two were excellent and left us both wanting more. So despite the wonky service which was incredibly pleasant just wonky eschew we were happy with our random stop.
author: Melissa H.

description:
This is by far my favorite Thai restaraunt in the whole city. A tiny little hole in the wall that really delivers. I love their Pra Raam Long Song (Fried tofu in peanut sauce with veggies) and their Yellow Curry the best. And it's pretty inexpensive, the staff are great. 
Remember that it's NOT open on Mondays, I always forget :(
author: Mitch M.

description: Called this restaurant to ask if they had seating for 12, they enthusiastically said yes. When we arrived they had a table ready for our large group. Service was helpful and fast. All the food was great - each plate had great flavor and everyone enjoyed their meal. I had my usual of pad thai, and it was very well done, hubby had the beef Pad Ma Keur which was so good, and my sis-in-law ordered the Red Tilapia which was also really delicious! Small place with some really great food!
author: Teema C.

description:
Perfect so far.
Small, but I never had to wait too long.
There's a parking lot (with meters) across the street.
While you're there, walk to Green Apple books too.
author: Davo W.

description:
Food is about 3~4 stars, price is the same, and it was actually one of our go to spots, either dining in or pick up order since it's walking distance, until...

while shopping on Clement, I thought to drop by and order dinner and return to pick up the food.  Ordering was fine, but the staff insisted on my paying on the spot.  She's like, you have to pay for it now or we won't make your food. 

WTF??!!  How's my ordering in person any different than my calling you on the phone for take out?  The staff didn't know how it's different, but she JUST wants me to pay for it now.  

It doesn't really make a difference to me to pay 10 minutes sooner, and despite of being a prior customer, maybe I just look like the kind of person who runs around placing random $20 order as pranks.  Who knows?  All I know is, there's plenty of choices around and I don't need to come back here.
author: daphne w.

description:
In the all-too-Asian Richmond, it would be easy to assume that the level of regional food would be uniformly high.  With its uninspiring interpretations of Thai classics, Thai Time proves this a fallacy.

Literally a hole in the wall with fewer than ten glass-covered tables, it is obvious that Thai Time doesn't aspire to greatness.  Rather, it attempts only to be an inexpensive, neighborhood Thai place where diners can get in, get some decent, if unimaginative, food, and get out quickly without sacrificing their entire paycheck.  In this, it pretty much succeeds.  Albeit, diners should not expect more.

Accompanied by the traditional peanut sauce and cucumber salad, the Chicken satay was fine, but could have featured a more flavorful marinade.  Although hearty and warming on a cold Richmond evening, the tom yung kung soup could have been spicier.  The pad Thai, a staple in any Thai restaurant, contained a paucity of prawns, and the noodles were egregiously overcooked.  Inexplicably, there was no jasmine rice available, but at least management had the foresight to offer brown rice.

Service was awkward and slow.  It was quite a while before the waitress took the order, and upon doing so, there seemed to be a difficulty in "getting it."  The waitress incorrectly totaled the bill and nearly forgot to include some of the left overs in the take-home bag.

At Thai Time, look only for standards--pad Thai, satays, curries, etc.  Don't expect anything bordering on interesting--mieng kum (a favorite Thai self-made snack with spinach leaves, roasted peanuts and coconut, fresh lime, ginger, onion, and chopped Thai chili peppers) or anything that would require higher level kitchen skills (for example, tom yam pla, steamed sea bass, mushrooms, and tomatoes flavored with lemongrass and kaffir leaves.)  

With straightforward food and only fair service, Thai Time's saving grace is that its prices are reasonable, even by Richmond standards.  If you are seeking greatness, look elsewhere; for a quick Thai bite, Thai Time will suffice.
author: CJ G.

description: This is my favorite neighborhood Thai restaurant.  Every dish I have had here has been delicious though I keep coming back to the green curry rotee.  Yum.
author: Courtney C.

description:
The angel wing appetizer is BOMB! What is it? Chicken wings stuffed, and I mean STUFFED, with pork, woodear mushrooms, and clear noodles...then deep fried to perfection. 

The appetizer combo is pretty awesome, too. The dipping sauces here are delicious! I think you can get the appetizer combo and eat that as a meal. 

The pumpkin talay is very creamy and delicious. I think their pad thai is better than most. Mainly because the noodles aren't so dry and stick to each other. 

I've only done take out here so can't really comment on the service.
author: LeTran B.

description:
I have found my new favorite Thai restaurant! Wohoo!

I used to like King of Thai, but the food quality has decreased tremendously recently (the shrimp in the pumpkin curry that I ordered was completely undercooked.. disgusting.. their portion size is also inconsistent). On the other hand, this small non-chain restaurant always gives me consistently delicious Thai food. Servers are friendly too. They are patient, and took their time to recommend food to us. They made a mistake with the order (gave us green curry when we order red) and were happy to give us the right food, instead of semi-threatening us to take the wrong order by giving us the "I-am-gonna-spit-in-your-food-you-demanding-customers" look. 

Anyhow, the food I would recommend here is: Pumpkin curry and Angel Wings!! They can be crowded during dinner time, but wait is usually not that bad.

They also deliver, and it's pretty fast too (not sure if it's because we ordered around 8-ish, so it may have passed their busiest dinner time).
author: Doris H.

description: it was ok, going forward I'd ask if the tofu is genetically modified. it had a weird taste, there was something going on with it. as much as I like the stuff/tofu, there's something creepy about what the Monsanto's of the world have done to it. just remember, this is the shit that is fed to those incarcerated in the usa, and thousands eventually bite the dust because of it.
author: Henry K.

description: I can't believe how cheap the food is here! For a sit down restaurant in SF, it was like $8 a plate, and totally yummy. It's tiny and intimate so maybe don't bring your loud kids like we did, but even then, we will probably still go back because the food was so good and the price can't be beat.
author: Ashley E.

description:
Pros: Friendly, clean, great portions, great prices! I ordered the basil chicken #66 & curry chicken and enjoyed  excellent choice if looking for great Thai.

Cons: no soda refills-comes in a can but typical of many places and certainly not a deal breaker. Tiny restaurant with limited seating and any wait will be outside.
author: Cristin H.

description: Yes, we really enjoyed this and will be back....the whole trout dish was amazing, totally recommended, and under $10 no less, while the pad see ew was plenty fine although about average among those I've had. Thai iced tea was well made, the service was great and the place had a nice homey feel.
author: Henry Y.

description:
SOOOOO CHEAPPPP!!!!!!!!!!!!!

We stumbled into this hole in the wall for lunch and it was a great find! They have a bunch of different foods for their lunch special. You'll easily be able to find all your favs: pad kee mao, pad see ew, pad thai, curries, etc. The place isn't super big, but it's fairly clean. The staff are nice and courteous. I can definitely see myself returning for lunch soon!
author: Sharon G.

description:
This is my go-to Thai place.  Best vegetarian tom yum I've ever had.  VEGETARIAN.  Be still my heart.  If the only thing I could order for dinner is that soup and some rice, I'd be happy. 

I've had to adjust my raging meat eating thai palate over the years so no more larb but everything veg we order here is good.  The atmosphere is cozy, prices are reasonable, and we always have leftovers (which hold up pretty well when reheated).
author: Heather L.

description: Very cute, small little Thai place tucked away in Inner Richmond.  This is our go-to place for Thai, both when we eat out and do take-out.  Not good for groups of more than four people-- there are only six tables in the restaurant, but that really adds to its charm.  The food is good, they give you a lot of it, service is pretty quick, and the price is right.
author: Jess B.

description:
*Inner Richmond Insider Tip: When it's time for thai green curry, make it Thai Time all the way.

Believe me, I've been in this business for over a year (moved into my place in April '08... not to mention I've been a frequent of Clement since I discovered King of Thai in freshman year of college). That's over a year+ of many a night where I have nothing in my refridgerator and am craving something hot, quick, slightly spicy, and well... green!

Having sampled all the competitors in proximity, I must say

* Tawan's Thai Food green curry is less than memorable.
* Thai Noodle Jump loads theirs up on veggies, but gives little liquid. Plus they used to steal my friend's wi-fi, who used to live upstairs.
* Beloved King of Thai gets it WAY too watery. Sorry, but you have been de-throned, at least on this dish.
* Be my Guest is too expensive for mediocre Thai food, in general.

Thai Time's green curry wins for its perfect balance of meat of choice, bamboo shoots, basil leaves, and peppers. Also the flavor is the best, with a distinct fish sauce taste but not overwhelmingly so. The viscosity of the curry is thick and creamy. And the portion is big enough to last me three evenings total of empty fridges.

I might even go as far as saying it's the best green curry I've had, ever. Buuuuut I understand there is life outside of the Inner Richmond. So I won't say it... yet.

Still, well worth the trek. I usually take it to go, but the one time I ate in, the teeny tiny place was pleasant.
author: Kate V.

description:
I eat a lot of Thai...and this was just ok, nothing more.

Larb gai was dried out but still tasty 3.5 stars. 

Then, they messed up our order and served us pad se ew instead of pad kee mao both of which I had had numerous times before at a lot of thai places, then the waitress argued with me insisting it was what we ordered. 

Upon showing another waitress (who was extremely nice unlike the other one) what the menu described was obviously not what we were served she apologized, took the dish back and came out with pad kee mao in a couple of minutes (which still had no bell peppers and bamboo shoots - WTF? weird). 

We also had the choo chee whole fish with curry - the fish was tiny and bony, kind of a rip off - also, nothing was spicy at all even though we ordered it medium-hot - had to throw tons of prik nam pla and dried peppers on it just to get it to taste like normal thai food. 

Long story short, I REALLY wanted to love this place, best environment ever - small, quaint, but with bad service that argues with you when they obviously messed up and underwhelming food, no way i would go here again.

Marnee will still be my go to in SF...or best of Thai on haight in a pinch.
author: Ben B.

description:
I really like thai time! The servers are very polite and the food comes out pretty fast. It is a small joint so on certain nights (usually the weekends) you might have to wait to get seated. Large parties (6-8) people not recommended. 

I always order over the phone and pick up. Only takes about 15 minutes from the time you call. 
The portion size is large and tastes great! Most the time I have leftovers.
author: Zack E.

description: I was coming home from Marin and wanted some Thai on a rainy night. I pulled over to see what I could find on Yelp and decided on Thai Time. I got a bunch of stuff and was pretty happy with everything. I was strangely fascinated by the Angel wings and was impressed with the fresh seafood in the pumpkin curry. I downloaded the Order Ahead app and will use it next time I go!
author: Alisha A.

description: There was a hair entangled in my fried rice. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone
author: John alexis G.

description:
1 star for okay food with more than enough for just one serving of curry.

-4 stars for horrible service. We waited an hour for a table - fine. We waited an extra hour just for our food - and so did everyone else in the restaurant. Might as well have ordered take-out, atleast then we could've waited in the comfort of our own home.
author: Rae A.

description:
It's been two years since my original review, and this place still gets my 5 stars. 
How do they make eggplant taste so good?
author: Sarah H.

description: 5 of us are eating and sharing duck, noodles, fried rice, and roti.  Everything is excellent- spiced as ordered, fresh, and moist.  Prices are great, we'd definitely come here again!
author: Jesse S.

description:
Thai Time is probably thee best Thai restaurant I've ever been to!!

Their Pad Thai is so freaking good, they add some coconut juice.

Do not use their bathroom though. You have to walk through the kitchen...which is tight. Then you have to walk through this tiny walkway...which is tight. If you can hold it...hold it.

Thai Rib
http://static2.px.yelp.com/bphoto/c9fnt9h7puGlsJbceGh5mQ/l

(Tuesday, June 30, 2009)
author: Kenny C.

description: I order from here often, but on this particular occasion I happened to order a bit too late (after delivery hours, only pickup). I called to cancel my order and surprisingly they offered to deliver. Always great food (gang phed is amazing) and great service. A rare breed.
author: David H.

description: Stopped for lunch after walking around Golden Gate Park, and were fairly impressed. We ordered a variety from the lunch and regular menus, pad Thai and the roasted duck among them. The food was good, the restaurant wasn't busy, and the service was okay. Tables a bit small, but all worth it in the end for the large portions and tasty dishes!
author: Meralyn W.

description: I went there earlier today with my friend and really disappointed. the  barbecue pork i ordered wasn't cooked at all. After I complained they brought it back slightly burned. Chicken was ok.  Portions are really small for the price. I'm an average eater, and would need like two full meals to feel full. If it wasn't for pork not cooked I walnut bother to write this review  but that was just not right.
author: Michael B.

description: Favorite thai restaurant! I've been going here since I was 8 years old (about 16 years) and the quality hasn't changed. I love their pad thai and tom kha talay soup. Their roti and fried banana dessert is delicious. I love most of their dishes. It's a hole in the wall and tiny but I go there for the food. I ruv it so much. So derrishushh.
author: Joyce D.

description:
FOOD:
1.)  = Oops I forgot to ask what it was called. But it was likeee pad see ew but with the gravy sauce :D yummm! My kinda fooood. Sloppy and comforting. But it tasted good too, mmm!
2.) Garlic rice with chicken katsu = ooh, this was good too. I don't normally care for Thai food, but this place hits the spot ^__^ Especially if it wasn't even something I was craving to begin with, but I end up wanting to eat it all? Defff good.
3.) Hot Tea = mm! lol Their tea tasted good. 

SERVICE:
Lots and lots of refills of tea and water :P


ATMOSPHERE:
Really tiny haha. But nice. :)
author: Angela L.

description:
I had a duck dish one time and Pad Gra Prow with pork (basil pork) another time. 
Both times were ok, nothing memorable.

Service is good (typical mom and pop asian restaraunt) but overall, in the city of San Francisco filled with amazing asian food, this just didn't stand out to me.
author: Lily S.

description: I got the Thai time fried rice and was really disappointed. The rice was mushy there was no flavor and the vegetables tasted bad. I've had the tom ka gai here before and it was good, but this dish was so bad I couldn't eat it.
author: Lisa D.

description: Has lately become my new favourite Thai spot; food tastes authentic--Pad Kee Mao is super spicy and huge! Green curry and roti is fab. Thai Crepe is super good! Attentive staffs; going there twice they recognised me and my bf right away! Mango STicky Rice is amongst the best in the city!
author: Joelle K.

description: Great little hole in the wall with excellent food and pleasant service.  We broke up our ride through Presidio and GG park and had a light lunch there today.  The pumkin curry and papaya salad were both outstanding.
author: Todd F.

description:
This place should to be my to go thai place when I lived in the Bay. It is fast and easy. The food is decent and semi authentic. I highly recommend this place for groups. The service is really good. 

I don't remember this place being very spicy, so make sure to tell them spicy if you like it that way. Oh, they have really good noodles.
author: Snook C.

description: My wife and I ate here for lunch. The food was great as well as the service. My wife is Thai so she knows great Thai food. Located close to the Asian market too. Great place to stop in and eat. Love this place.
author: Mark E.

description:
Absolutely the best thai food I have found in the city!!! 
Food is great and staff is quiet but very kind an attentive. Small location so be prepared to wait if on a weekend.
author: Jesse M.

description: Service was great, food was good. This place is cute and cozy too. Pretty small though they only have a few tables but they do deliver which I haven't tried yet.
author: Ellie R.

description:
Haven't tried the food yet, still waiting for it, 2 hours later.  If you order online, its not going to get delivered, you're actually ordering for pickup even though yelp says they deliver.  So when you place the order, it'll just sit there... and you won't get a call, and when you call them, they'll be annoyed that you placed the order through their website, and they'll say next time to call...

Update:

The food was good, just don't use the website to order the food.
author: sam h.

description:
Have only done take-out from here.

It was good, came in a timely manner, and portions were reasonable.

Some of the best papaya salad I've had. Yummmmm.
author: Rachel G.

description:
It's like I am taking a trip back to Thailand whenever I come here. 

We always get the som tam (green papaya) which is soooo good, thinking about it now is making my mouth water. I love that it comes with cabbage and green beans. Everything is also fresh and crunchy which is how this dish should always be. 

The first time I came I got the kao soi (basically a curry noodle dish that I've been craving since I left Chiang Mai) and this was pretty close to the ones I ate in Thailand. They even given you a side of pickled veggies to go on top. The curry was flavorful and the noodles were great. 

Another time, I got the the pad see ew. So awesome because it comes with broccoli and chinese broccoli. I never like broccoli in my pad see ew so it makes me happy to get some chinese broccoli. 

My husband has gotten the curry and the pad thai and he's enjoyed both.

This is definitely our go-to place for Thai food in the Richmond and the portions are huge! Warning though, this place is small so it's not good for big groups. But it's still nice and cozy, the people are nice and very attentive to your glass of water (greatly appreciated).
author: Lang T.

description: Love this place.  Great food and classic service.  Cute little restaurant that has very good style.  My go to for thai.
author: Grey K.

description:
Talk about quick delivery service!  Thai Time's delivery service was excellent.  I was the only one working at our store today.  So I had no way of leaving for lunch. Thai Time's saved the day.

I ordered the calimari salad and the Pra Ram with chicken.  OMG!!! The portions were great and it was nice and hot when it arrived.  I ended up only being able to finish the salad.  

The only room for improvement is that the website on the yelp site leads me to their other location in San Carlos making it difficult to find the number to order.
author: Salvador T.

description:
A decent example of the Thai and Burmese scene here.  

We dropped in for lunch on Saturday because another Thai restaurant nearby was capacitated.  The room was nearly full, which was a good sign, and there was a table open for us, which was an even better sign.  

The room was fancifully decorated with carved and painted birds and fish, and with a tank of live goldfish.  It looked like there were about 6 tables, maybe 8, and the kitchen was doing both dine-in and take-out preparation.  

The waitress kept up with the crowd, and she made sure we had everything we wanted.  As this was our first visit, we decided to get our benchmark dishes.  Was this too pretentious?  Were we to order something we didn't know, and form an opinion from that?  They do have "People Love Us On Yelp" stickers in their windows, after all.  

We chose a chicken satay, pad thai, roasted duck on rice, and tea, for $28 + tip.  

The chicken satay was generous, 4 skewers fully loaded, with cucumber salad and a peanut sauce that was pure peanut.  This passed our screen with flying colors.  

The pad thai had the right texture, and the prawns were well cooked.  There was a scent in it that I wasn't used to, though, and I had a hard time adjusting to that.  The flavor was good, regardless of the smell.    

The roasted duck on rice came with tamarind, which was quite tasty.  I'm not a duck fan myself, so you can guess whose it was, but even for duck there seemed to be more fat and less meat that I would expect.  The tamarind was delicious.  

We left full and satisfied, but next time we're hungry for Thai food we'll opt for waiting for a table at our favorite place.
author: David D.

description:
This place was great the first time I went and ordered their Pad Thai. The second time the yellow curry, so far so good. The third time, I tried their red curry and it was ABYSMAL! They must have done something wrong, it tasted like coconut water... bland, spiceless, and nasty. I've read other reviews and it seems like I'm the only one who had a bad experience so I'm going to give it benefit of the doubt and give this place 4 stars.

Small place, good prices
author: Angela H.

description:
Definitely friendly service + a cozy atmosphere? Check.

Delicious, 4-star rating food? Fairly unclear.

I've always thought noodle soup comes with chopsticks. Apparently not here? I dunno if it was my group of pearly white dining buddies, but there were no chopsticks to be found. Sadness begins to abound.

Sadness continues to rise when I order a café sua da (iced coffee), and it's crazy sweet. Like, send me to a dentist now, cause I feel 10 cavities bursting through my teeth sweet. They do offer me another drink, but everything on the menu is equally as sugary, so I respectfully decline.

Sadness reaches its peak when the soup (Gang Jerd Pak) - albeit fairly tasty, with tofu, veggies, and rice noodles - arrives without any spicy additive alternative.

Sadness begins to recede once the bill comes. Their prices are hella reasonable, but in my book that doesn't make up for lack of flavor and crazy sweet dishes (the Pad Thai and Thai iced tea) were equally as sweet.
author: Monica C.

description:
This place is small, and it's definitely a hole-in-the-wall given its location on the cross street off the main restaurant corridors of Clement and Geary. There are only about 10 tables and can be a little tight. I see how busy they are even on a Tuesday night and can say they do have their followers. The Thai decor that's inside is very nice.

I ordered the seafood tom yum noodles. They do give a fairly generous portion of squid and scallop. The bowl size, however, was quite small, so overall the quantity of soup I got was equally small. That was my one disappointment because I love tom yum soup, and theirs was pretty good.

Despite that, I'll keep them at a high rating for the effort I see put out by this small business (it might be family run). Maybe next time I'll try their Thai curry items.
author: H K.

description:
I placed an order for pickup from Thai Time tonight. The food was delicious, the service was courteous and fast, the ambiance was very cute in the restaurant, and the price seemed reasonable. 

Very good experience - I'll come back here for sure!
author: Alyssa A.

description: I love Thai Time. Service is great and it doesn't usually get too crowded. I'm not an adventurous eater but my friends have tried a lot of dishes and enjoyed them. The lunch specials are a great deal. I also love the different protein options they have.
author: T D.

description:
Tiny, cute, cozy and homey, this restaurant seems to be run by a Thai family. On slow nights, the kids color at a table in the back.

I love the soups here. The red curry is a flavor symphony but they put too much filler - chopped bamboo I think. Try the snapper special if they still have it - an entire deep fried fish bathed in red curry. Yum!

Maybe the food itself only gets 4 stars, but given the low prices and the sweet hideaway feel, it gets an extra star from me.
author: Diane Y.

description: Hands down one of the best Thai restaurants in the city. Consistently good and very authentic.
author: Michael S.

description:
This downgrade saddens me, but I had to do it for two reasons:

1.) I think they complete overhauled their staff. I was used to seeing the same few waitresses every time I came here. They were wonderful - friendly and efficient. And they knew me, which is a bonus. Their new waiters are either too slow or they are all over you. As in, I just put my fork down for a second and they are trying to take my plate away. It's a little...uncomfortable.

2.) The food quality. Maybe I should say the consistency of the food quality. Sometime it's as good as it used to be and sometimes very mediocre. I always order the same thing (I know, I know) and I want to know what it's going to taste like. 

I don't even get cravings for Thai Time anymore. Breaks my heart  :( It's still ok. Just not five stars.
author: Nicole P.

description:
NO Thai Time like the present!!! We found this place after just strolling home through neighborhood when hunger decide to hit us.  We ordered delivery: 
*Spring rolls, 
*Gang Panang, 
*Pad Se-Ew, and side of rice.
 The currie and noodles from start to finish was great in the balance of taste and  also FRESH!!! which is hard to find FRESH!!!, which could be found though out all of the ingredients   and dishes. The spring rolls where cooked perfectly not over done with that golden brown color described in so many description everyone aims for BUENO!!! After we order our meal the the estimated time for delivery 40 minutes, and did they out do that by 10 mins, which painted picture of good things to come.

The  only cons I could say I experienced was that after I ordered. I called back to ask a question about my order and I for what ever reason it took me three calls to reach them just to ask a question about the menu. I would only assume that it was dinner time and busy. Another is that they only stay open till 10:00 blame that on my selfish wants.
author: Merrell D.

description: I'm not sure if I ordered the wrong stuff, but the Pad Thai and Pra Ram Tofu was good, but not 4 star amazing. The Pra Ram was "meh". The Pad Thai wasn't anything out of the ordinary but the shrimp was perfectly cooked. I'm not sure if I'm a fat ass but the portions were not as big as the other Yelpers made it seem. My friend and I (both girls) shared 2 dishes and and didn't feel satisfied after the meal. The prices are very reasonable ($7-$8) and the menu is very extensive, I'll give them that. I won't mind giving this place a second try though.
author: Cindy A.

description: love it.  takes me back to my travels in South East Asia.  Super good food and service.
author: William G.

description:
Very decent prices, great service, but not so memorable meals. Will come back though if I'm in the area. The place is small and cozy and we were nicely greeted with the large menu. Angel wings were ok so was the chicken satay with peanut sauce for appetizer. Ok, but nothing to die for. Both almost a size of the main course :)
Now, I don't like pad Thai but I got a bite and it seemed too sweet. Beef Pad Ka Nar was very decent, but I certainly had beter. Well, at least we were certainly full and our budget did not suffer much at all!
author: Alek L.

description:
What an adorable little Thai place! I'm Laotian and agree with the other reviewers on the authenticity of Thai time; there are actual Thai people in the kitchen cooking real Thai food. 

The ladies and I stopped by after a shopping extravaganza and shared the angel wings, tom yum soup and shredded mango salad. Everything was delicious and full of flavor. Our server was friendly and quick. The restaurant was quaint and perfect for a chilly rainy day with only a few tables and steam on the windows from the heat in the kitchen. The prices were reasonable but the portions are a bit smaller then a Texas girl like me is used to. If I did live in SF this would definitely by my neighborhood Thai spot.
author: Ariza S.

description:
On the other hand, there's nothing wrong with large portions of great food at an absurdly cheap price...  Don't sleep on this.  Homey decor, super-sweet service and a kind neighborhood vibe in a nabe over-stocked with over-rated Thai.  Can't wait to go back.  Props to my friend Ilana for turning me on to Thai Time just in time.

P.S. TT is a truly great Thai spot that delivers.  See if you're in their radius!
author: Ted R.

description: This is my fave Thai spot in the city! It's a hole in the wall which I think only adds to the ambiance. Pretty much tried everything in the menu and it's all great... my go to right now is their green curry served with a side of platha and if you're into pad thai, they have the best. Not too peanut-ty and not too greasy. Also their mango salad is great for those who want something on the lighter side.
author: Maria P.

description: Nice portion for the price. I got the "spicy" eggplant with chicken. It wasn't very spicy, but the flavor was nice. They gave a large portion for an A la carte item. The chicken was okay, but slightly dry and rubbery. The place is tiny and sort of obscure given the bustle of Clement Street. It would be small for a large group, I wouldn't recommend it. I want to come back to try their lunch special ( Unfortunately I came on the weekend). Overall, I enjoyed the meal, but It wasn't extraordinary. I wish it had been spicier, I specifically requested that it come spicy, but it was mild. Is it just me or are most of the Thai places here in SF under spiced?
author: Shannon H.

description:
I had to write a positive review of this place. They don't cut corners.

- My som tam (green papaya) salad was incredibly delicious; fresh, crunchy green papaya, great dressing, cashews, and they made it fish sauce-free for me.
- The choo-chee tofu was awesome. I loved the julienned kaffir lime leaves that gave it just enough leaf flavor to complement the rich red curry sauce. The vegetables were fresh and fantastic.
- Clean kitchen and bathroom (yes, it matters)
- Friendly service (doesn't matter too much to me, but might to some)

Can easily understand why this place has a high number of stars.
author: Jason M.

description:
Thai Time is YUMMY! I didn't plan on coming here while visiting the city, but because of Yelp! we were bestowed this delectable delight. 

The gf loves to try different foods, so we got 3 dishes to split. 

Appetizer: Tom Yum Gai (spicy, sour, lemongrass, with chicken). YOU HAVE TO TRY IT. Fantastic SOUP! I'll call it Tom YUMMY gai I don't really enjoy soup, but this soup really got me. It's so full of flavor, I was scooping the bottom of the pot looking for more. The only bad thing was the chicken was over cooked. Very tough and chewy. The taste of the soup made up for it.

Main Dishes: Red Pumpkin Seafood Curry. It was spicy but bland. That's a weird one. I could tell that there was spice, but I just couldn't get any flavor from it. It had calamari, mussels, and shrimp. 

Sauteed Deep Fried Chicken with carrots, cashews, onions, and mushrooms ( i forgot the name, but its on the main dish page) This dish was my favorite of the two main dishes. The chicken was crunchy because of the deep frying and had lots of flavor, HOWEVER I think it was the same batch as the chicken from my soup. Very tough and overcooked. Still, okay because the flavor was on point.

Sticky rice is only $1.50 so i got that. One serving of rice is good enough to feed one person. For women, you might have a little extra left over. My sticky rice was really sticky for some reason. I had to use my fork and my soup spoon to cut a chunk of rice off, but hey thats sticky rice for you. 

Dessert: Mango Sticky rice for the gf. TASTY!

The service was good, frequent checkins and to refill our water. Our food came pretty quickly. This place is going on my list to visit when in the city
author: Nathan P.

description: I have been ordering takeout from Thai Time for years. At times it can be agonizingly slow, and there are some dishes I think could be better, but they are remarkably consistent and when I stick to the stuff I know I like (curries, duck soup with noodles, larbs and salads), I am always happy.
author: B T.

description: Late post (didn't realize it in "unfinished review" limbo until now) but met up for dinner a few months back with friends who lived nearby and had ordered takeout from Thai Time.  Really enjoyed it.  Ordered a bunch of dishes (including pumpkin curry and pad see ew), all of which were quite good and easily shared.  Great to have this option within walking distance.
author: F. P.

description:
This is definitely my go-to neighborhood Thai place.

Super quick delivery! They usually deliver sooner than their quoted time, and the delivery girl last time was very nice. Food is always solid, love their green curry with coconut milk. I always end up getting my usual -- pad gra pow, but they do theirs with sliced beef instead of ground beef, and I think I prefer ground beef. Oh well, still delicious. Very convenient, and quality food, perfect for ordering something quick on those nights I'm too lazy to cook.
author: Erica W.

description: Small place with and good.  Never had a bad dish.  I am getting hungry now just writing this review,
author: M H.

description:
I can't believe I haven't received thai time yet! it is by far my favorite thai restaurant. I am sure theres at least 20 other thai restaurants thats closer to my place but I always go there despite the 10 mins drive. 

The dishes are slightly cheaper than most thai restaurants, about $7 each. They have so many varieties on the menu, but my favorite dish has always been fried tilapia with red curry! I always order it spicy! order it with the sticky rice(same price as the jasmine rice!) and there you go-my favorite thai dish. 

Go there you won't regret it!
author: Ris L.

description:
The place is quite small, only seats about 25. I came here for lunch while waiting for a prescription to be filled at Kaiser. The menu is pretty extensive and service was attentive. I always check out the restroom, as to me that is an indication of cleanliness. It is through the kitchen and miniscule, but was very clean.

I ordered the sweet and sour chicken soup. It came in a little clay pot and was packed with chicken, mushrooms and tomato. Very tasty if a bit salty for me (but I rarely use salt so am hyper-sensative to it). Also had the chicken with veggies and peanut sauce plate. It was tasty but arrived lukewarm (though the rice was hot).

Next time I would try the pad Thai and coconut milk soup, as that is how I usually judge a Thai restaurant.

Overall reasonable prices and decent, place was almost full when I left.
author: John K.

description:
I am a huge fan of Thai Time!  Their prices are really reasonable and the food is great.  The pumpkin curry with shrimp is one of my personal favorites, but all the curries I've tried are yummy.

The restaurant is casual and pretty small (9 tables or so) but you usually don't have to wait long to get seated if at all.  And the people who work there are really nice.

On nights when I don't feel like leaving the house, I call Thai Time for delivery.  The delivery portions seem HUGE (maybe even larger than in the restaurant?) and I can always get a few meals out of it.

Overall, great Thai food at really affordable prices.
author: Rachel N.

description: Love Thai Time! My favorite Thai food in SF and I've eaten a lot of Thai.  One of the things that is so great about this place is that there are items on the menu you don't find on every single generic thai restaurant menu, but they have also mastered the classics. The food really tastes like there's love put into it.
author: Bella P.

description:
The other day I was walking down Clement Street and began to experience some major shopping fatigue.  I was super hungry and needed some cheap, delicious grub.  Then I remembered how close I was to Thai Time and I got super excited, finished up quickly in the fabric store, and walked briskly towards eight street, stomach gurgling and mouth watering...........when I turned the corner I saw that my beloved Thai Time was CLOSED!  OH NO!  I almost laid down on the pavement I was so upset....I even walked up to the door hoping maybe it was a mistake and someone would let me in and feed me!  No such luck.....

I haven't been so upset since I found out The Onion was no longer in print!  I realized I should probably yelp review this place......

Thai Time has my favorite thai food in the city!  And it's cheap!  And quick!   They have a substantial vegetarian menu and are always happy to accommodate dietary limitations or preferences without that funny squinty-eyed lemon face look they give you at some Asian restaurants (I'm talking about you, every Chinese restaurant on Clement!).   The veggies are fresh and flavorful which is a real plus.  The waiters and waitresses are very sweet and serve your food with care and attention.  The place has that charming hole-in-the-wall feel and everything is clean - in the window they display a health inspection score of 100!  How often do you see that?!  Also, they deliver.

Oh, minus one millionth of a point for being closed on Sundays and Mondays.  Boo.
author: Katy K.

description: amazing, cheap, highly recommend. ignore the lackluster storefront--it's the food that counts.
author: Christine H.

description:
Cute little family run restaurant that looks like a hole-in-the-wall but has a remarkably clean and cute interior. 

Ordered a few appetizers to share: fried fish cakes, chicken satay, rotee with green curry. The small cucumber sauce/salad that comes on the side was delicious!  

Order the Thai pancake for dessert! Pan fried dough (rotee) with condensed milk and sugar on top. 

Food was solid but were overall pretty standard Thai dishes. Still love Tawan's Thai that's located a block away much more!
author: Vivian D.

description: Good food and good value; I'm a fan. But definitely order takeout/delivery on the weekend, because this place is tiny and there's really not much ambiance to be had. This is my favorite Thai in the neighborhood currently.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Cute little hole-in-the-wall place where the staff is friendly and the food is good. I ordered the Pad Ka Prow with pork and it was the least spiciest version I've ever had. Actually, it wasn't spicy at all. I'm not sure if they just assumed because I am white that I don't want some heat, but it definitely lacked with out that extra chili! My friend got the soft shell crab with mango salad special that night. He enjoyed it, but from what I tasted the salad was fresh but the crab was too heavily fried. It was too crunchy and you missed the taste of the crab itself. 

The place is cheap though and does offer a great selection!!!
author: Jessie M.

description: Yum. Thanks yelp for yet another satisfying meal. Service was eh-ok, but food was awesome. I had duck over rice with thai chili oil...accidently ate one and I burned :p Another dish I had was the plain ol pad thai. It was probably the best pad thai I've ever had. So much better than the king of thai a few blocks away.
author: Alyssa Z.

description: We came here our first night living in the city, and it was the perfect first meal in SF!  Great prices, huge portion sizes so you always have leftovers, and it was absolutely delicious.  We had the green curry and the fried rice, both which were fantastic!  I can't wait to try more!!
author: Amanda B.

description:
I judge thai restaurants by their Pad See Ew. Its my favorite dish, once I know that dish tastes good, I move on to explore the rest.

Unfortunately, their Pad See Ew was Eww. The beef was very chewy and thick, the noodles didn't feel like it had enough marinated. 

The restaurant is a "hole in the wall" type, seating no more than 20-30 people. Had a good time hanging out with a friend, but I don't think I'll come back again.
author: Sophia G.

description:
Affordable, yummy, friendly, and consistent on the quality of food. Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the place is really small. But the FOOD IS GREAT! 
The Tom Yum soup is tasty, the Pad Thai is flavorful, and the portions are reasonable!
author: Ang P.

description:
My first time ordering from Thai Time, they were very friendly and well priced. We actually had to order some spring rolls to make it to the minimum delivery of $17. I had the veg pad thai, it was pretty good-  more so on the sweet side. If you don't like it sweet you probably won't like theirs but I found it pretty good with some added siracha. I loved that the carrots and cabbage in the dish were finely shredded, something I haven't seen before. My bf had the choo-chee tofu, a red curry with veggies, and it was good as well. Lots of flavor, spicy but not flaming, and delicious chunks of tofu. They will definitely be competition for Ploy 2 for delivery.
The spring rolls were crispy and fresh, but very filling. The portions are huge!
author: Cori W.

description: This is my favorite Thai place in the city.  Usually get a curry and a fish.  Never had anything bad.  My girlfriednd likes the spring rolls.
author: Phil B.

description:
Small venue, great service, great food!  My older son picked the honey chicken and we all loved it (including our toddler).  We also had the a panang type curry which was good.  Though I could taste the fish sauce just a little more than I prefer.  They have brown rice as well as the standard white white & sticky rice.  It's not the best thai i have ever had, but it is pretty good & worth repeating!  We all left with our bellies full & smiles on our faces.

I think the web link that is posted is not for this same business.  The menu on the webpage also looked different which leads me to believe it is not just another location.
author: Megan M.

description: I stopped here for a late lunch while spending a couple days in SF on vacation.  I ordered the Tofu Himma (vegetarian special that day). The food was delicious in flavor but really lacked spicy-ness. Also, none of the curries or dishes come with rice, so remember to order a side of it!
author: Caitlin C.

description:
I always hate it when people give a rating then say, "Really it's a 3 1/2 and not a 4 star review." 

Well call me hypocrite number 1 (or should I say 1 and 1/2).  This is a solid 3 1/2 Thai place in Richmond that's cute and cozy and won't let you down either.
author: Zack S.

description: I always find myself going back here. They have amazing Thai food. They decorate the place with traditional Thai artifacts and such. Good service, I'm a big fan of their pad Thai!!
author: Chanel T.

description: The best Thai food in SF hands down! In fact, I wouldn't be surprised if it's one of the top 10 restaurants in the city when it comes to flavor. The service is also very good. The restaurant itself is very small, with less than 10 tables, and feels kinda like you're in a Thai household getting served home cooking.
author: Alexander M.

description: Came here again after a few years and sure enough the portions were small and the quality of the meats weren't that great. Had ordered a fish plate, and the fish was severally over cooked
author: M C.

description:
You do have to give this place credit for good prices.  And you really have to give them credit for large portions for the lunch special.  Unfortunately I can't give them a ton of credit for taste.

They have a ton of menu items, so I'm sure they do some things better than others.  But rather than figure out a bunch of stuff to share, we opted for the individual lunch specials which included 2 entrees from the list of 14 options, soup, and rice.  

The soup was super bland.  we had to add a lot of hot sauce, but can you really fault "free" soup?  I went for the red curry, and a beef and eggplant option for my two entrees.  I was impressed with the meat.  They gave a lot and it wasn't ground.  The portions were very large for lunch so that made me happy.  It was all cooked well, but sadly everything tasted a little bland to me.  The flavors weren't impressive.  The food was fresh though, but I don't know, I don't think I'd actively go back here.  If I was in the neighborhood and my cohorts wanted to eat here I'd oblige, but I'd never suggest it.  

Next time I probably won't go for the lunch special and will order off the main menu, but I don't have high hopes.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: i crave their chicken wings now! They are so tender crispy and juicy! I can't get out to San Fran enough for my liking. The server was very busy -just her by herself for a whole restaurant full of people, she didn't break a sweat and didn't skip a beat. The peanut sauce, lettuce wraps, rice, everything is to die for here! It would be easy to pass right by, but you'd be doing yourself a disservice if you did.
author: Neriyah J.

description:
Small, cute dainty restaurant on 8th Avenue in the Richmond District can easily be driven by and missed. The decor definitely gave off a "homey" feeling, which makes one feel comfortable when dining in. 

I had dinner here last night with a friend and we ordered the Spring Roll, the Pad Plik King (sauteed deep-fried tofu with green bean and house spicy sauce), and a spicy shrimp dish with string beans. The dishes were yummy and flavorful. My only complaint was the two spicy dishes weren't spicy enough. 

You pay about the same price as King of Thai, but you're not eating grease. I would definitely go back.
author: Candice H.

description: I love this Thai food!  I am always ever jealous of my friend because she lives within delivery distance of Thai Time.  This food is amazing and delicious.  The fish cake curry with eggplant and basil is Thai style spicy and delicious.
author: emily b.

description:
I stopped in for lunch today, as recommended by other reviews for Thai Time. The place was small but had a very inviting and cozy atmosphere. Cute. I went for the lunch combo that, for $7.95, came with a cup of soup, two entrees (from a list of 14), and a nice serving of jasmine rice. The nom-worthy soup featured a respectable amount of tofu, carrots, mushrooms, cabbage, and egg flowers. My two selected dishes, Pad Plik King and Pad Pak Gra Prow (both tofu dishes with assorted veggies), were also quite tasty. 

I also witnessed some awesome kindness on the employees' part when a (presumed) poor, Asian lady came in and offered a few bucks for some soup with minimal ingredients. I didn't see if they accepted the cash, but they did take more than a few minutes to prepare some soup (i.e. not sinkwater) in a take-out container and gave her some tea. Well played, Thai Time. You're officially on my radar.
author: Derek F.

description:
I knew Thai Time was a hole-in-the-wall type of joint, but I did have some hopes for them after seeing a good assortment of reviews on here.  Unfortunately though, while they didn't exactly fail in any sort of way, I still left a bit disappointed by the experience.

The restaurant is pretty tight, but they manage to seat about 20 people give or take, so it's a very intimate sort of feel.  I have to admit, the menu is surprisingly extensive despite the restaurant's size.  In order to get a taste of a variety of things, our table of four decided to start off with a couple of appetizers in addition to our own plates.  The Thai Time combo was the first to arrive, and it's perfect for you if you love fried food - egg rolls, fried fish cake, fried tofu, fried shrimp roll, and fried samosas?  Yeah, definitely a fried food lover's best fried...I mean, friend.  We also got an order of Angel Wings, but it was a bit different than I had expected.  Rather than chicken wings served with a sort of glaze/sauce, it's two wings that are attached to pieces of chicken meat, and then fried.  Sort of like those giant shrimp balls you would find at dim sum restaurants.  Overall, it was all just okay - basically, just a bunch of fried oily food.  The samosas were the best of the bunch by far, and the Angel Wings weren't terrible, just not what I had in mind considering we had already gotten a platter of fried food.

As for my entree, I wanted to stick with something simple, so I ended up with the Yellow Curry Chicken to satisfy my craving.  The portion was quite generous, as it was loaded with chicken, onions and potatoes, so kudos for that.  Even more so for the tastiness.  I didn't get to try what a couple of my friends had ordered, but I did get to sneak a bite of the Pad Thai dish my other friend had ordered.  She read it was supposed to be unique since they use coconut milk (?), but I didnt really taste a strong flavor of it.  Either way, it definitely did taste different than your run of the mill pad thai, but I dont think I had enough to really say if it was better or not.
