The service was rather prompt, and they were certainly friendly enough.  Overall, the food was decent and I wouldn't rule out coming back.  That said though, I'm not sure if I would make it a point to do so...not when I could just find my way over to Marnee Thai.
author: Mike L.

description:
Got the Thai time fried rice which I assume is probably their version of pineapple fried rice.  It was okay.  Not the best but not the worst.  

The rest of my group each got a type of curry and that tasted better.  It made me wish I had ordered that instead.
author: Daniel T.

description:
My friend and I were hungryyy so we were ready to order more food than we can handle.

We started off w/ chicken satay. It was super delicious!

Then we ordered 3 plates -- Chicken Red Curry, Thai Time Fried Rice and Chicken Pad See Ew.

The Chicken Red Curry had a hint of spiciness to it. My friend loves red curry and she said this one had more chicken than curry leaving it kind of dry. She likes pouring the curry over the fried rice. Yum!

The Thai Time Fried Rice and Chicken Pad See Ew were so good! They were very flavorful and super delicious :).

Although the waitress forgot to bring me my water for a while, the food came pretty quickly and service overall was good. I would definitely come back!
author: Justine O.

description:
Okay, the staff is somewhat nice, but... Thai Time, you can stick it.

I just went there and asked for a noodle dish and got chicken because it is easier than getting vegetarian as far as protein goes and the daily allotment of.

The dish arrived and it was so stank bad on the verge of botulism chicken that I politely asked to please re-make it and make it vegetarian.  About ten minutes later, and after hearing people balk in the kitchen I get a "vegetarian option" of the same dish.  It was a little less funky smelling, but thought it is probably just me.

Wrong.

About halfway through I realize I get a piece of chicken (the same  stank smelling chicken I got that I sent back) in my dish.  I had liberally applied delicious chili sauce and green peppers to it and enjoyed the heat and vinegar from those so much I did not smell the rotten flesh smell of the cooked and bad chicken.

I am at home throwing up now from both ends.  I will never go back there again and will advise anyone that wants to check it out with what happened.  I am going to be more wary of meat in restaurant foods in the future if the price point is below a certain range.  I haven't had this happen since I was stupid enough to get a chicken teriyaki bowl from Jack in the Box in 2002.

I really wanted to like it.  I usually vote for the smaller place.  And, what a bunch of jerks for simply remaking the same noodles and just picking out the chicken because -- "stoopit customah don't notice..."  Don't work too hard, guys...

I didn't make up the "smells funny" remark to cause you extra work.  I wonder if they really think their customers want to wait an extra 15 minutes to get more sick?  Thanks, great experience.  Love it.

Forget Thai Stick... have some Thai Sick, you will feel just as stoned after throwing up 4x from their BAD FOOD.
author: Gwen P.

description: cheap and delicious lunch which are great deals. chicken with eggplant was quite good.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
EDIT 07/11/07:  I'm convinced they have the best Pra Ram Tofu around...five stars, and not budging any time soon.  

EDIT 07/08/07:  Last I came here was for take-out.  This time, I dined in.  The tofu was perfectly crisp, and I left with a full and happy stomach.  I've also decided that the family that runs this place is just too adorable.  I love the King of Thai chain, but between Thai Time and King of Thai, I'd pick the former.  One star bump up to five stars.

----------------

What time is it???  It's Thai Time!

The food wasn't mind-blowing, but the hospitality was great--friendly, welcoming service, including water while you wait for your take-out order.  Unfortunately, this place is overshadowed by other Thai restaurants on Clement, even on a weekend.  It's also extremely tiny.  For attentive service and an intimate dining experience, check out Thai Time.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Pretty standard Thai food. However, it is really cheap. I arrived around 7pm on a weekday with a friend, and we had no wait. Food came fast, and was plentiful. They didn't ask us how spicy we wanted our curries, so I was disappointed about that. Also, they didn't have any fresh spring rolls, only fried spring rolls. Good thing I like fried spring rolls.

I'd definitely go back as the price was definitely right.
author: C S.

description:
Small intimate inexpensive Thai restaurant. We ordered a couple Thai beers at 3.50 a bottle and a fried curry puff to get started. The curry puff was a very mild curry but the peanut sauce was oh m gee. I would've just eaten the shredded carrots drizzled with their peanut sauce. 

For the main event I had the Woon San Pad Thai with Shrimp(spelling incorrect?) it was awesome the shrimp tasted so fresh, I even ate the tails because they were nice and crispy but the meat was still perfect. The noodles are thin and flavored with some awesome homemade Thai sauce. I kept getting pleasant hints of sweet coconut. They sparingly put veggies and pieces of tofu in the dish. 

My wife had the spicy green bean rice and it was not the best dish mostly because the spice was disappointing and the chicken was a white dark mix. It was obviously "spiced" for your average San Franciscan. Then of course I tried it in comparison to my dish which made it even more bland. 

All in all a great place go on a date. I would return but get there early it is very small and the service is a take your time joint. 

The total price for 1 appetizer, 3 beers, and 3 entrees was 45 bucks.
author: R J.

description: Great food, simple yet very tasty.  Will definitely be a repeat customer...
author: Pink L.

description:
The beef gang dang was really good. It was tender, moist, and the peppers were crisp. I take issue with a place that won't pony up a free side of white rice, however. Last I checked, rice was the most abundant resource on earth...and you got the stones to make me pay $2.00 for it? Hmmm, I dunno about your tactics, but I can't tell you what to do when you're shelling out curry that's this good. 

I went in at 3pm on a Saturday with the intention of being left alone, and left alone I was. The joint was nice and empty and the service was quick and efficient. Cheers to that. 

FInally, spend your appetizer cash on something other than the spring rolls. They were filled some random dark-colored something and those creepy translucent noodles that look like melted plastic wrap. 

Go here, be happy, pay for rice.
author: kenton y.

description:
Thai Time is a great neighborhood gem, and one of my go to spots for good, authentic Thai food.  They always great specials, such as the salmon curry, which keep me coming back to see what they will come up with next.  The wait staff is friendly, unpretentious, and always willing to help if you have questions about the menu.

On my most recent trip, we had the spicy green beans, pad thai, and the gang garee gai, which were all quite tasty, and for about $7 a dish, you really cant beat the price!  I actually don't think there are any menu items at Thai Time that are over $12-$13.  This turned out to be a good amount of food for three people, and I believe we even took a small amount home afterwards. 

The only real drawback of Thai Time is the size of the restaurant, which is tiny.  This place is not good for large groups, or even groups larger than
4-5 in my opinion.  Typically, my wait hasn't been more than 20 minutes or so.  Anyways, next time you're in the Richmond and looking to grub on some good Thai fare, stop by Thai Time, and Im sure you'll enjoy it!
author: David M.

description:
I am bummed that I just recently discovered this place! 

It's a tiny place just off of Clement Street and easy to overlook. 

They have really good vegetarian Thai food. My friend and I got the pad thai, some tom yum soup, and thai iced teas. We were pleasantly surprised and loved our meal!  Everyone was so nice and the prices were very affordable ($6.95 per dish and $1.95 for the tea) 

They were pretty busy but we called in our order for take out and it was ready within 20 min.  

I would go to Thai time over other Thai places in the area. 
Such a good find!   Will be back for sure!
author: Katie I.

description: I came to this place looking for something quick and cheap. And it is definitely that, quick and cheap. I ordered Pad See Ew, which was good enough, and shrimp paste rice with green mango. The shrimp paste rice with pork and mango is a Thai dish I don't see too often and is a dish that really smells because of the shrimp paste. However, it is also a dish that I love to order. Their version was good enough but the only thing I didn't like is that they are a little skimpy on the meat in that dish so I wouldn't be getting that particular dish at this restaurant anymore. However, their Pad See Ew was delicious and they had really great service. The place is small but cozy and the cheap prices are definitely worth coming back for.
author: Rylan C.

description: The best Thai food in San Francisco. I came here three times with my friends and family, we really love their  Duck Fried Rice and Papaya Salad. the service was good.
author: Roy L.

description:
They have the BEST green curry I have ever had. It is just the right amount of spicy that an Indian girl could crave. The heat doesn't cover the flavor of the food. 
There is also a delicious amount of bamboo in the curry so it's crunchy and yum.
I didn't have any meat so I can't really comment on the quality of it. However, try the curry with tofu if you're not a total meatatarian. 
Parking was fairly easy as I can after bank hours and parked across the street. 
I came in close to closing and never felt rushed or pressured. 
The bathroom is smaller than a linen closet and requires you walking through the kitchen, but it's clean.
author: prachi v.

description:
Food AWESOME! 
Price SO REASONABLE!!!
Service - OUTSTANDING**
Location - only a couple blocks aways (from me at least kk)

It can't get any better. 
I've permanently switched from O$h@'s .
author: k k.

description:
Thank you sir, may I have another...

Best pad thai I have ever had.

I clearly only took the food part into consideration b/c the service was mediocre at best. We waited so long to even get water on the table. I am just a little more forgiving of poor service when the food is outstanding.
author: Lauren J.

description: My go to Thai place.  Best chicken pad Thai I've had. There's a lot of food place in clement but this always satisfies my craving for food.
author: Abegail N.

description:
This place was good, I would go back if I was in the area, but maybe not make a special trip for it.  The restaurant is super tiny, we were lucky to get an open table when we walked in.  
The server let us loook at the menu a LONG time before coming by for orders, but then things picked up.  They were attentive with refils and food came out warm and pretty quickly
The pad thai was good, and the chicken with green beans was also tasty.  The green beens were cooked to perfection-I couldn't get over how snappy but tender they were.  The chicken dish didn't have enough sauce though, so it was a little on the dry side.  
The bill for 2 with dinner and drinks came out to $20, so the price is righ as far as I'm concerned.
author: L F.

description: Amazing vegetarian nook in the inner richmond. As a vegetarian it is difficult to find good food and this place lived up to the hype. You must eat here if you want thr best thai experience or vegetarian experience of your life!!!!!
author: David T.

description:
Coming here may not be an extravagant, awe-inspiring, innovative gastronomic experience ... but it's good Thai food.  Really good.  And for a very reasonable price.

It's a tiny place, tucked just off of Clement Street -- a true hole-in-the-wall -- but comfortable for an intimate dinner of up to four people.  I'm always worried there will be a wait because it's so small, but I've typically been seated right away.

Tonight, I tried the vegetarian green curry, comprising a diverse mix of vegetables, tofu and coconut curry goodness. Fantastic, and just the right amount of heat.  My BF ordered the green curry fried rice, substituting tofu for the chicken; also incredibly good.

The first time I came here, I ordered the vegetarian Pad Thai, which I'm kind of picky about; it was so delicious I think I've ordered it almost every time I've come here (and I definitely prefer it to their Pad See Ew, which is good, but could be more flavorful). Just be careful if you ask for your dish to be made spicy -- the second time I came here and made this request, my lips were totally on fire. I like that they think to ask whether eggs are okay for the vegetarian orders since I was vegan for a short time. I'm usually too stuffed for dessert, but the mango with sticky rice is another winner here.

To top it off, the wait staff is so pleasant and wonderful, which makes coming here all the more enjoyable.  Can't wait for next time, Thai Time!
author: Jamie T.

description:
It's a solid four stars now, maybe even 4.5!  
 
Papaya salad, red curry beef, sauteed chicken, sauteed shrimp and string beans, fried tofu curry with onions and peanuts.  All delicious, all fantastic.  We were also famished so that could be why it was so good.  But it really was so good!  $41 take out.  

After so many misses these past couple of weeks, this was a hit.  A BIG hit.  

We still haven't eaten inside yet, but it's cute.

I think this will be our go to Thai place in SF from now on.
author: Mrs F.

description:
Came here with Sarah D for a quick bite after a long day at work. I have bookmarked this place and was praying that this place would be great. Long story short............I was not impressed. 

They were busy and it was almost impossible for them to take our orders, let alone give us water. It was extremely stuffy in here tonight. The place can be cramped and cozy. Or........ it can be cramped and claustrophobic. It was the latter tonight because it was packed. 

We ordered: 

Tom Yum soup (had better.....little too sweet) 
pad thai with shrimp ( probably their best dish here) 
garlic rice with breaded fried chicken ( not bad) 
pork with garlic and basil, I asked for it minced but didn't get it.( very tough) 

Service on the other hand..........was great. 

After ordering the waitress then tells us that it would be an additional 15 minute wait for our food due to the backup in food orders. Shouldn't they have told us this before we ordered? It was actually 30 minutes and it was probably the longest dining experience at a Thai restaurant for myself. 

The long wait to get water, to take our orders, and the arrival of food might have made the food not as tasty. I might try this place one more time when it is not so crowded. For now...........it is not really all that. Marnee Thai, Chabaa, Osha(geary) are far better than this place.
author: jason g.

description: The portions are pretty big. The angel wing was good. The entrees aren't that good. The pat thai is missing something and it's really soggy. The pat see ew isn't anything special, it taste like Chinese stir fried. I would not go again.
author: Stacy C.

description: Disappointed. Yelp reviews and photos of high times at Thai time had my partner and I in high expectations of this cozy home style dive. I went with the Panang curry because the photo looked plentiful but I was served over a dozen tofu chunks in a shallow puddle of very greasy, heartburn inducing to those susceptible, sauce. I admit the flavor is delicious and the service is warming but unfortunately this is not the Thai place for me.
author: Libra J.

description: First off let me just say the Angel Wings were INCREDIBLE. That being said, the main courses unfortunately left a lot to be desired. I got the noodles with chicken, broccoli and carrots and my husband got fried rice with shrimp and pork. My chicken was WAY overcooked and dry and the noodles were super sweet which really overpowered any of the other flavors. My husband's dish was a mix of flavors that didn't compliment each other the pork and mini shrimp were over cooked and tough and the rice was mushy. Based on the appetizer we had high expectations for the entrees but were very disappointed in the end. I'm giving a three star rating purely for the delicious appetizer and friendly staff. Another heads up, this place is TINY, maybe 7-8 tables total so it tends to get crowded REALLY fast, be prepared to wait.
author: Amanda T.

description:
I had a desire for Thai take-out, so I went to GrubHub to locate a good candidate. (One thing I have never managed to find - a reliable, consistently good Thai restaurant that delivers.) Thai Time looked promising - reviews on GrubHub site and on this site were, in general, very positive, and the prices seemed very reasonable.

I went for a few dishes - Tom Yum Soup, Pad Thai and their "signature" Green Curry Chicken. After a bit of difficulty - the woman who took my call seemed to have great difficulty understanding me, and it sounded like there was great chaos in the kitchen behind her - I ordered, and the food was promised within 45 minutes.

It was delivered right on time, and there seemed to be a *lot* of food. I started with the soup - very plentiful, and zesty & lemony - tasty broth and vegetables, but with lots of bits of old, gray chicken pieces - a turn off! The Pad Thai was good. (I ordered it with shrimp instead of chicken.) However, the Green Curry again had pieces of really unappetizing, nauseating chicken. That was it -- I'd had enough.

Very disappointing - the meat spoiled the meal, and grossed me out. I'm unlikely to go back. I'm surprised that they dont make an attempt to improve the quality of their chicken - everything else appears to be of a good quality (and I notice now that others at Yelp have commented about the quality of the meat.)
author: donal c.

description: had a green curry fried rice, it was okay, not worth for another visit.There are a lot more Thai restaurant better than this one
author: Momo G.

description:
This is my go-to Thai Spot. Found this place on yelp and i love that it has a homey atmosphere. Their dishes are reasonably portioned and priced. The service is great, mostly because its a small restaurant and the waitress only has a limited number of tables to serve at a time. I love the pad kee mao, very delicious. My boyfriend usually orders the rad na and the gravy that accompanies it is delicious also. 

I love their lunch items because they are priced around $6.50 or more and it comes with soup. I have yet to find a better thai restaurant!
author: Connie C.

description: Fast, great service, delicious food, Thai Time rocks.  Try the young coconut and the mango sticky rice.
author: Audra S.

description: Service was rocky, but the waitress was hustling with a very busy lunch crowd. Tasty food. Small interior that smelled great and felt good coming in from the cold.
author: Colin W.

description: Now our favorite Thai place in our neighborhood in the Inner Richmond.  Great menu, great tasting and prepared dishes, very reasonably priced.  Cute too.  We love it here.
author: Patrick M.

description: Great Thai food.  We've eaten in and ordered delivery - both ways the food is delicious.  It's small and clean and the staff are very nice.
author: Denise G.

description: Thai time combo is a lot of food lol
author: Yan X.

description:
Warning to all vegetarians - even though their menu claims to be vegetarian, most of the curries at Thai Time do have fish sauce in them.  My husband and I have been eating here since we moved to the neighborhood almost 3 years ago and absolutely loved their green curry.  We've introduced countless friends & family members to their food - you can imagine my shock and anger last night when placing an order for takeout, I verified - as I have done for every single order I've placed there - this order is all vegetarian so no fish sauce, etc, - I was told that the green & red curries already have fish sauce in them and can't be made without.  So disappointed and angry that in 3 years of ordering here, this is the FIRST time this was the answer I was given.

Don't call it a "vegetarian menu" if many of the items on it are not.  And when someone asks you whether something contains fish sauce, if you don't know the answer, find out - and answer honestly.  Because if it didn't matter and wasn't so important, we wouldn't be asking.

Sorry Thai Time - you just lost some of your most loyal diners.
author: N. J. K.

description: I eat a lot of thai food. Most San Francisco thai restaurants make pretty good food that have almost always been 3.5-4.5 stars in my book. Thai Time has blown me away and literally redefined how amazing thai food could be. This is the best of 30-40 thai restaurants I've been to all over the city.
author: Doug H.

description:
I order from this place all the time, and have never been disappointed.  They do a really good spicy green curry, and the yellow isn't too bad either.

However, i would recommend getting the vegetarian version of whatever you get, because the meat that they use isn't of very good quality and ends up bringing down the rest of the meal.
author: Eric W.

description:
Really great Thai place in the city. Excellent food, and the price is really cheap. Kind of a small hole in the wall location, but that adds to the experience really, and the decor inside is nice.

I scored free parking on the meters in front of the restaurant on a Sunday evening, I was by myself and one of the two waitresses seated me immediately. After looking through the menu, I decided on the spring rolls and chicken pad siew (ordered spicy), as well as a pad thai for takeaway. The food came out quick, and the (fried) spring rolls were very crispy and delicious. The pad siew was huge, and excellent, though I may have underestimated the spicyness a bit.

My pad thai was boxed up and ready for me when the cheque came, and tasted excellent even the next day reheated for lunch. Couldn't make a word of complaint about anything here, and the price was downright cheap for the quality and quantity of food. For a large beer, 2 entrees and an appetizer, my bill was only $32. I'll definitely be coming back here next time I'm in the area.
author: Lucky D.

description:
The chicken was grey. WTF. Scared the shit outta me. Thought I was eating evil. Don't get me wrong though, I still finished my food. Still... the chicken was grey.

Will look around for another Thai place.
author: Aaron Z.

description: Cute place. Very small. Pad see eu with roast duck was delicious. So was the yellow curry. Excellent, friendly, speedy service. A fun experience to go through their little tiny kitchen with grandma (?) cooking to reach the restroom. Will be back.
author: Frank F.

description:
This is such a cute little restaurant, with literally only 8 or 9 tables! This service is great because its so little the waitress is always near ready to help.
My favorite dish of pineapple fried rice with tofu is always really yummy here, with alot of different stuff in there!
I have also tasted the pad thai and it was great!
My boyfirend loves spicy things and is always able to find something overly spicy from the menu to satisfy that craving, so overall its a great place!
author: Noelle L.

description: I have yet to find a Thai restaurant with more tasty food and a better value.  'Nuff said!
author: Katelynn L.

description: My unhappy review of Halu across the street now results in my happy review of Thai Time! A satisfying and extensive menu, priced reasonably, and the staff genuinely care about your well-being while eating there. Support this business!
author: Leslie F.

description: real good place to hang out enjoy real real good food. no matter how and no matter where it is good small to have this place . love have it! and wonderful.
author: Sukhum J J A.

description:
This smalish, obscure place is quite a hidden gem, located in the busy and robust area of the shops at Clement.  It's easy to miss this sweet find, but once you enter this cozy, bland looking restaurant, get ready for some good food time at Thai Time!

My friend and I came here for lunch, which they aptly offered wonderful lunch combinations.  This deal allows you to choose 2 authentic Thai items (out of 14) for the incredible price of $8.  This includes their soup of the day.  I forgot the names of the items in Thai, but what I had ordered were grilled eggplant with beef, and sauteed chicken with fine peanut sauce.  Actually, there were more stuff in it but I kinda forgot them all.  

Overall, it was very satisfying and authentic.  I enjoy going to Thai restaurants in SF and this one is definitely one of the best I've tried.  On top of that, the service was above average, as the waitress was very friendly and extremely attentive with our drinks.

4 stars for sure!
author: David N.

description:
Originally went to the Thai place around the corner from here but they didn't serve beer/wine so we relocate to here. So happy because this place was so much better. Cute cozy dinning without harsh lighting.  
Good Thai food- I was in Thailand for a month this summer and they serve you up the real stuff at Thai Time
Good beers imported from Thailand
Friendly service imported from Thailand
Good vibes imported from Thailand

Will be returning soon
author: Carlos S.

description: I miss living near Thai Time. One of my favorite thai places in the city. It's a small, hole in the wall place but very delicious, satisfying food! The places make me feel at home with the feeling of a home cooked meal. The service is great and lots of options for vegetarians. I love their yellow curry with tofu. I've tried other dishes, and all so tasty and full of flavors!
author: Aiza B.

description: Thai Time is a great place to bring people! It's small & intimate & super cheap! I've never waited for a table but that seems to be changing with more popularity (yay for the family!). The last couple times I've been there (last 8 or so haha) they used WAAAY too much oil. Thai food isn't known for being light fare but seriously, cut back a little! Best fried tofu in the land!
author: K T.

description:
I'm on a flu-induced soup regimen this week. My liquid diet tour of duty has included chicken pho, Korean tofu soup, ramen, canned chicken noodle and last but not least, tom kha gai from Thai Time (the coconut-based sweet and sour chicken soup). 

Here's how I ended up eating Thai Time soup... 
Stop #1 - The doctor. Verdict -- nastiest flu I've had in years. Leave with two prescriptions, including a throat numbing gargle. 
Stop #2 - Soup (self-prescribed as my third medicine). I wanted Thai soup and used mobile Yelp to locate this gem of a tiny restaurant near my doctor's. They had the soup ready in 5 minutes and filled my request to make it spicy.
Stop #3 - Home to eat my soup. Whoa! They weren't kidding it's spicy. Every sore inch of my throat starts screaming. So I swish a bit of the numbing stuff, then proceed to eat the rest of the bowl. Delicious. And now my sinuses are clear. Hallelujah. 

Can't wait to go back and try more. Also excited to see that they deliver for free. And that they have a selection of rices including brown, jasmine, garlic and sticky rice, not just white rice.
author: Shoshana D.

description:
This place is great. It's super small, but doesn't seem to be crowded that often for some reason. (Maybe because It's a little bit off the beaten path...)

I've had the pad thai, green curry dish and mango sticky rice desert. My friends have all had great meals here as well.

The trip to the bathroom is through the kitchen which makes for an interesting experience checking out what they are cooking!
author: Jason O.

description: Ate here.. and ate at two other thai place around this area.. I honestly dont know which one is better.. I have to admit, I am not a big fan of the atmosphere here.. kind of cramped and dark.. and not the romantic kind of dark either.. You can see the kitchen too.. which is not a bad thing.. but its bad if you own an asian restaurant.. lol.. I can say this cause Im full asian.. so dont call me racist cause I cant really be racist about my own race??
author: Sean P.

description:
I've ordered take out from here twice now, first time the order was perfect, food was delicious.  Second time, they messed up the order, and brought something completely different than what we ordered.  However, whatever they brought was good too.  I'll order again, maybe they'll bring something else yummy!

Never eaten inside the place, so I can't comment on that.  Prices are fairly reasonable for Thai food....
author: Michelle L.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in SF. I thought King of Thai Noodles was good but this place has better food, nicer staff, cleaner kitchen and eating area, nicer eating area, its all around just better.
author: Michael R.

description:
Pretty authentic if you ask me.  The service was awesome and since we came during an off hour (about 4pm), there was no wait for a table.  Overall, good bang for your buck.

*Tom Yum Gai: a little too sweet but full of chicken and mushroom-y goodness
*Pad see ew: very authentic, good portions
*Pad thai: very tasty.  Not dry and had a very slight coconut flavor going on.   Would certainly order this again.
*Basil Chicken: chicken was not dry or stringy.  Good flavor
*Red curry duck: probably one of my favorite dishes.  Rice drenched with curry sauce...yum!  Only complaint: there was not that much duck.
author: Yeelo N.

description:
I really love the cozy vibe of this little spot. After only a couple visits, they recognized me and made suggestions when they noticed I didn't eat all my chicken in the yellow curry dish. It is one of the few places I comfortably dine-in by myself, because well, I don't really feel alone.
The dishes I have tried so far have been better and more home-made tasting than all the other local thai joints that seem to all use the same curry paste, etc. They also get props from me for using some dark meat in their chicken dishes. the savory crepe is super tasty. I want to encourage them to go ahead and get a bit more creative from time to time. especially on the veggie and seasoning tip. If it ain't broke, flaunt it!
perfect neighborhood thai restaurant.
author: sundown c.

description:
Right after a quick drive home from school after finals (12/10), I came here through a quick yelp search. When I walked in on a Thursday afternoon at 1 or so, the tables were empty except for one. I guess we were lucky since it was a super tiny restaurant. It had a cozy and clean feeling. My eyes wandered and I could not spot a bathroom. I did not dare ask.

The lunch menu is cheap, as you guys promised us. We ordered the Pad Thai , Pad See Ew , and a yellow curry. I was glad we ordered three things, because the Pad Thai would not have filled me up. The Pad Thai was a bit better than average. The Pad See Ew had carrots?! That was awkward. I thought the curry was definitely smaller than usual and lacked flavor. However, we did have to get a box for the half-eaten curry. I would definitely come back when I'm back in the area. I just hope I get lucky with another parking spot again.
author: Glen H.

description: Young coconut seafood curry was awesome! Went well wit their thai beer too. Tiny place fits less than 25 people, but was not max capacity on the 2 dinners I've been there. Super friendly. If you need to use their restroom, be prepared to walk through a tiny kitchen (clean), and into an airline-size restroom (also clean).
author: Lee W.

description:
I am happy with everything I've tried so far. I've had the green curry roti with generous portions of creamy spicy fragrant curry beef, chicken and veggies and a serving of flaky roti. I've also had the kao kook ga pi, shrimp sauce fried rice with sweet pork, mango, and veggies.
I am looking forward to going again with a large group so I can try more of their menu!
author: Eric C.

description: Great lunch deals. Friendly service. Lots to choose from. I've been coming back for well over a year now. The Tom Kar Gai soup is exceptional.
author: Eric F.

description: Our Friends from The OC came out to SF and we were looking for a Thai Restaurant. We came upon this small place and I am glad we did. The food was very good and the Thai Tea was amazing. The Rad Na was very good and the curry was excellent. Coming back for sure.
author: JC L.

description:
this restaurant is very small inside, not much bigger than my living room

I ordered Pad Thai with Shrimp and a Thai ice coffee, I noticed the pad thai was a little too sweet? the sauce had a little too much sugar, I dont really like it so sweet and Ive had better, but it was still pretty good, I should have ordered the Thai spicey chicken with basil over rice instead, I prefer salty / spicey foods better than sweet. I would come back again to try other dishes, the service was excellent!
author: Mr Bolo B.

description:
Thai Time has great food and they deliver in the neighborhood too.  We had some really delicious curries and stir fry dishes here.  I do not even like Pad Thai and I think it's a must have here. The prices are very reasonable.  We liked the green curry duck, the pra ram with tofu, stirfried eggplant and the coconut and brown rice.

It's very cozy here.   On a Saturday night, we were told to come back in one hour.  We couldn't wait because we were starving so we didn't come back.  

On another night we ordered delivery (yay they deliver) and were told it was going to be about 45 minutes.  No problem. After 1 hour, I want to call them but I am encouraged to wait.  After 1.5 hours I am cranky and hungry and call them and asks where is my food.  And supposedly the driver was on his way.  I asked them to call us next time if they are running late. If their food was not so delicious I might have been more upset!
author: Betty L.

description:
Yes, I know that the name makes it sound like Fisher Price My First Thai Restaurant, but don't let that fool you. This is definitely one of my favorite Thai places in the city. I've eaten their food (dine-in and take-out) dozens? maybe hundreds? of times, and they never disappoint. Some highlights are the Tofu Gra Prow Krob (crispy tofu with curry-ish chili sauce and basil), Tom Kha Gai soup, Garee Puffs and Pad Plik King (green beans with choice of meat/tofu, try it with pork!). If you're feeling fancy, get the garlic rice instead of plain, it adds even more flavor to the experience.

They are also incredibly accommodating. My sister is a vegan (and picky), and she routinely makes up dishes and they do it without complaint. Let me repeat that: they are willing to cook food THAT YOU HAVE INVENTED ON THE SPOT. Want crispy tofu with peanut sauce, pumpkin and veggies but no mushrooms or fish sauce? Done. Like pineapple curry but hate duck and love green beans? Ask them to substitute chicken for the duck and add the beans, they will do it for you. Yes, you may have to repeat your request for maximum clarity, but isn't it worth it for a customized Thai-licious meal?
author: Valerie M.

description:
Tried this spot out last night, and I ave to say, it's not that bad. Not the greatest by any stretch, but the portions were decent sized and the food was pretty tasty overall. For what you got, the prices were fairly spot on. 

I normally never eat vegetarian, but decided since it's the onset of Spring/Summer and since I'm trying to be more health conscious, I'd give it a go, and was actually pretty satisfied. They make a mean tofu dish!

The curry puffs were my favorite part of the meal...almost a Thai samosa kinda thing, but the Pad Ka Meur was dern tasty. 

If you want a VERY casual, lowkey spot to get some decent Thai, if you're in the 'hood, pop by!
author: Marco M.

description:
This place is pretty good. In fact, I think I am going to make a point of going more often. For some reason having a Singha here and some noodles is oddly transporting in a way that a lot of other places can't summon up. Its got a great balance of sweet to spicy and they have that whole traditional "wood and fabric covering everything" decor. Plus, you have to walk through their closet of a kitchen to get to the restroom and to think that they create their food in such cramped quarters is worthy of applause.

Noodles = good.
Curry = good.
seafood = good! (surprise)
author: Zac H.

description:
Me and my friend decided to go somewhere new just by driving around and while driving on clement, at the corner of my eye, i spotted thai time!! just what we were looking for, hole-in-the-wall!

We walked in, and the restaurant is SUPER TINY! but cozy. there weren't much people but two other parties in there. but then in the next 15 minutes, people started coming in and by the time we were done eating, the restaurant was full with people waiting to be seated!

So we did family style. I got a Thai iced tea, that was pretty standard. My friend got hot tea, and I think she liked it. Ordered the spring rolls for appetizers. There were 4 pieces and all cut in half and served with this sweet/sour sauce. yummy. Ordered the yellow curry with beef. That was just a little spicy but tasted very good with rice. And we also ordered sweet and sour chicken over rice. the chicken was pretty good and it was fried. Total came out to be $32 including tip/tax.

This place can be deceiving on the outside but thats where you find the best and affordable food! Cheers to Hole-in-the-walls!
author: Amy X.

description: We found this place on Yelp and decided to try it... It was okay. No parking like anywhere but I wont fault them for that since its right next to super busy Clement Street. Ordered the Tom Yum Soup and the Pad Thai--our testers for when we try out new Thai places. The pad thai was really delish and flavorful but the portion was just okay...The tom yum soup was super small. It was likek an appetizer size! I was hoping it was just in my head but 15 min after I left the place, I ended up eating a 2nd lunch. The food is good but I'd need to order like double what I normally order.
author: Amy S.

description:
I'm a big fan of Green Apple bookstore, but not so much a fan of the Clement area. Can you blame me? I can't read most of the signs, Pizza Hut doesn't deliver to street corners, and it's damn near impossible to tell whether you're walking into a used clothing store or a restaurant until you're inside.

Now I can't remember where I found out about Thai Time. But I do remember that while waiting for some friends, an old, windbeaten woman staggered onto her stoop next door in a tweety bird nightie, telling me she sensed good energy from me. It was some kind of force, she explained, and she would love to tell me more about it. I'm pretty sure she wanted my money, but I'm always willing to take a euphemism at face value. Not that I fell into her trap. I could smell the 40's on her breath, and I'm still unsure whether the spot on her neck was a mole or a stoma.

Finally my friends arrived, and we sat down to what is the best Thai food I've had in the city--bar none. The panang curry was spicy and flavorful, it tasted fresh, and when I went to the bathroom I saw that it was indeed made by some tiny thai grandma. How authentic! I checked to see if they had her chained to anything, but it looked like she was crammed back there of her own volition. And then, a thought: did I find it strange that I had to walk into and through the kitchen to take a pee? Why yes. Yes I did. That's not sanitary at all. Not that I cared once I had sat back down and begun eying my boyfriend's leftovers. 

And to be truthful, I still have little to no complaints about the place. The service was brisk but efficient. The food was quite good and well priced. And I finally have a go-to spot amidst the land of Happy China Golden King Rainbow Dragon Express Kitchens.
author: Brian K.

description:
We went to Thai Time the other night after checking Yelp reviews.  It's a very small little place with only a few tables.  It was very cute and quaint, kind of felt like eating dinner over at someone's house and the couple that ran it is adorable.

The food was suburb, the service was speedy, and the prices were easy on the wallet.  The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is cause the appetizer of soft shelled crab was a little "oceany" but other then that, the main course was simply divine and the beer kept flowing!

We were glad that we decided to head out to to eat here and will be back.  If you are looking for a little cozy place to get some thai food, this is the place to go.  One thing, it's a perfect date restaurant but the tables are super close together so keep the talk about buying more lube on the DL since everyone there will hear you.
author: Steve P.

description:
My friends and I came to this little hole-in-the-wall after Nightlife at the Academy of Sciences.  Who knew you couldn't get full off of overpriced alcoholic drinks?

It's a very small but cozy place just off of Clement with amazing green curry.  That's really all you need to know.
author: Jen L.

description:
Sunday was a beautiful day. Such a wonderful day to take a drive to the City and soak in the sun. My girls wanted to hit the Exploratorium. And we were hungry for lunch. After writing 13 reviews - yes, I'm just a Yelp beginner, folks - I thought , alright, I'm going to put Yelp to work finally and find good Thai. This literal "hole in the wall" turned up as one of three Thai restaurants in the City with a 4.5 rating. (No 5 rating places, by the way.) We actually tried to go to one of the "other" 4.5 places right around the corner on Geary, but lucky for us, it was closed. Thai Time did not disappoint! No way! Great stuff here folks!

Upon walking through the door, the first thing I thought was - oooh, wow, pretty small. I think my master bedroom is bigger than the dining area! My wife counted enough seats for, hmmm, maybe 26 "small" patrons. Luckily I'm one of those small patrons - yah, right! Hah! Do I 'eat to live', or do I 'live to eat'? Uhhhhh, hmmmm, I think the latter! Don't let the small surroundings scare you away, 'cause it'll be your loss!

Okay, time to order. The soft-spoken server made several recommendations, almost all of them seafood (I think they might specialize in seafood). But my family wasn't in the mood for seafood today, so we tried the following:

- Satay (chicken), as an appetizer
- Tofu Tod, as an appetizer
- Gang Dang (beef), as an entree
- Gang Garee Gai, as an entree
- Moo Yang, as an entree

Delightful food! The Satay was solid in taste. My little one loved it, so I think it was right on the money. The tofu was also very good, cut in a smaller, triangular 3-dimensional shape than you're used to in other Thai restaurants, and we counted this as yet another plus, because they were bite-size for the kids. Delightful appetizers!

Now for the entrees. My wife felt strongly that we specify the dishes to be "mild", because she believes that you'll find more "truly" spiced Thai in the City, as opposed to Thai fare in the burbs. I think she was right. The "mild" Gang Dang had a tiny "kick" to it, but I didn't mind. I loved it. And, I usually don't like bamboo shoots, but the Gang Dang had the shoots cut thinner than usual, and they complemented my meal fine. The Gang Garee Gai is your typical Yellow Curry Chicken - delicious here at Thai Time. The potatoes, in particular, were cooked well, teaming with the onions and savory yellow sauce to make the chicken dance on your taste buds. And the Moo Yang was great too - your typical honey-grilled-pork, but satisfying with every bite. Delightful entrees!

Uhhhh, we're not done yet! There's dessert too. The sticky rice and mango was just right. Outside of the Philippines, I seldom eat mangoes, but the one on the plate today was sweet and enjoyable for me. We also had the peculiar "Roti". I was curious about this, 'cause I thought Roti was Indian, not Thai. The server returned with the Roti, explaining that this was their "Thai" version, and what a yummy dessert it was! Thin, moist yet crispy (on the edges) bread, covered with condensed milk and sugar. Wow! Delightful desserts!

In the end, I give Thai Time 4.5 STARS. Wonderful Thai food. Attentive service. Much better than my usual "burb" Thai cuisine, but then again, this is City Thai, right? Whenever I'm back in the area, I'll definitely return to sample something new from their extensive menu. But until then...it's....

Barracudaman over and out!
author: Shawn A.

description:
My roommate has been telling me about this place for a while, but it's often been crowded when I've tried to go for dinner. I tried it today for a late lunch and found it pretty empty, which was great for me because my food came pretty quickly and the waitress was very (though not overly) attentive.

I had #87, which had lots of Japanese eggplant, bell peppers, onions, basil and mushrooms. Had I thought about it, I probably should have realized they'd be straw mushrooms (which I really dislike), so I ended up pushing them all to the side. The dish was a little oily, but overall it was well seasoned and very tasty. I had an order of garlic rice as well, which wasn't especially garlicky, but was good nonetheless. 

The "housemade lemonade" was refreshing, but it was somewhere between lemon and lime, not straight lemon. 

Finally, I really enjoyed their goldfish tank. They have the big, bulgy-eyed fish that I've always found cool but a little creepy. They gave me, a single diner, something to focus on while I waited for my food.
author: Katie I.

description:
It's a cute little place, and the food is decent enough, but not great. A plus is that it is pretty cheap, and they have a fairly extensive menu. We ordered angels wings, beef pad see ew, and chicken panang curry. You really can't go wrong with the angels wings, anything fried is always delicious.
I take my pad see ew pretty seriously, and the pad see ew was fair. The beef in the pad see ew was overcooked, and  the rest of the noodle dish was ok, but lacking in flavor (nothing a little hot sauce doesn't help). The panang curry was pretty good, loaded with chicken, which was nice, but could have used some more sauce, and again, more spice (again, hot sauce helped a lot here). All in all, it was cheap, and pretty good, but I've had better.
author: Kelly L.

description:
My best first date in a long time was placed in the quaint, romantic setting of Thai Time. It had been recommended to me randomly when I was in green Apple (1 block up!) and freaked out that I'd left my wallet at King of Thai across the street. Upon finding my wallet, the store clerk mentioned to me of a 'better Thai place' on 8Th avenue around the corner, the girl waiting behind me confirmed the recommendation. Thank you to you both!

The menu is huge and full of the usual favorites like pad Thai and contemporary style twists on the favorites, like green curry with salmon and Japanese eggplant. The service of course quick and friendly. The bathroom is a little scary. A really cute place to take someone you're really crushing on :)
author: nina B.

description:
I like this place for the most part, and it's conveniently located next to my house. However, as I sit here eating their Pad Thai dish I think how gross it is. WARNING: do not get the Pad Thai from here! So many places in SF have bad Pad Thai and these people are Thai, come on now. 

The best Pad Thai I have found so far is at Bai Som Thai Kitchen on Clement at 22nd. I suggest trying theirs and if you have a place that you think tops theirs, then please email me! Also, Herbivore on Divisadero has some NASTY Pad Thai...I thought I was eating peanut butter. 

The best dish I have had at Thai Time is their Green Salmon dish. It's steamed salmon in a green curry sauce...its pretty tasty.
author: Anne A.

description: This was my first Thai Food experience and I was definitely impressed. The service was excellent, and all of our food was awesome!
author: Philip S.

description:
My hubby and I had heard this place was great and were excited to try it.  The atmosphere and service were both good.  The  chicken satay appetizer was delicious.  For entrees we had the Pad Ma Kuer (tofu with egglant and lots of other yummy stuff) and the  Pad Prik Khing (chicken with green beans and lots of other yummy stuff).  Both were very tasty and there were lots of leftovers.

Unfortunately -- a few problems, one quite major: 1st the wrong drink was brought out to us; 2nd the wrong meals were brought out to us - both problems were quickly corrected (minus no stars for these issues). 3rd, the hot tea was $1.75 though a coke was $1.25 - very strange - and in my opinion too much money for tea, but that alone also doesn't merit a deduction in stars.  

The big problem - my hubby and I both had major stomach issues for the 48 hours following our meal...  For this reason alone, while I would otherwise have given this place 4 stars, I will not be going back.
author: Cara C.

description:
We got delivery from Thai Time. I thought it was okay - but I would try other Thai places before ordering from Thai Time again.

My wife disliked it and would never order from Thai Time again.

The meats seemed to be from lower down on the USDA grade scale, and the flavors were just so-so.
author: Greg H.

description:
Can I just say one more time how much I love this place? For having discovered it just this year, I find myself eating here on an average of once a week (sometimes more...).

They have a lunch combination for $7.50 which includes two choices of entrees from a list of popular dishes and curries, jasmine rice plus vegetarian tofu-egg drop soup (which rocks my world!). I am a sucker for the Pra Ram Tofu and Tofu Gra Prow Krob. These curries are rich and buttery smooth, with a really decadent finish to the sauce, much enhanced with coconut and aromatic seasonings. I always substitute garlic rice for the jasmine. It looks browner and I can even pretend it's healthier than the usual white rice fare.

The place is cozy and cutely decorated on the inside and the ladies here are so sweet and friendly. Very attentive service, and if you stop in at lunch time they will be busy in the back kitchens as well, preparing each dish made-to-order. I know this because I can hear the pans sizzling each time, and literally smell the fresh curry wafting into the dining room. If that's not good, I don't know what is!

Really good noodle dishes as well; I'm partial to the Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, and Pad Kee Mow.

NB: I just noticed today that the consistency of the Tofu Gra Prow Krob was slightly thinner than usual; still tasted delicious though.
author: Anna S.

description:
I had take out from Thai Time yesterday, and it' a very good value for good food. I got drunken noodles and yellow curry w/chicken and potatoes, and the total bill was about $16, and it's fed me and my girlfriend for two meals so far, and there's still a little bit of curry left. The drunken noodles is an interesting mix between what I usually expect and pad see ewe (since it has chinese broccoli), but it's quite good. My only complaint is that the curry included dark meat. I didn't ask for white meat, though most Thai restaurants I've been to only serve white meat in their curries, I think. Next time I'll ask for white meat only.

Oh, I asked them to make it "spicy" and they definitely made it spicy. And they only deliver after 5pm.
author: Jose L.

description:
The place is small, but their food is unbelievably tasty.  Read: curry tastes like curry, with all the spices and seasoning, unlike other places that add sugar to make up for the taste.  And is that real fish sauce I taste?  Yum!

The only minus is that the food can be a bit spicier.  Come on people, don't you realize that authentic thai food has to be spicy?  None of this mild curry crap.  But because I can't find that kind of a thai restaurant in this city, I have to give Thai TIme full marks, as it is the best I have found thus far.
author: Tangerine L.

description:
The food is good!!!

BUT eating inside its way too small, HOT and smelly... order take out only.

Good curry, good pad thai - good prices!
oh and a damn fine Thai Iced Tea
author: Jessica L.

description: I'm DEFINITELY a Thai Time fan. They're reasonable, the food is amazing, the service is good, what more can I say? They are a bit a small and have that "hole in the wall" restaurant look, but looks can be ... ARE decieving! Their Thai food is geniune, and I don't know what it is about their Chicken Pad Thai, but they must've spiked it with a something extra because it's SO GOOD. My favorite Pad Thai is their Pad Thai. It's not great for big groups because their tables can fit 4 at the most, but really good for a small late night dinner with the significant other or with a few friends. YUM, can't wait to go back! (:
author: Chrisy Y.

description:
Wonderful cute little restaurant with friendly service and flavorful food! This spot is great for dates as the cozy atmosphere breeds closeness, which leads to breeding. JK 
Seriously though, it's a small, unassuming venue with no-nonsense delicious Thai food at a reasonable price. My friend and I shared an appetizer and two main dishes and the total was only $27!  
I think the Pad See Ew was better than the one at Osha Thai.
author: James C.

description:
I've upgraded my review from 4 to 5 stars.  The food truly never disappoints. I'll go as far as to say it's simply the best Thai food in the city.  

I haven't seen anyone mention the Yum Moo Yang (charbroiled marinated pork with cucumber, tomato, onion and lemon dressing).  It definitely has traditional Thai flavors with a unique and surprising twist.

I've never eaten there but the delivery is always on time and friendly and the food arrives hot.  Don't forget the Garee Puff appetizers ... little triangular pockets of deep fried sweet potato goodness.  The sticky rice with mango is great too.  They give HUGE slabs of fresh mango!

I'm always super satisfied and happy after eating at Thai Time.  A definite staple in my take out diet.
author: Nada b.

description:
Pretty good Thai food!

I decided on takeout and so I stopped by Thai Time per a friend's suggestion.  It's supposed to be a pretty packed place, but on this early evening, there was still 2 available tables for those who wish to dine out.

I ordered the green curry w/chicken, chicken satay, and mango + sticky rice.  Brought them home for dinner and they were all very tasty!

I shall be back to try other entres!
author: Jeff H.

description: Ordered both the green and red duck curry, and both were amazing (although I preferred the green a little more).  Definitely coming back here next time I'm in the city and craving Thai food :). Relatively quick turnaround time from order to service, too!
author: Irene W.

description: This is the BEST thai food in the entire city.  Its not too expensive, their green curry kicks my ass and they deliver if youre feeling lazy.  I also recomend the angel wings to share.  Delish.
author: Hm M.

description:
Pretty tasty thai food. Fresh and hardy. Tastes a little bit Viat influenced, but perhaps it was what I ordered. The Tom Ka Gai was excellent. Creamy as opposed to watery; a little on the sweet side, though still spicy with plenty of chicken and mushrooms. Very rich. 

Prices are very good for what you are getting. The only thing that seemed a little off was the steamed sticky rice. Good enough when you mix it with the sweet juices from the dish I ordered, but not so good by itself. Pretty fast delivery for a Sat night.
author: Mark B.

description:
Thai Time doesn't have a 'Medium' setting to their curries, but I love them still... THE BEST PAD THAI POSSIBLE, gorgeous thick red curry, and amazing little deep fried sweet potato-onion dumplings with peanut sauce as an appetizer....The prices are right too (with average $7 curries).
The place doesn't look like much from the outside, with its faded blue awning, but contains some of the best thai food I have ever eaten... absolute heaven, really. 
I will be back for more, you can count on it.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I found myself in the Inner Richmond with my boyfriend Sunday night.  We don't know this area that well but know that there are some serious gems...we just aren't sure which ones provide excellent food and which ones are no good.

This place was just ok.  The worst part was the chicken.  The chicken just didn't seem to be of high quality.  And my yellow curry was kind of bland.

The mango with sticky rice was really tasty and the place was cozy and romantic in its own way.
author: Lauren S.

description:
OMG!  Can I give this restaurant a -5???  If I could, I would!

I got THE WORST food poisoning of my entire life here....as in I thought I was going to die!  Thai used to be my favorite food....now I can't even smell it without reliving that horrible night!
author: Sandee L.

description:
How did I live in the Richmond so long without discovering this hole-in-the-wall but oh-so-yummy place?  OK, maybe because I can never walk past the purple hole-in-the-wall King of Thai on the way to 8th, but I digress.

We ordered the green curry fried rice and the pad se-ew.  A cup of Thai iced coffee to boot.  I spilled a chunk of it while moving it to my side of the table, so yes, I made a mess.

Delicious and affordable - what more can I ask for?
Oh, maybe move to the Sunset like I did?
author: Jenny L.

description: Tired of bad chinese delivery, I ordered here yesterday and was pleasantly surprised. We got the spring rolls, angel wings, and one of their duck dishes...all very good. But the real kicker was the deep fried boneless chicken over garlic rice, awesome! So crispy and delicious. I will definitely be ordering from here again!
author: Lady G.

description:
Quaint little place that feels like you are dining in a friend's living room. The service was good and always at your table (mostly because they have no where else to stand). As a huge fan of Thai food, I found Thai Time pretty good. Although, I didn't have anything that really threw me over the fence. The green curry lacked heat (spice) that I've come to expect from Thai food, a spice that makes you grab for your water or pound your Singha in search of relief.
I am inclined to try it again.
author: Travis W.

description:
Pleasant surprises are always a great way to begin an evening. When the green mango salad was served I knew I was in the right place. The key to this little local off Clement is its use of fresh ingredients blended with the perfect amount of spice. The service was excellent. The server was attentive and my water glass was full though I had been guzzling gallons of H20 since I walked in the door post work out. For an entree I ordered a dish with sauteed seafood (squid, prawns, scallops, and mussels) and my perpetual-companion had the scrumptious, satisfying yellow curry with onions and potatoes (FYI-he liked it much better than the same selection at Neecha Thai Cuisine). 

The space was comfortable and inviting. Sitting there, you almost get the sensation that you're in someones home for dinner and not in a hole-in-the-wall restaurant in the Richmond. Now that I know they deliver I'm pleased to have another menu in the everything-drawer to choose from when we're too tired to cook. 

To end our visit at Thai Time on a sweet note we shared fried banana and coconut ice cream.
author: Jessica D.

description:
I've eaten at lots of Thai places in my life, but Thai Time has won a place in my heart as my favorite Thai restaurant in SF.  Cute family run restaurant in a house-turned-restaurant.  I've had the curries, the kao pad kra prow fried rice, pad thai, seafood mor din, green papaya salad....all delicious!  Their lunch combos are generous and cheap--for around $7 you can get soup, an eggroll stuffed with noodles (a surprise but better than the typical Chinese restaurant eggroll), a heaping portion of rice and two generous entree portions on a rather large plate.  Mmm...I might even stop by again today...

The thing to know is that you have to ask for the food to be spicy, otherwise it won't be and you won't get the my mouth is on fire feeling.  Personally, I like the unspiced versions because I can really taste the different ingredients and flavors.  Its always good to know that yes, the food is just as delicious nonspicy as it is spicy...you know how some restaurants try to compensate for crappy food by making it so spicy you can't taste anything and aren't able to tell.  Thai Time isn't like that.      Friendly quick service and delicious food...what more could you want?
author: Swirls L.

description:
Best peanut sauce EVER.

I was never a big big fan of anything with peanut sauce, but thank you, Thai Time, you made me a believer. Chicken Pra Ram and... the dish underneath it on the menu which I cannot pronounce.

Small seating area, great friendly service.

I'm waiting for the staff to yell "NORM!" whenever my best friend and I walk through the door. We're there almost once a week, and if we both had more cash, we'd eat there three times a week.
Not, to say that you need a ton of cash... not only is this quaint place YUMMY, it's CHEAP.

And on occasion, we get lucky and get parking right in front.

So I say, go there and go often. I'd like to see this place stay in business for the rest of my life.
author: Jenn H.

description:
Just when I thought I would never be able to order Thai for delivery again, my fellow yelpers came to the rescue. I've tried all of the Thai places that deliver in the outer Richmond at least twice and they all frankly suck. Thai Time has saved my laziness!

We ordered the pad thai (my litmus test for a good Thai place), the seafood hot pot, roasted duck rice, and mango with sticky rice. All were fabulous. In fact, earlier that day I had eaten at a Thai place way up in Santa Rosa that was probably the best I'd had since returning from Thailand (Jhanthong Banbua for any of you Santa Rosans reading). Thai Time was, I dare say, as good as both the Santa Rosa restaurant and the restaurants that I ate at in Thailand. 

I haven't tried any of the curries yet, but so far, so good!
author: Amy B.

description:
This is a really great neighborhood thai restaurant, and having been to most of the Thai restaurants in the area I can say that the price drove me to give it a five star rating. It's very reasonable.

But it's because of the price that it's five stars, and it's something to keep in mind. You're not going to find the best Thai food you've ever had in your life, but you're going to walk away satisfied every single time.

The Talapia (fish) is delicious, the curries are excellent, and be sure and save room for the Roti. I can't stress the Roti enough--it's a wonderful blend between a doughnut and a tortilla, which leaves you feeling like you've just been given a nuanced tongue-massage.
author: Andrew S.

description: Great find. Small, cozy, family-run, and delicious food. The lunch combo is an especially good value (2 dishes plus soup and rice for $7.95). I had the yellow chicken curry and basis chicken, both of which were very tasty.
author: Bret W.

description:
At the new job, we always seem to order from here and it never seems to disappoint.  It's cheap, it delivers and satisfies. What I really like:

Tom Yum Gai - not too fishy, not too bland.
Larb Salad - see above
Pad See Ewe - slightly smoky, not too greasy
Panang Curry - hearty, spicy, luscious

Just like the City.
author: Joyhan S.

description:
Line at Burma Superstar 1, 2, 3 hours long? (after 5 pm, um, when isn't it?) Go to Thai Time just a few blocks down and off Clement. It's a cozy little place w/ an extensive menu of Thai staples and some not-so-familiar dishes. Check out the red curry, fried tofu w/ peanut sauce, & larb salad (personally into ground chicken). Tasty, cheap (most things $6-9), and just satisfying enough to make you want to cuddle with someone in front of the TV but not coma-inducing. One star off b/c there's just this feeling that I have that it doesn't have quite the punch or freshness of a 5 star place.

EDIT: Forgot to add that the bathroom situation (gotta pass through the tiny kitchen to get there) here is skeeetch.
author: Steph P.

description:
I met a friend here for the first time a couple weeks back and I loved the intimacy of it. Thankfully we got a table right away but because it is really small, you may have to wait outside a while so don't come when you're dying to eat. :) The wait staff was extremely nice and the food was very flavorful. I'm not a Thai expert so I could easily be challenged but I couldn't get enough of my Vegetarian Pad Thai. Yummy! There was a birthday party going on when I was there and it seemed like the perfect place to rent out for the night for a party of 30 or so. Really a cute and tucked away place. I would rate it an A+ for a first date place. It reminded me a lot of London. It's a bit out of the way but there are some great dessert places not too far away.

I'll definitely be back.
author: Melisa B.

description:
Unforgettable dish -- lao mun gai tod, essentially deep fried chicken strips sort of like a Thai version of Chicken Katsu.  Served with garlic rice and sweet and sour sauce.  You know you want it bad.  I am going to eat it again and again.

The Tom Kah Gai is excitingly served in a clay pot atop flaming coals at your table.  They don't skimp on the chicken, and the broth is rich and flavorful.  They also have house-made lemonade that received favorable reviews from my girlfriend (though I didn't sample it).

I ordered the Pud See Ew with pork, and it was good but not nearly as good as the other dishes.  They went heavier on the oil than I would have liked, so I would definitely try some other things before going with this again.

Service was a bit slow and I got the impression this place is more about the take-out or delivery experience than a dine-in establishment.  The staff was very friendly and I've no complaints but their delivery person was running to and fro the whole time we were there.

We're really happy we found a great Thai place in the neighborhood!  Definitely going back.
author: Walter K.

description:
This place is very cozy (has about 10 tables or so), but there was one last open table waiting for us.  Perfect, no wait.

The food was delicious!  We got the Pad Thai (which is a boring selection, I know, but it's really worth trying, since it has a hint of coconut flavor to it, mMmmMMm);
Angel Wings (stuffed chicken wings), crispy and fresh from the fryer; and papaya salad, which had just the perfect mix of lime & spice.

Once again: MMmmMMmmMmMm :)
author: E N.

description:
Still feel the same as in my previous review, except I just wanted to comment that the Beef Nam Toke and Gang Keaw Pla Guy are pretty good here too. I actually prefer them to the Pad Kee Mao & Pad Thai, which lately have been hit or miss. 

I was excited to see the Thai crepe on the menu, but I'll pass on it next time since it's not that great here and fairly oily.

Still good food for a good price!
author: Jane K.

description:
Coming from So-Cal, we decided to try some Thai food up here. One of the main reasons we cruised over here was for a previous review of custom ordering dishes. Because we always order the same thing back in L.A., we ordered what we usually do with no questions asked! Servers (as most if not all) at Thai restaurants, are polite and attentive. We ordered Tom Yum Goong (not on menu), Yellow Curry, & Mint Leaf Ground Chicken Kra Pao with sides of white rice. I love that the curry comes with a small serving of cut cucumbers/julienned carrots/red onions in a vinegar/oil mixture. If you custom order things, make sure you ask how much it will be so you don't get a surprise when you get the bill. However, it is very affordable.

If we ever come back to SF we will definitely pay them a visit!
author: Nadine B.

description: I work near this place and love coming here to grab take-out for lunch. Everything I have had has been tasty. They offer an awesome lunch special- you choose 2 dishes from a select menu and it comes with rice and soup for about $8. Great deal! They do not give you the soup if you take it to-go though. Parking around here is particularly difficult, beware.
author: Amy J.

description:
First time visit to Thai Time based on Yelp reviews...the food was awesome! We ordered Chicken Satay, Yellow Chicken Curry, Red Chicken Curry, Spicy Eggplant and Mixed Vegetable Fried Rice....everything was delicious! Prices are reasonable...parking was no problem.  The restaurant is very small. I think they do quite a bit of carry out business...lots of people coming in to pick up food during our dinner.

We will be back!
author: Daddy F.

description: Very tiny restaurant, so get here early or do take-out.  Yummy food, well prepared.  We had the fried catfish with mango salad and tom kha gai (coconut soup with lemongrass and chicken).  Very flavorful and the waitstaff was very cordial.
author: Jay S.

description: Great food, great prices. #55 (Gai Tod) is a win, and the pad thai, red curry, and Tom Yum soup are pretty good too. Average entree price is about $8.
author: David S.

description: I've tried their pad thai dining in and it was quite good. But their take out was very disappointing. I ordered their pineapple fried rice to go. What I got was mushy and tasteless. There were even chunks of white rice, indicating their lackadaisical approach to cooking. Not ordering from here again, at least for take out or delivery.
author: Jessica C.

description: We had the Green Rotee and Chicken Pad Thai and both were delicious. Place is small but around 8:15pm people were heading out! Perfect timing!!!  I will definitely be back to try the Sticky Rice with Mango.
author: Meli B.

description:
This is by far my favorite Thai restaurant. 

Of all the times I visited this place, I always get the curries to go. They give you a really good portion that can be good for up to three meals. To me, that's a really good deal for under $9. 

But you can't go wrong with anything else either, I haven't been disappointed yet.
author: Willie F.

description: Best Thai food I've had. Try the seafood in a coconut (tallay I think #33).
author: Greg G.

description: I ate here 5 years ago and loved it. I went back last week and it was still as good as ever. This cute Thai run, hole-in-the-wall severs slightly Americanized Thai that will still satisfy even the harshest of Thai cuisine purists. We ordered a chicken larb salad, seafood green curry, duck with greens and sticky rice. All dishes, especially the duck, were tasty. The only thing I would change is a tad more toasted rice powder and sauce in the larb--but then again I am an Isan enthusiast and quite particular with these regional dishes. I will come back again, for sure.
author: Brian J.

description:
Fox is evil, 24 is good; I am still struggling with this.

24 goes well with Thai.

I love Thai Time.

Thai Time seems to be closed Mondays.

That makes me sad.
author: Juan C.

description:
I was hungry for some good food, but lazy to drive or walk any place far. So I discovered this little hole in the wall as I was contemplating maybe going back home and eating some Special K Red Berries cereal with my Soy milk. Well, I am glad I found Thai Time. I love my cereal but, how much Special K is too much?

Thai Time is now my favorite stop for thai food that is within a block and a half radius of my place. I enjoy the freshness of the food here and that they take their time to prepare a meal that is worth the wait. I had beef and broccoli and the spring rolls and was impressed. 

The restaurant itself is super tiny, but yet comfortable. I sat by the window and watched the folks walk by as I enjoyed my food. I will definitely come back to TT, when the time comes for some decent thai food.
author: Eric B.

description:
Since I moved to Nopa I was having a hard time finding a Thai place that would a) deliver & b) taste yummy! My roommate introduced me to Thai Time and now it's the ONLY place I will order from. 

They're more affordable than other high end Thai places, but just as good in my book! The Red Pumpkin Curry here is super yummy!!
author: Angel P.

description:
What time is it?!?

I have a special place in my heat for Thai Time...

I don't think you can find a better deal anywhere for this quality (and quantity) of food.  It is a staple in my diet.  Actually, as we speak, I have two one quart containers in my fridge of pumpkin curry and pad thai waiting to be devoured.

Yes they deliver - but who can resist a cozy atmosphere and good conversation?
author: Brad W.

description:
Excellent food! A small place in the Richmond, but well worth eating at.
Their food had some wonderful flavoring which was not too spicey for me. However if you like it really spicey, I think they can accommdate that for you. Nice intimate place to eat. Service was good and friendly. Highly recommend this place.
author: Leon C.

description:
I've been to Thai Time three times with my family, and have been very pleased each time. Be prepared to leave happy and full!

The place is pretty tiny, so you may have to wait a few minutes for a table to open up. As small as it is, I love how cozy the dining area feels. It's clean, and I love the decorations.

The service is great - we never had to ask for refills on water or tea, and food is usually ready within 15 minutes. The people who work there are attentive and friendly.

As for the menu, they've got a extensive selection of authentic Thai food. The portions are a good size, and unlike a lot of other Thai restaurants, their stuff is a lot less greasy and packed with flavor, not sodium. The mango salad's refreshing, the pad thai is the best I've ever had, and the mango with sticky sweet rice is a must-have.

Delectable!
author: Sophia T.

description:
Absolutely impressed with Thai Time!! 

My boyfriend and i looked on yelp just because i was craving Thai food so much last night, when we decided to check out Thai Time. First we were greeted very nicely to walk in and see a very cute small restaurant with about 10 tables. We were seated right by the kitchen and scanned the menu for a while. We ordered the Appetizer combo plate which was so yummy! Loved the deep fried shrimp, and fish cakes were absolutely fantastic, they made my mouth water for more. Everything on the plate was delicious including the sauces- one a peanut sauce and the other a hot and sour. I also ordered the gang garee ghai (yellow curry with sliced chicken and potatoes) while my boyfriend had ordered the thai time fried rice which came with calamari, scallops, and shrimp in it. We shared and were totally stuffed by the time we finished half of ours. I also had 2 thai iced teas which were absolutely delicious. I plan on coming again to this little scrumptious hole in the wall! Im hoping i will be able to say that Thai time is now my go to thai in SF!
author: Taylor P.

description: I think I actually met the owner the first time I went to Thailand.  That was over 7 years ago.  He was an extremely friendly fellow and we hung out for a day.  The food here is pretty good, especially the Pad Thai.
author: Jim J.

description:
I'm sorry but I had to , 5 stars baby! tofu gro prow krob is the best best best!! Just so delicious over rice - the tofu is saturated in a curry sauce and basil and mushroom - I got a thai ice tea as well which was about the same as everywhere else of course but great - we got this pancake deep fried banana thing for desert which WTF great!?!?! I wish I remembered the name but im sure if you say "ya, gimme the banana pancake fried thing" they will hook you up" LOL. 

I guess they deliver too but haven't tried it. I used to go here all the time and they are pretty consistent with their orders so thats a plus but this time I was hunnngryy. I love how you have to go through the kitchen to get to the bathroom because you get to check out the simple kitchen setup. Try this place out and just get the tofu gro prow krob and nothing else, you will pass out from a food coma immediately!!

-t
author: Tony G.

description: Our friend took my husband and I there for the first time and the experience turned out to be great. We did not order abundantly since we weren't too hungry. Our friend introduced us their salmon curry, now I"m not a big cooked salmon fan but it turned out to very yummy.
author: Wine L.

description: When you say hot they can really make it hot without having to ask three times.  The staff is so friendly that it is truly like stepping into a restaurant on one of the islands of Thailand.  The atmosphere evokes this too.
author: Amy S.

description:
I love Yelp and I love Thai food...and 10 minutes after venturing onto yelp to find a dinner spot in SF, I had settled upon Thai Time.

I'm giving 5 stars for the quality and flavor of the food AND the price.  As many of the other reviews note, the atmosphere is no frills but charming, and the place truly feels like a good authentic local spot.  I drove all the way out from downtown just to try it and was not disappointed one bit.  The flavors and the portions were excellent.  Hands down the best wide fried noodles I have every had at a Thai restaurant.

The menu is very expansive, and the food is cheap and served piping hot.  If you want something swanky and people-watching, then dont come here.  But if you want EXCELLENT thai food on the cheap, then its time for Thai Time.
author: Jon M.

description: Stopped by here for lunch and had an amazing coconut chicken soup. Great little spot and great food.
author: Jess J.

description: Good thai food and such low prices. Its has really good thai food especially for their cheap prices. Also it can be easily accessed from my place. The only downside is that its sooo small and clement has terrible parking at times, but other than that the food is good!
author: Stephanie E.

description:
ordered take out.  they packaged it nicely and put in napkins and utensils.  
pad thai w/ shrimp and mango salad
i asked for medium spicy for both.  i think they forgot.  it was not spicy at all.  there was no chili or anything.  

pad thai- better than a lot of other places i've tried.  i've had their pad thai before and they had bean sprouts in it. i'm not a big fan of bean sprouts, but i'll eat it.  This time they didn't have bean sprouts.  there were just 4 shrimp. boo

mango salad-  no, please don't order.  it was $8 for a small amount of yuckiness.  It was super sour and had a ton of fish sauce.  Super salty and fishy.  There was a lot of garlic.  2 shrimp here.  tiny specks of squid.  the menu description says "...with shrimp and calamari..."  Oily, too.

$17.39 for the two. 

no, will not be going again.
author: Candy Y.

description:
We took some visitors to Thai Time, because Tawan's is closed at the moment and the reviews seemed quite positive. And we too had a very nice dinner there, good service, pleasant experience all around.  Large party of people, seated right away - service was prompt and attentive throughout the evening (I've never had so many tea refills!  Excellent!!)
