Very small place though, a bit on the dark side, but has that quaint family comfortable feel that I like.

First off, they have a very extensive menu that includes a lot of vegetarian options, non-deep-fried itemry, and stuff that doesn't have egg or coconut milk. For us that's a plus.  And they have hot thai tea, another big plus. We ate larb (chicken) to start, which was excellent.  Then we had the eggplant and chicken dish that included basil - this dish was good, but could have used a bit more sauce or flavor or something. Then we had an excellent dish that included steamed pumpkin with a bunch of seafood (mussels, scallops, prawns, calamari) - this one was truly excellent. Very light (it was steamed), but it had a flavorful broth. Would definitely order again.  All our dishes were reasonably priced too.

We didn't try the other dishes at the table (we don't eat red meat or big-time deep fried items, and the rest were pretty much those). Apparently the beef salad was excellent (in a lime juice that was apparently great), and the pad thai was enjoyed. One of our group got the Thai Time sampler, and that is a huge plate of heavily deep-fried food. If you're into that, apparently it's good but you might want to share with a group as it's a ton of food!
author: Jen D.

description:
I ordered delivery, on the recommendation of a friend... she was right ..Thai time is delicious..
We ordered the curry puffs  (yum),
 angel wings..my personal favorite... (I was pissed because my dog stole a piece of it off of my plate when I got up to get a drink..)
woon-sen pad thai.. I love silver noodles... there was alot of shrimp and meat...
and thai fried rice. not greasy at all
The food arrived in about 30 minutes still hot and my fried items still crispy.
Surprisingly inexpensive too.....
author: Karlee D.

description: The food was above average and the service, prompt and the price was fair. The space was cramped and I hate to say this, but it was a little dirty in the dining room and kitchen.
author: Eliz M.

description: Came here with a few friends on a sunny Sunday and left in happy spirits.  The place is sort of a hole-in-wall but the food was delicious and well portioned.  I got the boneless duck over rice and it was the best I've had and have been craving it since.  The service was friendly and fast.  Man, I wish I lived closer...
author: Joy Z.

description:
Cute place, very tiny. Walking through the kitchen to get to the bathroom really makes me feel like I'm in someone's home. The food is delicious and menu has many more authentic Thai dishes than I've seen at other restaurants. It's worth ordering dishes you normally don't see at other places...rather than say, the Pad Thai. My favorite dish is this seafood curry dish served in a coconut. 

It can be hard to get in and service can be slow, but if you're not pressed for time it will be worth the wait. Corkage is only $7 but watch out...they pour to the top.

Not sure if they use any MSG, but I feel a tiny MSG headache after I eat here. Nevertheless, the food is so darn good I keep coming back.
author: Mellie D.

description:
Just ordered delivery yesterday!  The green curry and the red curry were
perfectly spiced!  The veggies were cooked perfect and the chicken was good too!  The pad thai had good flavor, but was kinda plain.  I am definitely ordering delivery again.
author: lisa v.

description: I went here with my uncle the other day and the food was great. I had pad see ew which is pretty standard at most thai restaurants. It was great, not the best ever but definitely a competitor for being the best. It was reasonably priced and the place was small and cozy. It would not be large enough for a big group dinner but a good place to go with one or two other people.
author: Ashley A.

description: Probably one of my favorite Thai places in SF. If you eat duck, try their red duck curry. Their crepe is delish and so is their mango catfish. Oh, I could go on....
author: Zoeboe D.

description:
This is a very cozy little restaurant tucked away off of busy Clement street.  There are about 10 tables in this tiny restaurant, but I never felt crowded there.  The decor is soothing and one can look out the front windows seeing the world pass by on 8th.

The food was quite good but I widh I had chosen different dishes.  Unfortunately the dishes I tried were very similar, so I'm not sure if it's the restaurant that was lacking range or my choices.  I'm willing to bet it was my choices, but I'll have to wait until I visit again before upgrading my rating.

The menu item that first caught my eye (actually my wife's eye, I liked the description) was the Red or Green Seafood Curry with Pumpkin.  I love pumpkin and thought it would be interesting with seafood.  I opted for the red curry, but wished I'd chosen the green curry later because the rest of our dishes were red curry dishes.  The dish included squid, bay scallops, two prawns and two mussels.  The sauce went very well with the seafood and the pumpkin, but I wouldn't get it again.  The squash like texture of the pumpkin didn't work with the seafood for me, but the flavors did go well together.

     We also got the Crispy Tofu which was absolutely wonderful.  I've never had tofu prepared quite like this before.  The outer skin was pan fried to be slightly crispy.  The dish featured a red curry based sauce with some mushrooms and was topped with Thai basil.  This was a very wonderful dish and I'd love to have it again.

     Lastly we had their red curry which was wonderful.  It was fairly representative of most excellent red curry dishes with possibly a little more bamboo shoot than usual.  The flavor was very enjoyable.

     The menu has a separate vegetarian section which I like.  Unlike other Thai restaurants I frequent, there wasn't any indication of which dishes were spicy.  I usually like something between medium and hot and I found the dishes here were very well spiced.

     The other thing about Thai Time is that their dishes are very reasonably priced.  Most of the vegetarian dishes were $5.95 each and the seafood and pumpkin dish was only $8.95.  Thai time has very good food and is an outstanding value.
author: Tony P.

description:
UPDATE: Having gone here a few more times, the food is excellent.  I love  each dish and the mango with sticky rice and banana with coconut ice cream is to die for. IT IS NOW MY FAVORITE THAI RESTAURANT IN THE CITY.

1st review: The food was good, the soup (#1) was a little too sour but having run with it balances it out for a nice flavor. The service was okay, wasn't that attentive. Had great company so I enjoyed it.

I had better Thai food elsewhere.
author: Chatree T.

description:
I want to tell the reviewers that this place sucks hard, just so that no one else will go here. I LOVE Thai Time. Seriously...from now on I think my room mate and I are going to look at each other and go...Thai Time? It's three blocks from my house, absolutely delicious, and affordable!

We started off with a Thai Coffee, Thai Iced Tea, and an ice tea. All were excellent. Then we had larb with sticky rice, deep friend tofu in a peanut sauce with crispy thai basil (I forgot the name), and a noodle dish that I couldn't fall in love with because it tasted too much like anise. And then...just when we thought we were fill our waitress asked us about dessert. Then we tried the rotti (sweet thin pancake like thing with a sugar-caramel-cinnamon sauce) and split it three ways. It blew us away and we were bummed we each didn't order one. 

Definitely will try delivery next time, just to see the difference.
author: Allison P.

description: GreatThai food- so fresh, fast and reasonable.  Pad King is my fav...nice pieces of grilled chicken with amazing crisp green beans and basil.  Very polite staff, fast delivery and never disappointed.
author: Jennifer S.

description: The shrimp with silver noodles was good but the rest of the dishes I ordered was just average.  However, service was really good. Unfortunately, I was pretty thirsty after eating there.
author: Mary L.

description:
I love thai food and have tried many places but i think this is the best food. You will pay a bit more than King of Thai but the variety and taste is better.
The fried chicken and cashew dish (52?) was amazing....the soft crab appetizer with mango salad is bliss and i don't even like soft shell crab.
Great jasmine rice, great service. All the dishes were good, much better than Marnee Thai.

I guess the main point is that it stands out from the sea of other places I've been.

It's a small place but we've never had a long wait. Not sure if  people don't know about it or overlook it because it's small?

Very pretty inside and nice ambiance.
author: Little B.

description: There is so much good Thai food in the city that it's hard to give a relative comparison of many of the restaurants. I don't hand out a lot of 5 stars, but this place was cheap and delicious. My husband and I got a great meal for $20 including tip. The garlic rice is a must!
author: Brittany G.

description:
thai time san francisco. i love you. i love you with all my heart.
this review has been a long time in coming.
my boyfriend and i are very very protective about whom we share this place with so i haven't written anything on yelp about it.

but recently after taking 4 new faces into thai time one of the new faces asked me, "do you think thai time would want you to yelp them?" and i thought and i thought and i thought and finally said yes. 

because the food is amazing. i mean really really good.
my favorites are the:
pad see ew/pad king mao/green roti !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! /panang curry/pumpkin curry

their service is impeccable and they are the most friendly nice folk around.

they're a very small spot, i think there are maybe 8 tables and the kitchen (which you get to walk through when visiting the bathroom) is even smaller. 

going to thai time is like going to my best friends parent's house for dinner. it's just magical.

go. enjoy. smile and if you can't make it over to 8th and clement, take advantage of their swift and always accurate delivery service.
author: lucy m.

description:
How can you NOT give this place five stars*****? 

Every week I order from them. They offer Tofu Gra Prow Krab. If you are not vegetarian, and you've never liked tofu, then this is the stuff for you to pick out of your fellow vegetarian's plate. This stuff is the best, crispy tofu in a light-n-spicy garlic sauce, whispering in basil.... MMM YUM!!! Enough for me to want to use every speck of white rice to lick every drop from the bowl. 
Ok, so they also have a special menu item, I think its letter C, shrimp, tomato, and pineapple kabobs in a mango sauce, fresca style. ITs Innnn-SANE!!! 

But ofcourse they do have the standard Thai menu items like Thai Iced Coffee and ever -so- sweet lemonade on the rocks, but how many Thai places actually have pumpkin curry? 
Find them, sign me up, and then follow me back to Thai Time.
author: Danielly A.

description:
Thanks to google maps and my bf's phone this was a quick find on a Friday night.

The location has plenty of parking out front (Plus!). Restaurant itself is tiny, with minimal tables. You must know that if restroom use is required, beware that it is mandatory to walk into the kitchen, through a tiny storage area all the way to the back (a bit weird).

Now the important stuff: Food! We ordered the Gang Penang (Chicken with Curry and Veggies), Thai Fried Rice (cooked with broccoli, bell peppers and onions) and Pad Thai. Overall quality was good. They give you huge helpings for the amount charged, which is always positive.
author: Anne K.

description: Absolutely love it. Staff is great, food is amazing. Lots of vegetarian and vegan options. Everything is fresh and delicious!
author: Valerie A.

description:
I stumbled across this place because it turns out that Halu doesn't open till 5:00PM and this place was right across the street.  

The place was really small and chill.  Nice ethnic decoration and small enough to seat about 20 people.  A good spot to relax and enjoy a peaceful lunch.  The service was friendly and timely.  

I forgot the name of my entree, but it had flat noodles, squid, shrimp, fishballs, spinach, and green onions, in a pinkish soup.  It was an excellent combination of sweet, sour, and spicy.  Grinds.
author: Kalani K.

description:
also one of the best thai places around.

our favorites: Kao Kook Ga Pi (shrimp paste fried rice) and gai tod (deep fried boneless chicken).
author: Tom L.

description: The best Tom Ka Gai  soup our family has ever tried---and we have tried many! Very flavorful Pad Thai, and while the Mussuman and Green curries were prepared slightly differently than we were used to,  they were packed with tons of flavor and spices!
author: Div D.

description:
I had two friend from out of town come visit this last weekend, and they really wanted some Thai food. Having read other good reviews about this place (on Yelp of course!), I chose this place, also because Tawan's is closed for the whole month of July...but I'm sooooooo glad I chose this place! 

First of all, it's small.  Like real small.  But it's right of Clement street so it seems like it gets some pretty good business in there...the four of us got the last available table and sat in the back.  We all ordered various items, I got some spicy fried rice w/ chicken, my friend Chris got some green curry with duck, and his g/f got something else...I'm not sure what it was, but it was good!  Also ordered some sorta coconut and chicken soup that was very tasty. Everything we ordered was good. 

My friend was going to come back and visit again in a week or two, and he specifically asked if we could go back there...I'm not sure if we will, but I know that I'll be coming back soon!
author: Matthew S.

description: This is the best Thai restaurant I've been to yet! Never fails me each and every time I go there. I love the Tofu Gra Prowk Krob, the chicken coconut curry, and the Pad Thai as well as the brown rice. Combined altogether just calls for a most delightful dish. And I am very lucky to have it near my house. I've tried King of Thai Noodle, which is good, but not as tasty as Thai Time. I am sure there are other great Thai places to check out, but I highly recommend this place for thai food lovers.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: i think this is one of those places that I hesitate to yelp about because I really want to keep it all to myself.  I don't want it to turn into such a "destination" that I will never be able to grab a reservation.  It is that good and the people who work there are that nice.  Others probably feel the same and have been way too hesitant to write about this place because once you do, you know it might be over for the rest of us -- as far as continuing to enjoy it away from the food tourists.  Had the specials and the mango tango for 9 something was phenomenal -- mussels, squid, shrimp and scallops.  Loved it.  Great service, great food.  Just what a restaurant experience should be.
author: christine m.

description:
Discovered this restaurant totally by accident and WOW what a find. I've been back twice though I don't live in SF. I want to try more dishes but the parum nur (not sure how to spell it but it's beef with vegies in a peanut sauce) is so good that I can't NOT order it! The portions are very generous and the vegetables are very fresh. 

The restaurant is small and intimate and appears to be family run. A wonderful experience. I recommended this restaurant to friends who were also very pleased!
author: Lorene L.

description: A little disappointed. I like things spicy, so it was a surprise to me that they didn't ask how spicy I would like my dish, which was the green curry fried rice. That's a little unusual for thai places. There should also be a mild, hot, or very hott as an option. The food was good for its price range. Definitely budget eating.
author: Lisa D.

description: Best Thai food in the city, hands down.  I was previously a Marnee Thai loyalist, but when I moved to this neighborhood and discovered Thai Time, that all changed.  Super friendly staff, and cool tiny interior.  It is occasionally a wait, particularly during bluegrass or outside lands, but you can usually get a table pretty quickly.  Favorites are the Thai time crepe, Green Rotee, Khao Soy, and green curry salmon. But you really can't go wrong.
author: Erin D.

description:
i am not as hip as i would like, to which restaurants to recommend to folks, let alone where to take out of town guests. so i started using yelp as a resource. this place was my first successful experience, i picked this place purely on reviews and location, since my friends were staying nearby. it exceeded my expectations. 

the cherry on top is what a cute little restaurant it is, there are only a handful of tables. it is super cozy with delightful atmosphere. service was great and the food was even better. also i have a weakness for presentation and that was also satisfying.

i feel like i found that hole in the wall place that i can enjoy taking my friends to or go with my sweetie on a romantic date or simply walk right in because i am craving thai and i don't need to wait an hour to be served.
author: M. P.

description:
I had the "larb j"  for starters then dove into a red chicken curry over the top of garlic rice, super super good! service was great too, very attentative waitress. no complaints. this has toppled thai spice from its top spot in my coconut milk filled heart. 

update: went back again, ordered the same dish and it was awesome... again!
author: Steve M.

description: Don't let the appearance fool you. This place is just as good as any great Thai place, but the price makes the difference.  I had the gang panang (i think it was called that..) It had spicy red curry, chicken, bell peppers, and basil. very flavorful and not too spicy. The Thai iced tea was great, refills would be nice though. I will definitely go back.
author: Brandon I.

description: After three visits I must average them. Visit 1 was fun friendly and fresh tasty food. Visit 2 was pretty good, slightly slow service and I experienced the awfully disgusting bathroom. Visit 3 was mediocre. Diet Coke had a ton of dirt on the can, glass had a hair on it and the #27 pork was too salty (I ordeed this before) and at $45 for three of us is starting to get pricy for lunch. I think it's time for different Thai for me. I'll admit I'm more a fan of clean when it comes to food.
author: Gio D.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in the entire Bay Area (and my ex was Thai so I went to all of them). I've always had a good time and great conversations here. Extremely kind thai service and good food.
author: Wren C.

description:
I've eaten at Thai Time 3 times now... I didn't even know about it until one day I noticed it while walking by and made a mental note to try it out.  I have ordered the Tofu Gra Prow Krob each time... Its fried tofu in this really tasty chili garlic sauce. I've also tried the Woon Sen Pad Thai which has peanuts, egg, tofu, veggies, and silver noodles mixed together.
Eating in is like having your meal in somebody's cozy home... Its very small and the people are really nice and friendly.
If you go, try the Tofu Gra Prow Krob!!
author: Jackie O.

description: Food poisoning this past Friday night from Thai Time. It was awful. I do not recommend this place.
author: M R.

description: Best tasting Thai food for vegetarians in my opinion. The tofu satay, great, tofu Krob, omf! Veggie spring rolls and pad thai all tops. Super friendly staff, easy to order and fast delivery. OH OH OH the rotee for dessert! I sometimes forget to order it and get bummed when they didn't read my mind. 5 stars anyway.
author: William R.

description: Had to update this review to 5 stars. They know me by name here and know that I always get the green curry vegetarian style. I almost always get my order to go, but eating in here is a real treat, too... It's small, cozy, and has wonderful decor and atmosphere. I ate here with 3 friends last week and we ordered family style. We got the Thai Time sampler appetizer, green curry with rotee, vegetarian pad thai, and a dish that was fried tofu in red curry. It was probably the best meal I've had in a long time. This place is amazing. They also take credit card, which puts them heads and shoulders above any other business in the area.
author: P A U L.

description:
I'll preface this with a disclaimer that while I've only eaten in this restaurant twice, I've ordered delivery probably 20 or 30 times.  The delivery always arrives promptly, and the food is still hot.  If you live in the Inner Richmond, this is, imho, the king of delivery options.  Prices are good too.

If you're graduated from pad thai, or just need a break, give pad see ew a try.  Love it here.  The various stir-fry options are competently executed, and are true to their menu descriptions.  The soups are notable.  Curries are standard -- not a bad thing -- but I always feel guilty ordering them knowing how easy they are to make at home.  I had a fried (sliced) catfish item with mango, I believe, which was also good, with nice fruit and spice flavors.

Order the spice level you desire, and they will ramp it up accordingly.  Say "thai spicy" and hold on, if you're up for it.
author: Kevin B.

description: This is a "cozy" cheap restaurant for a group. The food is tasty, the service is pleasant.
author: Marcus M.

description:
Many years ago, when I first moved to the neighborhood, we used to order food from here. However after a rather uncomfortable and unfortunate side effect of my food one night, I stopped ordering from here. Until today...
So now it has been about seven years, and I finally worked up the nerve and the stomach to order Thai food from Thai Time once again. 
I really like their menu; they have a lot of tasty sounding dishes i.e. the green fried rice and the Gai Himmaparn. I decided to order the Gang Dang, no no not because it has such a rad name, but because the combination of chicken, spicy red curry, coconut milk, bamboo shoots, Japanese eggplant ,bell pepper and sweet basil...Yum. And the Garee Puff; deep-fried sautéed sweet potato and onion; served with peanut sauce and cucumber salad... also yum. 
So order in and excited for Thai food, my doorbell rings 17 minutes later. There's no way this could be the Tai food.....but wait....IT IS!  So for the super fast and efficient delivery of hot tasty smelling Thai food I give Thai Time at least 2 stars.
Huge Portions of the curry dishes. The gang dang was good, spicy the way a red curry should be. The eggplant was soft and not bitter, but the chicken was not my thing. I am a picky meat eater, I like boneless, white meat chicken cooked very well done. The chicken was a lot of dark meat and just tasted like slimy chicken. So once I took out the chicken, I totally enjoyed my dish. I will definitely order tofu next time. 
As for the Garee Puffs, they were good fried little triangle pouches with some tasty pasty insides and the peanut dipping sauce was also good.
My brother order the Yellow curry which he said was good but not as curry-ee as he likes. He said it just tasted watered down. 
So now it has been almost an hour since eating and all is quiet on the western front. Should conditions change I will update this review but as for now I give Thai Time 3 stars
author: Kelle K.

description:
As a person on the small side (stature-wise) I tend to have an appreciation for small things. In some ways then Thai Time Restaurant fits this description perfectly (it's small). In other ways, however, Thai Time is not small. The dishes for example are quite large - the deep fried tofu I ordered came crashing (not literally) down on my table like an avalanche of triangles. And the follow up - a red curry boat weighted itself much like an Ocean Liner. Also not small was the flavor (a dazzling balance between just enough hot and just as much spicy) which left me feeling warm but not on fire, and the refills, which turned my (small indeed) tea cup into a bottomless well of hot (but not enough to burn) Thai tea. 

Add to this the decor, which crammed as many Thai signifiers as possible into space that (as I might have mentioned) is not much larger than Thailand is when found on a map, the staff, who were super friendly and constantly appearing at my table (one of a total six) (with the refills) , and the prices: (you guess it) tiny. And you get one big surprise. 

As I tend to be in this area more often as of late - I will certainly be making more time for this restaurant.
author: Stephen M.

description: Very small and cramped restaurant, so I often do take out orders from here. Although the food is on par with many of the other Thai restaurants in the neighborhood, I gave this place an extra star because you can order many of their dishes, including the Pad Thai, without MSG. Not many restaurants, including King of Thai around the corner, can do this because so many of the sauces used for Asian cooking already contain MSG. Just make sure you let them know at the time of your order that you want your dish prepared without MSG.
author: LA J.

description: Oh man, my belly is so full and happy from dinner tonight. This is my go to neighborhood Thai place even though I have at least two other Thai restaurants that are a whole 50 feet closer. The other guys are okay but not as good as Thai Time. The duck noodle soup is flavorful and chock full of meaty pieces (no bones!). Their Pumpkin Curry is very good too and one of my favorite things on the menu. I also love their mango salad - it's a plateful of sweet, sour, and spicy yumminess. The mango sticky rice is an amazing dessert too and is so very tasty. Basically, everything I've had here is delicious. The prices are great and they don't skimp on any ingredients. Eat here! Actually, don't, because the space is very small and I want to be able to get a table when I come...
author: Queenie C.

description: My friend told me that she had really good Thai food at this place so I decided to try it out . Their thai iced tea is okay , but not that great . Their green curry fried rice is A-MAZING !! You can really taste the curry in the rice and it's kinda spicy ... not too spicy but spicy enough . I love it !! Very tasty and yummy !! Only thing is that it comes in a very big portion ... so if you plan on ordering a fried rice , you should probably just get one and share before you order two and end up not finishing .
author: Eileen L.

description: The best Thai food I've ever eaten.
author: John S.

description:
I had been talking about coming here for awhile, and my neighbor and I finally made the trek.  Apparently, he loves this place, and, since it was already hot on my "to-do" list, I figured what the hell.
Such a cute place!  That little Thai woman statue in the front jolted me when I walked in, but I found it too funny.  The air seemed a little stale inside I thought, though, but it was nicely decorated, and seemed cozy.

I thought the service was really great, though, and they were quite friendly- bonus.  After much indecision, I finally thought to get the same entree I would normally get at my fav Thai place- Pad Prik King (I think) with chicken, red curry paste, green beans and basil, w/ sticky rice.  Verdict: my fav Thai place won.  HOWEVER, my friends entree- chicken w/ peanut sauce was REALLY good- and definitely would beat that at my fave place.  So, it really depends on what you order I guess!
author: M S.

description:
I came here with a few of my friends a few months bak, and since one of my friends was friends with the owner, we got a discount. There were four of us and we were in a rush to go to Purple Skunk, so we ordered two pad thais so half the order for each person. HOT DAMN that was some good pad thai, i dont remember what kinda fad thai we got, but damn that was good. We all finished in about 7 minutes 37 seconds, and we were off!!! So our discount got us those two whatever pad thais for a total of ten dollars, leaving us enuff to get something from furple skunk, so trust me when i say going to thai time has ALOT of benefits.
note- owners r friendly as hell
author: Brian Y.

description: Very good restaurant.  Was impressive by the food, which doesn't taste over-dry like in many other Thai restaurants.  Bonus for ordering Hot thai tea that you can get re-fill for free.  The price is also pretty reasonable.  My wife loves this one better than her previous favorite one at White Elephant.  Will definitely visit again next time around.
author: Alex D.

description: just got delivery and it was awesome! chicken pad Thai and beef pad see ew..... Definitely order here again for those hungover days!
author: Colin L.

description: By far, the best thai restaurant I have ever been to! Management was nice and friendly. I can say that all of the dishes I tried, thai time fried rice, green curry chicken, bbq pork with salad, and pad see ew. I can honestly say that all of the dishes carried some bold flavor. You can tell it was real authentic. Prices are reasonable and I plan on coming back for more. I definitely recommend to all food lovers!
author: JJ N.

description:
I found this place on Yelp while walking around with some friends to find some food in the area. Originally had planned to go to Brothers Korean BBQ, but figured it was way too costly. We stood outside for like 10 minutes because it looked like a really shady place. (I mean, it's next to a shoe repair store) Eventually, we went inside and it was quite small. It looked to fit a max of 15 people inside. I order some fried rice dish. (I forgot which, sadly) My friends also got their dishes ( which I also forgot the names for) and one order some Thai iced tea. All the dishes were delicious except for a dish with some curry and some noodles. (Something along the line of egg curry noodle) None of my friends enjoyed that dish either, but everything else was top notch. My rice was so flavorful and I was able to taste a lot of spices. Anyway, it all came to a total of around $35-40 for 6 people. All of us left with out stomachs filled and our appetites satisfied. 

I have plans to eat here again soon.
author: Kenton H.

description: I love Thai Time.  Sometimes I get cravings for it and kick myself in the butt for not living closer to this place.  From the outside it looks a little small and unassuming but inside it is sweet and quaint and has a wonderful atmosphere. There are only a few tables so it tends to get crowded fast but the food is wonderful.  My boyfriend and I make it a little tradition to go there every year on or around Valentine's Day. I also go sometimes with my family and the serving lady has recognized us more than once which adds to the atmosphere. I'm in love with their Pad Thai; I order it every time.  Also they've got a really tasty savory pork and silver noodle soup (can't remember the proper name for it). It's sweet, its warm, its cozy, and has made for many wonderful dates. I highly recommend Thai Time!
author: Jane D.

description: Thai Time is a tiny restaurant that I always passed by when I run errands. I had Pad Thai and the hot & sour soup last week. Fantastic! I will go back and order yellow curry next time. The food tastes more like home cooking rather than restaurant meals if that makes sense. I liked the family that is running the place. They were very welcoming. I sat next to grandma. She kept smiling at me. Unfortunately, I don't speak Thai. Otherwise, I could have joined in on the lively discussion that they had.
author: MS K.

description:
As other reviewers point out, this is a small family run place.  Size of a typical living room in those row houses converted into a restaurant.  There are 4-5 tables that seat 4 and 3 tables that seat 2.  We went early Sunday night and was able to seat 5 of us comfortably by the window.  

Service was fast and friendly.  

Food was great.  We had the soft shell crab.  Nice and crispy.  Kids loved it.  The green papaya salad had good flavor and crunchy texture. Pad Thai was a little on the sweet side, but was fine.

Highly recommended.

P.S. Going to use the bathroom was an adventure.    You cut through the busy kitchen and walk up few steps.  Not the cleanest looking, but wasn't filthy.  Gives another meaning to an open kitchen.
author: gordon s.

description:
My favorite Thai place in the city, and I've been to a zillion of 'em.  Caveat this review with the fact that I'm vegetarian so can't speak to the meat dishes.  I echo Deb T.'s comment that the flavors are simple but wonderful combinations of the same stuff.  This is actually a good thing.  All the veggie dishes are terrif, especially the Tofu Gra Prow Krob, Choo Chee Tofu, and Pad Ma Keur.  My meat-eating friends swear by the Panang Curry and Green Salmon.  The restaurant also usually has terrific specials.

Worth visiting if only to marvel at the tiny yet well-appointed dining room, matched by a kitchen smaller than that found in most 1 BR apartments and the smallest bathroom ever seen outside of a steerage-level cruise ship cabin (entered through the kitchen, entailing stepping around the single cook who prepares all the wonderful dishes).
author: Galen C.

description: Charming place! Intimate space, not overly fancy, either. Food was simple but delicious. And the price is right!
author: Mark S.

description: Their soups are great, along with the curries!!! With the prices and delivery, Thai time gets the 5 star treatment...
author: Michael L.

description: Delicious thai place this place is. Small, but great. They now know me by face because each time I get winks from all the thai workers (not sure if there thai). But all in all great food for a cheap price...but beware rice is extra!
author: Melissa M.

description:
Where can you get better Thai than at "Thai Time"? Actually, Thai Time II.

Near one of the places I used to work in San Diego (Pt. Loma), there was a Thai Time II on Midway. I liked it because it tasted great, came in good portions, and was as cheap as Thai was going to get  (about $6 -7 for lunch specials).  Seeing that SF had a Thai Time (part 1) - I had to try - and I wasn't disappointed.

I do think this is a big coincidence (this Thai Time probably has nothing to do with the second one).

The inside is small - only about 7 or 8 tables (cozy).  The portions are humongous for the price that you end up paying.  Food is rich in flavor and prepared exactly how you'd expect it.  If you like Thai food and you live in the neighborhood, you might make this one your favorite.
author: Ralph N.

description: Good food and the lunch menu is a steal. $7.95 for two curry dishes, rice, and egg drop soup. I recommend the fried curry tofu.
author: Michael P.

description: Came across this place as a recommendation from a stylist at my salon who just happens to live in the neighborhood. The space is very (very) small and immediately gives you the mom and pop vibe. The service thoughout was very warm and friendly. We ordered the shrimp wrapped in wonton and fried appetizer. It was tasty and the sauce wasn't too sweet. Husband had the spicy catfish. I really liked the dish, but he's not a fan of fish on the bone as it's "too much work".  I had the seafood curry in coconut.  This was absolutely delicious - would definitely order it again. I suspect this is a great neighborhood spot. Will check it out again next time we're in the area.
author: Eme L.

description: Came here for lunch back in May with a friend. The restaurant is real cozy, so I'll recommend calling before going there with a big group. We each order a curry dish (beef and duck, i believe), which came in hugh portions and yummmy! We ate what we can, and still ended up with 2 more meals in the doggy bag.
author: Lois W.

description: You know, you will probably drive right by this, and go to one of 58 king of thai's on clement street. We in the collective of the accele-wise scoff and uphold our arrogance and hover from the thai time atrium, which is the size of a tenemant pantry, indulging spoonfulls of noteworthy curries and dishes that the msg dojo's spur out faster, cheaper and more toxic. Just slap yourself in the face, have a shot at 540 to regain composure, and meander into the light. You gonna caress your computer screen knowing that my diction has aided you to righteousness, once again. Why does irony always come shrouded in bombast?
author: Christopher J.

description: This place is super cute.  It's totally tiny, and family run. If it had cheeks, I would pinch them.  I got the chicken pad thai, and it was pretty good.  It was predominantly sweet, and I usually like it with a little more sour or slightly spicy.  Maybe it was because my slice of lime had no juice in it.  I think it would have helped.  But I still give this place 5 stars.  Our party needed seperate checks for 8 people, and they obliged.  It's very cozy and cute inside.  And when I went to use the restroom, the kids pointed the way for me.  It was toooo cute.
author: Dorothy P.

description: Thai Time is a great local find.  I go there once every two or three weeks.  My favorites are the Mango salad (fresh, spicy, multi-flavored) and the Green Salmon Curry.  Also really good is a noodle dish with duck (I believe its in the soup category on the menu).  Pleasant atmosphere and surprisingly cheap.  People who work there are very friendly.
author: Ann S.

description: I was told their food was amazing, so we tried it. My friend's takeout was phenomenal as he remembered it. I think we ordered outside of the box. Don't get me wrong, I will definitely be back. AND, there is a very  loyal following for this place, which of course speaks volumes. I just think we had an off night. Next time we're going more traditional and ordering pad see yew and other traditional yummies.
author: Annie T.

description: Really flavorful classic thai dishes. Super easy to order take-out. Friendly staff, fast service. The food is actually quite mild, I wish the heat were a little more kickedup, but flavorful nonetheless.  I will go back for more.
author: M R.

description: This Place is pretty small if you blink you'll miss it. But if you find it, it's one of the best thai food I've had. Seems like grandma's cooking type of food, very homey and delicious. For a San Francisco restaurant it's cheap. If you visit the city swing by you'll like it.
author: marlon m.

description: I joined Padmae k. and pseudo-Yelper Liam here for some comforting eats after a very rough weekend. It's cheap and good. A cozy, laid-back atmosphere in proximity to Clement St. madness. Be prepared for some moderate difficulty in communicating with the staff, especially over the phone. Otherwise, it's go time for Thai Time.
author: Patrick G.

description: I rarely open up a box of food and say WTF . But I opened up my angel wings and was totally expecting something else. Did I order shake and bake chicken? Despite my initial assessment , the wing(one huge wing) stuffed with noodles were really good especially with the dipping sauce. We also ordered pad kee mao and pad thai. All good and all devoured in minutes.
author: Sophia C.

description: Hooray for Thai Time! I didnt give 5 stars, because, well, it's not a 5 star restaurant. But they are cheap, they do deliver, and the food is tasty. And whoever that was that recommended the Angel Wings, THANK YOU! They are delicious.
author: Heather T.

description: Fantastic! Totally agree with a previous reviewer who said it's like King of Thai in terms of price, but BETTER because it's fresher and less greasy. Everything we ordered came to the table piping hot and in generous portions that were well worth the low menu prices. I ordered something I normally wouldn't at a Thai place -  fried rice - but this was no ordinary fried rice. Filled with egg, shrimp, calamari, pineapple, and assorted veggies, it was beautifully presented in a light nongreasy sauce that blew me away. My dining companions enjoyed chicken satay, sticky rice with mango, tom kha gai soup and a chicken dish in a spicy peanut sauce. It was all fantastic and I will definitely be back!
author: Beth T.

description: The best Thai places are always tiny, cramped hole-in-the-wall type deals. Thai Time is no different. The service is quick and friendly, the food is delicious and CHEAP, and they don't rush you through your meal. My friend and I had the green curry with shrimp (which was not technically on the menu, but they are very accomodating. It was spicy and awesome), and the pad see ew with chicken. We washed it down with some wine and the bill was still only, like, $30
author: Aunt B.

description:
Have been to Thailand 7 times in the last 5 years and absolutely love Thai food. 

I have been in SF for 10 years now and have been looking for some "real authenic" thai. Now there are some good Thai places in SF (Yukol, Thep Phenon - no not Osha) and if you are looking for the real McCoy then THAI TIME is for you. 

We had the fish cakes which were just like you would get in northern Thai land. A larb salad that was just amazing in flavor. Sauteed catfish with green beans that just hit the spot. And to top it off Duck in a green curry sauce that just made your mouth water.

If you love Thai Food, then this is the place for you!!!
author: Cow H.

description: Best Thai food I have had in years, hands down.  I may have uttered these words in the past, but I have not known the meaning until now.  I asked for curry that "would make my nose run" and got it.  I was a sweaty, runny mess and loving every second of it!  The red vegetarian curry with potato could be my staple dish for the rest of my life and I would never tire of it.  Never.
author: Beth G.

description:
uh, ok i am so dissapointed. i have thai time's pad thai and fried chicken with fried rice in front of me as we speak.... and yesterday night i had the same thing at king of thai...and king of thai was somuch better. 

first of all, thai time's fried chicken has hella fat on it. i picked something off i thought it was... a booger? but its jus a lump of pure unadulterated fat... and the meat isnt even cooked all the way... and their sweet and sour sauce is not right. and t heir fried rice... has no flavor. its just eggs and rice. king of thai's rice has tomatoes, onions, green onions, eggs blahblahblah...

their pad thai... um... hteir noodle quality is better? they gave me one more shrimp than king of thai did last time? but other than that nothing special... king of thai might have been better....

i got hte same thing at king of thai for 14 bux.... it cost me 17 (delivery plus tip) bux at thai time... god this chicken is so  bad... if i hadnt finished all of my king of thai frm yesterday id be throwing this out.... 

oh! plus it took them an hour to get it to me....

major dissapointment. IM STILL DIGGIN THROUGH THE RICE TRYING TO FIND SOMETHING BESIDES RICE AND EGGS! WTF!

ok i give up i'll stop now.
author: Lillian P.

description: What's wrong with you people, not mentioning Thai Time's small but super sweet and delicious "rotee" or low-dee. It's just a small plate with a crepe-like pancake doused with condensed milk, sugar, and love from Thailand. The pad tai is good and from my other visits I think they give you a bit more noodles and saucyness than King of Thai's pad tai on Clement or on O'Farrell. 4 stars because the waitresses at King of Thai are hot and the rotee could be a bit bigger. The flavor is just right though (for me at least).
author: Albert B.

description: Food tastes great and they deliver! I haven't actually visited their restaurant, just had their food at home. Love the sticky rice. Packaging isn't great though but that's more the city's fault with all the restrictions.
author: Elsa T.

description:
I wasn't a big fan of Thai food until Thai Time.

I LOVE THIS PLACE SOOOOO MUCH.

The staff is really nice. It's cute and cozy. Food is delicious. And inexpensive. My favorite is tofu gra prow grob (or something like that). But I've tried many other dishes and have never been disappointed. Three thumbs up!
author: Kiren K.

description: The green curry with duck is outstanding.  The Tom Ka Gai soup is delicious.  It's such a warm environment in which to enjoy good, hot Thai food.  A very happy, very fulfilling dining experience, every time.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I wanted Thai food and my friend found this on yelp. It was a great choice.  

Pad thai was awesome. The noodles were cooked just right, the sauce wasn't too sweet, and there was just enough sauce.

Penang chicken was flavorful.  They use dark meat chicken so it's not dry.

Good sized portions. Friendly and attentive staff. Food came quickly.

Only reason I didn't give it a 5 was because there were only two of us and we only tried two dishes.  Will definitely go back!
author: Amelia L.

description: Really good food for a reasonable price. The staff is nice. Bathroom situation is a little strange, but I can live with it. (you have to go through the kitchen to use the bathroom) Eat here, it's good.
author: Rick M.

description:
It's High Time for Thai Time!
seriously. i thought this was our secret place....for the past 4 years, every time we've gone it's been pretty empty except for the owner's children doing their homework at one of the tables. so i guess we have had a little thai time hiatus. the next couple times we have gone back, this place has been PACKED! people waiting outside? we scratch our heads....what happened! must have been the workings of yelp. you are a blessing and a curse. just like spiderman and his powers. grrr.
i loathe the crowd because it's so small in there. but still. thai time will always be my favorite little inexpensive thai place.
Favorites:
tom yum gai (was it hard to guess? this one tastes much healthier than the one at KOT, just add some extra chili pepper), mango salad, green curry, rad nar.....mmm.
this place is definitely a step (or 10) up from King Of Thai which is right around the corner. Let's just call it "Thai Food, PLAN A"
author: Lori J.

description: This place is good...usually.  I have gone there for years and years now. Fresh,tasty food. I was disappointed recently when I took my girlfriend there on 2/14/12. The tofu in 2 dishes they served us was sour, like it had gone rancid.  I told the server and he went to the kitchen and came back to basically deny anything was wrong with the food. I thought it would have been professional for them to mark down the check or comp us one of the dishes.  Nope, they just  served up the full bill as they had the sour tofu. I wasn't in the mood to make a fuss, so I let it go. If they recognized me as the  loyal, regular customer I am, perhaps they would have done the right thing. But they didn't. Just another customer I guess.
author: Frank K.

description: I've been wanting to try this place for a while now and I finally did.  Ordered the Pad See Ew for myself and my friend ordered a combo lunch plate with the green curry and eggplant stir-fry with beef.  My Pad See Ew was ok, but I thought the portion was quite big.  I thought the green curry and the eggplant dish that my friend ordered tasted better than my noodles.  The green curry was thick, flavorful and a bit spicy, but not too spicy.  They have a special lunch menu with decent, affordable prices.
author: Katniss B.

description: A delicious quaint Thai restaurant that never fails. Get the fresh coconut drink! It's basically a straw in a coconut. The prices are extremely reasonable, especially for the quality and taste of the food. The service is pretty fast and the people who work there are friendly. It's tiny but if you go there during the off hours it will be nearly empty. Otherwise, going there during the busy hours may require a short wait but it's worth it. Note that they are closed on Mondays, as many places are - I have forgotten this and walked all the way there on Mondays twice.
author: Vanessa F.

description: All around probably my favorite Thai in the city, although there are some other places that make my favorite flat rice noodle dishes, Pad Ke Mao and Pad Se Ewe, a little better. Thai Time has some really excellent dishes you don't always see; I always get the Larb Ped (duck salad) and Kao Soy (a mild yellow curry with noodles). I haven't had anything here that's not damn good.
author: Lou M.

description: This is a great place to take a few old friends, parents, and lunch dates. Not fancy or expensive, but wonderful food and large portions. It's family-run, which means the service is good. Try the thai fried rice (a favorite :) or the Gang Panang (coconut chicken curry). Lots of dishes to choose from, good apetizers. There is parking around the restaraunt, and it's situated on a street that's not too sleepy and not too busy.
author: Laura B.

description: All of the food here is really good but the service isn't that great....we were the largest group there but were starting to wonder if by 'thai time' they mean... slow / nonexistent service? They have a clock mounted on the wall and we found ourselves glancing at it from time to time....maybe it's all part of their theme. 4-5 stars for the food but negatives on the staff...
author: Kelley N.

description: it's good for what it is, a hole in the wall. food cracks. order chicken pad thai, or pad kee mao. it goes down.
author: Alex G.

description:
I just had pad thai. You would like it if you like coconut taste. To me, it was just too overpowering. Too sweet. I couldn't taste anything else except for coconut. I personally prefer coconut in dessert, rather than in my entree...so I can't rate that highly. The presentation looked nice though.

I got the shrimp rolls too. There's a 17 dollar minimum to order, by the way. Not really ideal to order for just one person. Anyways, the shrimp rolls tasted pretty good. It would make a good appetizer.
author: Nayeoung K.

description: Thai Time!  Thai Time!  This retaurant is a gem hidden in plain sight.  Such a bijou spot:  from the friendly staff to the delicious food-- by far my favorite Thai restaurant in the City.  Try the Larb Ped-- heck, try any thing.
author: Nicola F.

description: What time is it? You guessed it -time to head for 7-11 for a Slurpee, hot dog, and muscle mag - oops wrong review. I've only gotten take out here but was tasty and you bet I was shopping at the Walgreen's around the corner while they were fixing my order.
author: Colin S.

description: I tried this place based on recommendations found on this site - and I'm so happy I did!  It's a teeny-tiny place, but the staff is really friendly, and the food is fantastic.  Thank you, Yelpers!
author: Akemi Y.

description: I have to admit, this place is really good.  They have excellent kao soi which is a curry chicken egg noodle dish from northern Thailand which you can't find at most thai restaurants.  However, the bathroom is Super Scary!!  hold it till you get home
author: Dawn P.

description: YUM!!! Best Thai food I've ever had.... yes, even better than King of Thai.  The prices are amazing, the interior is adorable, and the food is fantastic.  It is a cute family owned place.  The tofu is not gross and slimey like a lot of place; it is firm and perfect.  The peanut sauce is incredible. Service is attentive. Cute fish tank. Do yourself a favor, go to the bathroom. One as to go through the kitchen... cute inside look.
author: Eme C.

description: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in SF.  The food is delicious, plentiful, and inexpensive.  The service is great, and the menu is extensive.  It's a small place, so it's best to keep your party to 6 or less.  I highly recommend the appetizer sampler platter.  But really, everything I've tried has been top notch.  Buenisimo!
author: David S.

description: Easily the best Thai food on Clement street.  their lunch menu is an awesome deal!!  I used to lived in Thailand as well as work in a Thai restaurant in London, and this place is definitely no joke.  Excellent flavor and the price is very reasonable for portion size.  for dessert, try the roti-it'll blow your mind.  Every person I've brought here has loved it-whether or not they normally eat Thai food.  An all around great place, and they deliver too.
author: asia c.

description: The Green Curry with Chicken was great! Lunch specials here are a great deal and very yummy! Cute family operated place - a little small so I can imagine during lunch time it would be packed.
author: Kristina A.

description: Whenever I think of their green curry (potatoes, tofu, sweet sweet onions) I can't help but salivate...
author: Emma K.

description: This place is really small, about the size of a suburban bedroom, but the food portions are huge and the prices are very reasonable. We had yellow curry tofu and chicken pad Thai. Both were amazing. Service was great - very kind people.
author: Eyal B.

description:
I visited here yesterday at the suggestion of my brother who said if I want some good Thai food, I should come here.  Despite having had Thai the previous day for lunch, I was feeling adventurous and decided to pay it a little visit.  At a loss as to what I should order, I gave him a quick call and found out that he had the Green Fried Rice.  "Green Friend Rice? I wonder if that's anything like green eggs and ham," I thought to myself.  Thankfully, this was MUCH better!  The GF and I are big fans of Thai basil and this dish did not disappoint.  While I would've preferred it to be a little spicier, I had requested mild otherwise I'd have been the only one able to eat it.
We started with an appetizer of Angel Wings which were pretty good.  For her entree, she ordered the Pad Kee Mao which I thought was okay, but nothing spectacular.  The portions here were big and we ended up having half of each dish left over for the next day's eats.  The thai iced tea was good and not too sweet.
author: Allan H.

description: tofu graw kraw krob (sp)  and whole cooked fish...soooo good. I love this restaurant. Don't go on a Monday, they're closed
author: alexandra m.

description: it has been a while since i first tasted the forbidden delights of Thai Time.   I don't even know where to begin because this place is so legit.   The quality of food and service is great.  They always seem to know exactly what you want too.  I just start salivating and I know what time it is......infact I am awaiting a delivery order as we speak/type....ooooh yeaaaa
author: Katie M.

description: Best Thai food I've had in the city.  Very small and family owned and operated.
author: Heather C.

description: I have yet to enter the actual restaurant, but from the times I've ordered delivery, it has been oh so yummy! I found it one night after searching on Yelp for a Thai place that delivered and I was not disappointed. The food came quickly and it was good! Red curry with chicken was delicious with the perfect amount of spicyness and tender chicken. Tom Kha Gai was also very very tasty, but I just wish I could order it without butchering the name everytime! We enjoyed it so much that we ordered again the same week. I'll definitely have to visit the actual restaurant one of these days!
author: Kim C.

description:
my parents and i went here the other night and i was very happy with the night. i picked the restaurant based on yelps and was not let down.

the place is small which usually makes me nervous, but it quickly filled. they have a huge menu, but it all looked good.

we got one of the seafood noodle bowls, pad se-ew, and pad something else. everything was really good! plus, im eating the left overs right now! even better the second day!
author: Delaney P.

description:
ok.  we got duck.  a lot of it.  duck larb.  sexy duck and noodle soup.  i doubt it was really called that.  and i was feeling extravagant and white and got the soft shell crab with mango salad.   and i thought while eating it that it was one of the best meals that i had had in san francisco.  like crazy good.  

but i'm bummed that its teeny inside and i'm afraid of going back hungry because i think that i'll be waiting for a hecka long time and i'll feel dejected like when i go to burma superstar at 6 and they might be able to seat me by 9:30 if i'm lucky.   and then i'll just end up at spices.  again.
author: Nora B.

description: Pad thai was good!  I couldn't say much about the red curry we ordered - it was just OK to me.  I thought that the service was attentive but slightly rushed.  I don't know why they would rush us considering the place was pretty empty...all in all, I will have to try other items on the menu before making a quick judgment.  Well, at least its a quick walk from home - def positive esp since theres a lack of parking on Clement street!
author: Julie H.

description: Favorite yummy and cheap neighborhood thai place.
author: Aiko S.

description: I love this little neighborhood spot. I usually just get delivery or "to go," and I usually get veggie pad thai and tom kha pak.  Friendly, efficient delivery and always nice when I show up to place a "to go" order.
author: A W.

description: Not only is this place GOOD, but its definitely a good deal too. I LOVE their tofu dish with crispy basil, garlic and curry (I can never remember the name of it, but explain it this way and the staff usually can figure out what your talking about. Its great for delivery and for eating in. Very good pad thai and green papaya salad as well.
author: Jenica M.

description:
In summary - "don't eat the chicken".

We moved nearby 3 years ago, and thought initially that this was a cute place with nice people.  However, we stopped going a while back because we thought the chicken we used wasn't high quality.  There are just too many other good options around....

.... anyway, my five-month pregnant wife and I went back last night as we wanted to stay close.  The chicken again wasn't good, and my wife's stomach didn't feel good for a while.  We're staying away.
author: Larry M.

description: Food here was pretty yummy. Not the biggest portions but was tasty. What it lacked in quantity, it made up for in the right amount of flavor. It's a hole in the walk place but it's great. Parking is good if you go there late. For Thai food it's not bad but then again it wasn't ALL that either. Good place to try if you're sick of eating king of Thai in that neighborhood.
author: Allan T.

description: Great taste even with vegetarian.  Portion sizes are good. I have no complaints.  Worth the trip.  Lucky we were able to grab a seat because it's so tight in there.
author: Tezhan N.

description: Very cute small place with a nice neighborhood feel. Definitely good for a date. The curry we got was really spicy and awesome!
author: K A.

description: I know it may seem like I'm being over-effusive in my reviews and blowing my "cred," but it's only because I'm hitting my favorite places first, and this is another doozy.  A tiny little hole in the wall that's the size of a comfortable living room, but nicely decorated and the food is just out of this world.  Hands down the best Thai I've ever had, and I've gotten to be quite a fan of Thai food after an unfortunate peanut sauce episode some years ago that put me off of it for a while.  The house specials and daily specials are worth extra attention, but there is no shortage of super-delish food on the menu here.  Yum!
author: Michael T.

description: Perfectly serviceable, but unspectacular.  Both the Pad Se Ew and the yellow curry were slightly inferior to King of Thai--they both utilized fresher ingredients, yet were less flavorful.  The wait staff was fine, as were the prices.  Overall, the experience wasn't noteworthy.
author: Ray L.

description: I ordered 3 dishes. They need to improve the chicken and duck they add in to their meals. The quality of the meat was not good. Chicken tasted heavy. Pork in the curry had heavy skin and was not edible for the most part. Interesting enough excluding the quality of the meat the food was OK.
author: bora o.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to try this place after finding it on Yelp. It is a cute restaurant that seats about 30 people. Lots of street parking available. We walked in on a Friday night and was advised that the wait would be 15-20 mins (not bad!). After we ordered, we had to wait another 15mins or so for our food to come. This was expected after reading the reviews. Plus, it's a small kitchen.

We ordered:
- chicken satay with peanut sauce (a generous appetizer for two)
- yellow curry with chicken, potatoes and onions (delicious with a mild spice to it)
- Thai time fried rice (has actual prawns, not little shrimp in it! The calamari is good too)
- Thai iced tea (they don't put in too much ice, so you get more Thai tea!)

I like how they offer brown rice as an alternative to white or fried rice. I'll have to order some next time I'm there. I'd definitely recommend this place!
author: Eina L.

description: 4.5 stars. Been to this place many times and I still think it's one of the better Thai places in town (and there is another good one, Tawans, close by too). Small and cozy and food generally seems pretty fresh. The portions are smaller than you might find at other places, but overall I think this is a good thing. Every once in a while certain dishes have come out a little bland, but overall good solid flavors. Would highly recommend the kao soy noodle curry which as another reviewer said is pretty authentic and is not a typical menu item.
author: frontpack e.

description: This is the first time I have ever given out a one star rating. I went  twice (both times take out), once with my roommate, and then next day as well (he rated two stars as his was a bit more flavorful). I live a few blocks away and got a call  as soon as I got in the door from picking up food on my second visit only to find the phone ringing from the restaurant informing me that they had given me the wrong order. I had to go back, which is understandable, but, they never apologized, said sorry for the  inconvenience or really any verbal acknowledgment what so ever!. Not even an utterance!  Even on the phone they really said just  that my order  was  still at the restaurant and that I had to return if I wanted my original food.  (Me, I would have apologized to the guest several times, and offered to deliver it, as it was the restaurant mistake).Upon returning,they just handed me a bag and I turned around and I left.  This is ok. Stuff happens. But for a second time in a row, the food was dry, had  little if any flavor and was cold, and the portions are somewhat small. The Pad Keow Mow noodles were sparse, and had no flavor. I was surprised as the reviews are all pretty good. There are so many other better places to go around this area, so think about  going to the others first. If this was just a one time occurrence I could excuse it. But it wasn't. Two times in a row? Come on, at least fake it!  So, this was my two-time experience at this  establishment. Maybe it is better to dine in? But, upon looking around the second time I went back, I have concerns about cleanliness. I worked restaurants through college and know that if the front isn't kept "tidy" and  neat/clean then  you really need to rethink what the back is like. They were both bad experiences, and I will not return. Sorry to have to write a one star review, but hopefully this is only one will have to opine upon! (No, I didn't have to  get that one from my thesaurus Ben!).
author: Jeff V.

description: anytime someone is looking for good Thai in the Richmond, I direct them here. great flavors and great prices. the restaurant is full of character and service has always been attentive. the delivery is great, too!
author: Roman H.

description: I don't eat Thai too often, so I don't have a lot for comparison, but Thai Time is a winner.  The woman who took my order was very nice (let us tweak one of the orders, reminded me when I forgot rice), and the food was delivered quickly.  The Pad Thai was solid, if a bit noodle heavy, and the curry (spicy red) was fantastic.  The heat was definitely there, but it in no way overpowered the rest of the flavors.  We will definitely be going back for future meals.
author: Andrew B.

description: Cool little place for a Sunday lunch. Small, cozy, friendly service. Green veggie curry was tasty and with nice spice. Pad kee mow was rather bland". Restaurant cleanliness was marginal, but adds to the "dive" effect. Salmon curry is also delish.
author: Rebecca P.

description: Thai is kinda like Mexican in that it's permutations and combinations of lots of the same stuff.  What sets this restaurant apart is the *flavors*, yum!  Everything just tastes BETTER here, and because it's small and intimate, there's usually no slow service.
author: Deb T.

description: The only reason I'm not giving Thai Time a five-star review is that try as I might, I can't seem to convince them that when I say I want spicy, I don't mean "American spicy." I mean, I still want to be able to feel my lips, but I'm not afraid to go for the burn! Be that as it may, I've tried about half the menu by now and have never had a bad meal. The mango salad, with its layers of sweet/savory/spicy, is exquisite -- one of my favorite dishes at any restaurant anywhere in SF.
author: Fawn F.

description: Other than the overwhelming food smell stuck to our clothes and some slow service, this place is good. Reasonable prices, good sized portions and delicious food. The place is tiny though, only fitting about 8 or so tables, which probably helps seal the food smell to the body as there's no where else for it to go. I love food, but I hate it when food smell sticks and clings to me and I can feel it coming out my pores. I'm going to have to try delivery next time.
author: n m.

description:
food: 4
service: 4
atmosphere: 4

solid 4 stars. good food (on the sweet and not so spicy side). it's cute and cozy. remember the cozy part.

everything was great, but tonight's particular check had some addition problems-- in our favor. we left the right amount + tip on the right amount, but still... (shrug)? and for the (pre-discounted) price this was really yumm
author: Miss C.

description: I tried this place after reading all the yelp reviews and I would have to say this place is mediocre. I ordered the green curry, pad thai and the coconut soup. I thought the green curry was on the watery side with absolutely no zing or kick to it, quite bland I must say. I had to overdose on the thai chilies to get any flavor. The pad thai was so so, no bean sprouts but cabbage instead and skimpy on the shrimps (3). The soup was the only thing that dazzled my palate. Not enough good things to go back again.
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
My FAVORITE restaurant in the Bay Area!  The atmosphere alone gets me excited about this restaurant.  As soon as you open that door, it's like you have walked in the chef's personal dinning room.  Very welcoming.  You feel like a guest as oppose to a customer.  

  Have you ever been invited to another friend's place that is different from your culture, and they are willing to teach you their culture because you're just so curious?  Well, that's the wait staff  at Thai Time.  The BEST service you will ever get from an Asian restaurant.  

  You can taste the FRESH ingredients in each dish!  In other words, you can't expect your dish in 10 minutes.  That wouldn't be fresh, or the best food!  They serve a chef's home cooked meal.  

  The food, service, and setting gives Thai Time that unique intimacy that most restaurants lack.  If you haven't been here, I encourage you to try it!  And when you do, you will realize that you have just found San Francisco's hidden treasure.
author: EL A.

description: decent thai at fair prices in a tiny place with friendly people. not much more to say about that.
author: Will R.

description:
There's no doubt that my personal favorite Thai food in San Francisco is at Bangkok 16. It's in my neighborhood, I've known the owner for a long time, and there's plenty more I could say about it.

BUT, looking a little further a field and thinking about Thai food all around San Francisco, there are only a few other restaurants that ever come to my mind to visit. One of them, perhaps the top of the list, has to be Thai Time: 315 8th Avenue, between Clement and Geary Blvd. It's one of those small, family-run places that specialize in good service and great food.

Take the fish cakes for example. To begin with, the cakes are at least 1/3 larger than what you'll see in most places. And, they're thicker than most you'll see as well. The texture is perfect with just a slight chewy-ness, but crisp on the outside. The flavor is next to none with just a bit more than a hint of seafood flavor, basil, and spices. The cucumber sauce that goes with it has just a little sweetness with medium-sized diced vegetables. You won't find a better tad mun in San Francisco! Besides the fish cakes, their Thai egg rolls are flavorful and packed with vegetables and come with a delicious, slightly peppery sauce. The chicken sauté is tender with no skin or fat, and it comes with what my wife insists is the finest peanut sauce of any Thai restaurant in the city.
 
For the soup, we had a coconut milk soup with chicken and vegetables. We asked for it hot, and it came hot. REAL hot! In my book, that's the way it should be. When a person asks for hot, that's what they should get, and too often restaurants today are afraid to serve anything really hot.

 
Main dishes are equally good, although they are relatively typical of what you will find in other Thai restaurants in the city. We had a noodle dish with vegetables and chicken, beef with more of that luscious peanut sauce, duck with a curry sauce and lots of vegetables, and pineapple fried rice. The pineapple rice was the hit of the evening for me with the slightly tart pineapple completely breaking through any potentially oiliness of a fried rice dish.

 

We were all so stuffed that desert just wasn't an option on this visit. Maybe next time, and there will certainly be a next time.

 

Good, flavorful, and plentiful food is hard to beat. You'll get all of this with plenty of beverage selection at Thai Time. Try it soon, and I don't think you'll be disappointed.
author: Chris G.

description:
Best Pad Thai I've ever had. Ever. (Extra coconuty.) 

I love Thai time. There's a ton of Thai restaurants right around that area, but unless it's a Monday night (when Thai time is closed), I wouldn't dream of going anywhere else...
author: Kimberly D.

description: Got  a basic Pad Thai and spring rolls, just expecting a simple, basic level Pad Thai (i'm not too hard to please).  The problem is, I really didn't get it.  The spring rolls were fantastic, but the Pad Thai left a little to be desired.  Wasn't a fan of the meat and the general flavor was off.  Also, the delivery was made without any napkins or a fork (kinda basics, you'd think).  Also, no menu was included should I want to order something different next time.   Not overly impressed by any means, but who knows, it could have been an off night.
author: Eric L.

description: Authentic, cozy, vegetarian-friendly place with non-greasy, excellent thai food.  Service is fantastic too.  This place is a gem.  Their green papaya salad is one of the best I've ever had.
author: mazzy r.

description:
Since we moved to SOMA we really missed this great place! love the coziness and family feel....Excellent food and prices, we will do a special trip for our Thai Time food fix.

Love the chicken satay, MUST HAVE the pineapple rice (HEAVEN) we always order the fish...yummy!

Staff is absolutely extremely nice...feel like family....

Been trying to get them to open in SOMA / Mission Bay....we need you!
author: Liz D.

description: yummy yummy yummy I've been back many times and this Thai restaurant has not failed in serving great food.
author: Eh V.

description: Definitely sticks out among the plethora of Thai restaurants in the Richmond. their food is always good, fresh, and served quickly. I went with a group of friends the other day and no one was disappointed- on the contrary, we were all impressed by the general deliciousness. haven't tried the delivery, but am very excited for that :) even though its three blocks away from my house.
author: Sandra L.

description: eat local!  this place has fantastic food and generous take-out portions.   lots of veggie options and you can ask for dishes without fish sauce.
author: Heather C.

description: This is one of my favorite Thai restaurants in San Francisco, and it just so happens to be in my 'hood. It's a cozy little hole in the wall run by a friendly family. Thai Time has in my opinion SF's best Pad Prik King (string beans and tofu), and my boyfriend claims they have the best Spicy Noodles with Shrimp. The service has always been very friendly and attentive. The price is right and the atmosphere is quaint and cozy. Thai Time is Clement Street's best-kept secret.
author: Penny D.

description: We went on the Tuesday and we were the only ones in the restaurant.  We had tom yum gai soup and pad thai.  The soup was good, not the best but definitely pretty good.  The pad thai was a little different, didn't have much flavor or spice.  I liked the presentation of both dishes, the soup can with a sterno under it so it was nice and warm and the pad thai looked better than it tasted.  The staff was really nice and I'm sure they have some really good dishes, but what we got was not that great.  I would try it again if i was nearby, but there are better places in other neighborhoods.
author: Brian L.

description:
I've walked near this place soooo many times, but I'm glad I finally tried it. 

The green salmon (salmon in green curry sauce) was a surprise; most Thai places don't serve salmon in curry; this one was excellent. I'd say it's the second-best green curry I've had.

The pad thai was above average. My wife thought it was a bit too sweet. I still liked it. 

And the pad ma keur (Japanese eggplant with tofu and veggies) was a tad oily but overall pretty good.

Bonus: they serve brown rice! Very few Thai places do this, so I was happy! And the prices are too cheap. They need to raise their prices, but I hope they don't.
author: William S.

description: How did I miss this place?  I work around the corner.  I've been here four times now in less than two weeks.  Their Tom kha gai is the best I've ever had!  I'm eating the pad thai right now and it's super yummy too.  Smiling, friendly waitresses greet me every time.  They've won me over from King of Thai.
author: Nisaa K.

description: Don't get their MEAT curries, it's low quality meat. They cooked/boiled it so fast that the meat didn't soak in the flavor of the curries, so the meat have a separate taste. You can get better MEAT curries from King of Thai on 8th ave. Stir fried MEAT dishes are decent since they soak in the flavor readily. Their vegetables dishes are good. Sorry but I wont be coming back since there are other better Thai restaurants.
author: Robert S.

description:
I ordered for delivery.
Everything arrived promptly, with a great presentation and every bite was really delicious!
Very, very pleased.
author: Barbra V.

description: Really good and flavorful thai food at a hole-in-the-wall place.  But don't worry, it's not cold or dirty inside, just very small!  They have some inventive dishes here, but still with all the typical thai dishes also.
author: farmta s.

description: this place is really cute, it feels like youre walking into someones house. someones house with delicious thai food. i got the pad see ew, and it was great. the service was friendly, and it really feels like a neighborhood gem, i like that theyre small it feels quaint and like a secret. but now you know..so you should go and taste the deliciousness
author: Sandi V.

description: really great thai place. one of my favorites in the city.  i love the tom yum soup and pad thai.  it seems less greasy than other places and is just as cheap.  the restaurant is small so there is a wait sometimes.
author: Emily F.

description:
I don't go here simply because I live in the neighborhood.  This place is authentic and delicious.  After living in Thailand for 1/2 year, I can tell you that eating at Thai Time brings me right back to Chiang Mai.

The restaurant is owned by a Thai couple; the wife is from Chiang Mai and so they have some dishes that you will not find in many other Thai restaurants.  I suggest you try the Khao Sawy which is like a curry, except with noodles and chicken in it, too.  It is a northern dish and 99 percent of Thai restaurants do not have it.

Other than that, they do have anything and everything, unless it's something that just can't be found on this side of the globe.  And it's all fantastic.

Now, do I really need to say that I highly recommend Thai Time?  
Doh, it's a no-brainer for the real thing.

Sawatdii Krup!
author: Mr. M.

description: Decided to go here after we saw the wait for Burma Superstar was really long. The Garee puff was really good as was the chicken satay. The pad thai was a little on the sweet side but the cozy neigborhood ambiance and friendly service made it enjoyable. The fried banana with coconut ice cream came in a huge portion and hit the spot.
author: Lauren E.

description: just ordered up some delivery from this spot with a few mixed reviews. ordered just a couple items and was surprised when the delivery girl showed up with a $24 bill - they never gave me a total over the phone. i was expecting more of a cheap eats type spot, but definitely wasn't the case. i wasn't feeling too creative so went with the pad thai, which was very very average.. actually a bit dry. i guess i just wasn't that impressed. overall it was average. nothing more, nothing less.
author: Adam H.

description: The tiniest Thai restaurant I've been to in SF. There are maybe five or six tables at most. Food wasn't that spicy, even though we ordered in Thai. Avoid the Tod Mun (deep-fried fish cakes), they were soggy and bland.
author: M. W.

description: I just finished my second day of leftovers from Thai Time.  They were as good as, or better than, the initial meal.  Yum!  Their Pad See Ew is the best-looking I've seen (and damn tasty too).   Four stars because their vegetarian options could use a bit more variety-- how many ways can a single vegetarian enjoy tofu before shouting, "enough!"?
author: Justin d.

description: Great food! My favorite dish is the pad Thai and my boyfriend loves the green curry.
author: Moe D.

description: I used to go to King of Thai bc of its convenience and pretty good food (at outrageously low prices). But today I just discovered Thai Time just up the street on 8th and Clement, and boy, it was SO GOOD. Specifically, it was FRESH, well-presented, flavors were spot on, and service was great. A tiny place, but the food is what attracts.
author: Miale F.

description: Love the pad thai here! My husband is very fond of the green curry (too spicy for me). Anyway this place is great if you want a little 'hole in the wall' type restaurant. Despite the size it's not usually crowded or noisy. If you're in the area I would highly recommend.
author: Jackie D.

description: Excellent all the way around. Tofu app, 2 entrees, 2 glasses of wine, all under $25. All vegan. All delicious.
author: LJ S.
