description: The curry here is AMAZING with the fried rice and pad thai =) when the sticky rice with mango is in season ...get it. its so goooood. the place is tiny, but doesn't get too crowded and is cheap, good service, etc. great place.
author: Gina F.

description: best thai food in the city. i hope they never get as busy as burma superstar.
author: Pflip W.

description: i happened upon this tiny place by accident.  it looked like it'd be good so we gave it a try.  now, all i had was spring rolls and pad thai, very basic stuff, but something was lacking.  the sauce on the pad thai tasted weird to me.  the spring rolls were good but nothing fantastic.  before we ate, i observed other people's dishes that looked very fresh and tasty.  unfortunately, that wasn't my experience.  the staff was very friendly and it was a cute little place- i had high hopes!  i think i may go back and try something else and see if i like it then.
author: Kate W.

description: From the outside this place looks a little dumpy, but the food is delicious.  It is cheap and tasty
author: Brian K.

description: my fave thai joint in the city, and fortunately for me it's only a couple blocks from where i live.  while from my experiences with food i've ordered and with food others have ordered, this place does some great things and some average things.  it gets 5 stars because my fave dish is done nowhere else this well (and hardly anywhere else) - tofu gra prow krob.  and it's fantastic - creamy, garlicky, basily, fried tofu goodness.  also their spring rolls, tofu satay with fab peanut sauce, and tom ka j are excellent.  plus they do garlic rice, which is a nice treat.  love the place, the ambiance and family-run atmosphere.  i only wish they were open later and on mondays.  but all in all, my fave!
author: Karen O.

description: This is the most amazing thai food retaurant in my opinion.  I drive 20 mins just to come to Thai Time because no where else compares.  The restaurant is very very insanely tiny and the people who work there are very nice.  Im not too adventurous when it comes to thai food so i can only comment on what i have gotten.  Spring rolls are great as well as the chicken satay skewers.  Pad thai was too sweet, but i am not really a fan of pad thai so that didnt matter to me.  The pad se ew and the pad kee mow are absolutely amazing.  But the deal sealer is the curry there.  The most amazing curry i have ever eaten.  Every curry there is amazing.
author: serena t.

description: This is the consummate hole in the wall neighborhood favorite.  Not to be missed!
author: Matthew Y.

description: Delivery was a big disappointment. The chicken pad thai was some of the worst I've ever had, similar to a boxed pad thai from the grocery store. The chicken was all dark meat and a tad slimy. Makes my stomach turn to think about it.  Very sad. The spicy red curry with prawns and pineapple was good but not stellar. Not a 4.5 star meal. In this neighborhood and price range stick with King of Thai Noodle house.
author: Annie L.

description: This is a cute little place with only 5 or 6 tables!! as cute as this place is, the food aint close to how it looks. i went here twice, first time i went the food was quite bland and watery, when it's not suppose to.. common now where are the spices?! its thai food! i went for a second time, trying not to rate on first impression, or maybe it wasnt a good day for the chef, but nope. the food ain't so wonderful. i love thai food, and will not go back to this place.. new authentic thai restaurant here i come!!
author: frances l.

description: Great Thai Food! If your a Richmonder, such as my self, or you are looking for a reasonable, cozy, and impressively delicious date spot you need to go here. Its basically a living room of an old house with only about eight tables and none of them seating more than four people. They play fairly authentic sounding southeastasian music which I appreciate since I hate going to pronpiquity specific restaurants and hearing aesthetically vacous pop music from nonrelated regions. The most impressive thing that any seafood or curry lover MUST have is the seafood coconut curry. I seriously can not stress this enough, its phenominal particularly for the low price of $11. The top of a coconut is lopped of and then the shell is filled with a variety of delicious sea creatures including calamari and the coconut curry. Then artfully arranged on the top of the beheadded coconut is an array of mussels in shell, little crab claws, and prawns. The point is it looks awesome, tastes fantastic, and its freakin cheap. The other menu items are quite good as well and go great wiith a Singha, which I still prefer to Chang, though they seem to be promoting that beer now. Taking home the leftovers is easy too since all of the food is already contained in the coconut.
author: Marc W.

description: Excellent family owned restaurant.  It may be small in space, but the food portion is quite generous.  Went there about twice in the past and it has already become my local thai staple.
author: Jackson C.

description: One of my favorites in the Inner Richmond, and even perhaps in the city. A good selection of good-tasting Thai food for lunch or dinner. Always a good experience.
author: Ty L.

description: This is a small cozyish neighbourhood restaurant. Very small. But they have a nice selection of food at very reasonable prices. My non-vegetarian companions raved about their food choices (green rotee, papaya salad, fish cakes). My vegetarian appetizer, a kind of samosa with sweet potatoes and onions, was awesome. Had to fight off claims from my companions - since I couldn't share their items. Also ordered a japanese eggplant curry. Not as much eggplant as I would have liked but ok. A Thai coffee at the end of the meal was definitely off - the milk was sour or something. Tasted ugh. No one wanted to share this one. But the owners said they hadn't charged for it and who knows, couldn't read the handwriting on the bill, so maybe they hadn't. In any case, would probably give this another chance. My companions say they would go back even if I was not there. In fact, because I would not be there.
author: Rags R.

description: Four stars only because I have only eaten here once...we are doing take out again tonight and I will upgrade or downgrade based on our second experience. I ordered Tofu w/ chilli and basil sauce and it was delicious...better than I have had anywhere in SF. I also really liked their spring rolls. My husband enjoyed his Beef w/ chilli and basil and my two little kids ate up the chicken pad thai. So far so good...
author: Anu Y.

description: Delicious! I think this has got to be the best thai curry in the city by far, the prices are reasonable, the service fast, and the owners friendly. One of my favorite restaurants in sf.
author: Tucker M.

description: a little hole in the wall that serves some tasty thai food. i use the delivery a lot, fast and efficient. i love their pra ram chicken (chicken on steamed vegetables with peanut sauce), pad thai, and thai time fried rice. yum  yummy. i dont know about their thai ice tea though. i think it's too sweet, or it tastes like it came from a can or something. dont know.
author: Orange B.
